title: NEAL delivers reliability, efficiency, and more value for Aboriginal communities with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: In addition to the limitations of an older technology stack, NEAL was struggling with increasingly outdated and inefficient work practices. Working with IT partner Calibre One, NEAL moved to Microsoft 365 and adopted a digital phone system based on Microsoft Teams. In addition to unlocking a reliable solution for mobile and remote work, the productivity tools are helping the nonprofit find new opportunities for collaboration, communication, and improved workflows. Aside from these leaps in connectivity, productivity, and resiliency to disruption, NEAL is better able to connect with and serve its own indigenous communities.
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, SharePoint Online

title: St. Luke’s University Health Network prescribes proactive, unified protection with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: St. Luke’s University Health Network practices data security the way it practices medicine—it constantly drives improvement with a future-oriented approach. Its growing network of hospitals and hundreds of St. Luke’s Physician Group practices might present a security challenge, but the St. Luke’s IT security team has a remedy ready. It uses Microsoft Security solutions for a unified strategy that reduces the vendor footprint, lowers costs, and continually sharpens data security.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Innovative cloud technology consultancy LAB3 chooses Microsoft Security platform for itself and its customers
executive_summary: Trusted IT consultant and Microsoft Gold partner LAB3 specializes in cloud-forward IT solutions for enterprise and government clients. So it makes sense that its own infrastructure can serve as an example for customers looking for their own state of the art security and compliance solution. LAB3 chose technology from Microsoft Security, protecting its internal production and development networks with Microsoft Defender extended detection and response tools, and including orchestrated organization-wide security information and event management (SIEM) from Microsoft Sentinel.
products: Azure Monitor, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for IoT, Microsoft Purview Information Protection, Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management, Microsoft Sentinel

title: The City of Zagreb facilitates kindergarten enrollment and management with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Home to more than one million people, the City of Zagreb prides itself on being one of Croatia’s most forward-thinking, socially responsible cities. As part of its commitment to a sustainable, inclusive future, the city recently embarked on a number of digitalization projects. Among them, reimagining the decentralized, on-premises infrastructure behind the city’s kindergartens. Thanks to its new Microsoft Azure-based system, enrolling children in kindergartens around the city is easier than ever, while budgeting and reporting are faster, simpler and more transparent.
products: Azure

title: Global almond supplier engages with AgreeYa to drive digital transformation
executive_summary: Based in California, Blue Diamond Growers (BDG) began an enterprise-wide digital transformation initiative to achieve business agility. To this end, Microsoft Gold partner AgreeYa delivered end-to-end digital transformation services to help BDG reach its goals. Services included designing a modern employee intranet to boost collaboration; seamlessly migrating content from multiple systems; building apps and process flows to enhance efficiency; implementing Project Online to improve project management; and delivering Teams training to fast-track adoption.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online, Project

title: Non-stop cloud migration: EAM moves 80 applications to the Azure cloud within six months
executive_summary: EAM is the regional energy partner for around 1.4 million people in large parts of Hesse, southern Lower Saxony and parts of North Rhine-Westphalia, Thuringia and Rhineland-Palatinate. As a 100 percent municipal company, EAM ensures a secure energy supply, develops future solutions for its customers and shapes the energy transition in the region in partnership with a consistent sustainable approach. In order to successfully drive its business models forward in the future, the company is the first energy provider to entrust its complete technical and commercial system landscape to Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Azure Advisor, Dynamics 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender, Power BI

title: Invitalia implements secure cloud-first strategy with Check Point and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Invitalia is Italy’s national agency responsible for inward investment and economic development across the country. To effectively support its growth and emerging infrastructure needs, Invitalia implemented Microsoft Azure and tapped Check Point Software Technologies to secure the cloud environment. This enabled Invitalia to expand as quickly as needed, especially during Italy’s COVID-19 peak, and enhanced infrastructure protection from Check Point CloudGuard Network Security allowed Invitalia to adopt additional cloud resources with confidence.
products: Azure

title: PROTORIA modernizes its IT infrastructure with Microsoft Azure and the guidance of Cloud Services
executive_summary: PROTORIA, the retail service provider for Samsung in Ukraine, wanted to update its long-term strategy with cloud adoption plans. Cloud Services served as PROTORIA’s trusted advisor and migration partner in this endeavor. What began with a workshop grew to a three-year collaboration involving migrating PROTORIA’s infrastructure to Microsoft Azure. Now PROTORIA uses Azure, Office 365, and Microsoft Power BI every day and saves about 20 percent each year on costs.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Lobyco joins the Microsoft Partner Program to help its new customer loyalty solution reach the world
executive_summary: Independent software vendor (ISV) Lobyco was initially part of Danish retailer Coop, created to bring its outdated customer loyalty program into the future. Recognizing the potential of the innovative digital customer engagement platform, Coop spun off Lobyco, freeing the new organization to bring its solution to the broader retail industry. Lobyco chose to work with the Microsoft Partner Program for ISVs to develop the skills it needed to reach a global community of customers ready for a digital loyalty program transformation.
products: Azure

title: Accela uses Microsoft Azure to help build and deliver its suite of modern, digital government services solutions
executive_summary: Government agencies seeking to increase efficiency, save costs, and provide even better customer citizen service turn to digital government service provider Accela for its open, extensible, Microsoft Azure–based software as a service (SaaS) platform. The solution provides out-of-the-box improvements to customer interfaces and enhanced, modernized workflows that speed internal government processes. Citizens gain simpler, more efficient access, while government agencies can provide those improved experiences without additional investments in IT infrastructure.
products: Azure, Azure Disk Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft 365

title: Sri Lankan conglomerate Sunshine Holdings drives sales and workforce output with Azure
executive_summary: Sri Lankan conglomerate Sunshine Holdings, as part of its digital transformation initiative, implemented Microsoft Azure in early 2021. The company’s IT team of around 10 employees handled the cloud migration and deployment in-house for its more than 2,500 workforce, using skills acquired through Microsoft’s Enterprise Skills Initiative (ESI). Sunshine Holdings now enjoys greater access to unified data, which informs business decision-making.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Visterra uses KAISPE Purchase Requisition and the Microsoft Power Platform to automate procurement and boost productivity by 40 percent
executive_summary: Visterra Inc., a clinical stage biotechnology company, wanted to replace cumbersome manual processes with automation for day-to-day procurement and service requisitions. Stephen Torra, Director Enterprise Systems, Visterra, engaged KAISPE LLC, a Microsoft partner that provides efficient solutions and services to enterprise customers. In the initial discovery phase, Torra realized KAISPE possessed the experience and technology to rapidly solve his problems. With minor customizations, KAISPE deployed its Purchase Requisition solution, built on the Microsoft Power Platform, in just three days, resulting in a 40-percent increase in employee productivity.
products: Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power Automate, SharePoint Online

title: Property inspection service helps customers and employees feel right at home with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: There are few life events as big and disruptive as moving. Whether a move involves buying or renting a house or an apartment, Green Kite strives to make the process as easy as possible for agents, buyers, and tenants. Green Kite performs property inventory inspections and provides detailed, impartial inventory reports to document a property’s condition when a tenant moves in. The company also offers professional home cleaning and decorating services through another business arm called Agent’s Army.

title: Quorum bases its Cyber One solution on Microsoft Sentinel, easing and lifting security for customers like CountPlus
executive_summary: Managed security service provider Quorum Systems gets the crunch its small- and medium-sized business (SMB) customers face: competing with enterprise companies means finding enterprise-level tools on a small business budget, and their emphasis needs to be on supporting a company vision, not IT security. Case in point is leading Australian accounting network CountPlus, which needed outside experts to handle cyber security. That’s why Quorum created its Cyber One portal, a streamlined way for its SMB customers to stay on top of security affordably. Based on Microsoft Sentinel, the solution also uses Microsoft security intelligence to make supporting those customers easier—a win for everyone.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for Identity, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Delivering improvements through a ‘cloud first’ strategy at London Borough of Waltham Forest
executive_summary: “There are good technical reasons for choosing Microsoft Azure – and it was the smallest jump for us technically – but, for me, it was how Microsoft had changed and what it was most focused on that was most important. We want choice and we want a partner who listens and is focused on what we need and on the people we support,” says Paul Neville, Director of Digital & ICT, London Borough of Waltham Forest.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Windows 10

title: Romanian university in central Transylvania makes student-lecturer collaboration easier with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Established in 1945, the University of Medicine, Pharmacy, Science, and Technology of Târgu Mureș (UMFST) is one of the most dynamic comprehensive universities in Romania. UMFST’s forward-looking leadership team had already begun its digital transformation, but COVID-19 accelerated the process. The university quickly shifted to online learning through Microsoft 365. Along the way, UMSFT reduced thesis submission times, sped up academic feedback by more than 75 percent, streamlined graduation certificate issuance, and unified financial aid processing.

products: Forms, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate, Outlook, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Babeș-Bolyai University turns to cloud-based solutions to empower its faculty for online education
executive_summary: A descendant of the Major Jesuit College in Cluj that was founded 500 years ago in Cluj-Napoca, Romania, Babeș-Bolyai University (UBB) aims to promote and sustain an innovative learning culture. To fulfill its mission in today’s world, it needed a new digital infrastructure for its students, professors, and staff. UBB adopted Microsoft 365 to offer unified, easily accessible, and more secure digital tools for communication, collaboration, and storage. To achieve a single-sign-on system for Microsoft 365 and its in-house platforms, UBB is using Microsoft Azure Active Directory.
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID

title: SoftBank Corp. cuts monthly processing time in half after smooth transition to SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems handle information that is mission critical and highly confidential. At one time, it was thought unsuited to public clouds. Now, however, as familiarity with cloud services dramatically increases, users take advantage of real-time data processing and analysis to respond flexibly to a dramatically and relentlessly changing business environment. SoftBank Corp. (“SoftBank”) has long pursued innovation. In 2020, it migrated its SAP ERP environment to SAP on Microsoft Azure. SoftBank gained a platform that can respond more flexibly to sharp increases in data as the company grows.

title: Goodfood Market serves up fast growth with Dynamics 365 as key ingredient
executive_summary: Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Montreal, Quebec, Goodfood Market has grown to a company that gathers more than CAD100 million in quarterly revenues from delivering meal kits and grocery items to customers across Canada. The company needed a solution that could handle the growing complexity of managing its supply chain and scale with the company. Thanks to Microsoft Dynamics 365, the company served its exploding customer base during COVID-19 while nearly doubling its topline performance.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Microsoft Investigator Fellow Dr. Travis Osterman uses Azure to support lung cancer treatment protocols
executive_summary: Travis Osterman, D.O., and his colleagues at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nashville are using the power of Microsoft Azure to support the development of new treatment protocols for lung cancer. Dr. Osterman focuses on applying clinical informatics methods across the cancer care continuum. Informatics—which includes the use of computational systems for data storage and retrieval—focuses on improving access to health information and protecting patient privacy. Dr. Osterman and his team are also the first research group at Vanderbilt University Medical Center to use a new enterprise data warehouse in Azure.
customer: Dr. Travis Osterman - Microsoft Investigator Fellow
products: Azure, Azure Cloud Services

title: Microsoft Surface for hybrid working spurs digital transformation
executive_summary: London Metropolitan University has a rich history with strong educational roots dating back to 1848. The University as we know it today was created in 2002 by the merging of London Guildhall University and the University of North London. Across its two London campuses, London Met delivers high-quality higher education to more than 9,000 students. Like many institutions during the pandemic, it responded quickly to enable business as usual through the early days. However, as it became clear that a ‘new normal’ of hybrid working and teaching was emerging, the university’s IT team sought to take a more strategic and transformational approach.
products: Azure, Azure Lab Services, Microsoft 365, Forms, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Surface, Surface Go

title: T-Mobile uses RPA in Power Automate to integrate systems during Sprint merger
executive_summary: During its merger, T-Mobile needed to integrate its Orbit app with Sprint’s legacy back-end system. It was experiencing challenges that could not be solved with legacy APIs: data latency, time-consuming manual processes, and data entry errors. T-Mobile turned to the robotic process automation capabilities in Power Automate to help the two systems operate as one.

As part of a broad digitization strategy, Rabobank adopted Power Platform to streamline internal processes and today runs more than 2,500 Power Apps and Power Automate solutions. Power Platform was recently chosen as the default platform for all internal application and business process automation development.

ASI’s flagship product, the technology platform ESP®, manages the industry’s supply and marketing chain. Additionally, their servers host 15,000 websites for promo companies.

Paired with Microsoft Sentinel as COFCO International’s cloud-based SIEM/SOAR solution, the solution has already proven effective in proactively securing the company’s production environment.

title: Retraining to gain the skills of the future with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: “Microsoft has just been in my life for as long as I can remember,” says Gemma Robson, former Northumbria University student and winner of this year’s National Azure Championship. “It’s very exciting. My life has completely changed.” It’s estimated that eighty-two percent of UK roles require digital skills. Microsoft accreditations and training programmes and initiatives like the Microsoft Azure Championship have an important role to play in efforts to meet the huge challenge to ensure the UK workforce has the skills it needs to drive national competitiveness.

Luckily, Direct Line was already exploring how to support its staff with flexible working practices, so it was able to quickly accelerate its existing best practices – which leveraged Microsoft Surface Go 2 devices and a suite of Microsoft 365 tools, including Microsoft Teams.

Many lenders focus on simple income and record of employment profiles to determine lending criteria for new customers. Instead of penalizing loan applicants who don’t meet all the traditional criteria, Kensington considers more complex income circumstances that mainstream lenders don’t typically accommodate.

title: TomTom maps out a path to fast innovation with Linux on Azure

Amsterdam-based TomTom pioneered many of the inventions that underpin the location technology in the maps and other tools that get us where we need to go. Its engineers appreciate Linux, a powerful open-source operating system, and use it to support their development of complex software. TomTom moved to the Microsoft Azure platform to gain the benefits of cloud computing: scalability and availability along with flexible cost models to maximize cost-effectiveness. The company found it fast and easy to shift its Linux workloads from its on-premises infrastructure to Azure. TomTom is freer than ever to set the pace for innovation, and leading innovation means leading in market sha

title: Bosch delivers supply chain efficiencies using Java on Azure
executive_summary: Technical Story

New Azure services are released regularly, and existing Azure services are expanded with security features that contribute to safer and better services for organizations like VECOZO. This inherent dynamism adds to the security of the Azure platform as security services routinely change and their configurations are regularly updated.

In addition to quality of care, ETZ is enjoying tighter and more productive scheduling outcomes that benefit clinicians and patients alike and ease the burden on necessary physical consultations.

title: VillageMD powers technological transformation of legal operations with Microsoft services
executive_summary: In the midst of COVID-19, Nationwide experienced a radical shift in how and where associates got work done. Today, the company continues to embrace change by finding new ways to bring their people-fTo modernize healthcare and achieve its patient care goals, VillageMD needed to modernize internal operations as well. The company had its eye on streamlining cumbersome legal processes. VillageMD adopted and adapted Microsoft SharePoint, Lists, and Power BI to optimize and automate day-to-day actions, free up its lawyers’ time to focus more on patient goals, and operate at the top of its license. Through a suite of Microsoft services, the company customized a solution, tailored to its operations and flexible enough to scale and evolve with the organization.ocused mission to a hybrid work scenario. It’s a big change, and Microsoft 365 tools are at the heart of how Nationwide delivers the future of work. A hybrid strategy continues the organization’s culture of care in a digital world for the 25,000 Nationwide associates experiencing the future of work firsthand.

The water company chose to switch to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service, including Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service Insights with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service Professional. The improved view of the customer and the ease of use are helping the Wessex Water team to enhance the service it delivers to customers.

To achieve this single ‘golden view’ of each customer, Taylor Wimpey chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 as its business platform. Today, the business is already benefitting from the improved information sharing and visibility. Most importantly, Taylor Wimpey teams are using the information to enhance the experience for customers.

executive_summary: By embracing a cloud-first environment, the Catholic District School Board of Eastern Ontario (CDSBEO) has become a leader in education technology. With a comprehensive combination of Microsoft 365, Azure security offerings, Microsoft Teams, and Windows 10, CDSBEO responded with agility to an unpredictable situation by providing staff, students, and families with effective tools to maximize flexibility and inclusive engagement.

Conscious change management, supported by both sides, contributed significantly to the success of the project. Key users from the various departments ensured that this was not just an IT project, but one in which all stakeholders were consulted and involved. They are the multipliers who will continue to enthusiastically support the changes internally in the future.

Aiming at sustainable growth, LiquidSOL recently restructured its processes, including implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365. Yet in the logistics and construction sector, no high-quality purchasable address material exists. This is where HitHorizons came into play.

executive_summary: Speedy Hire Plc is the UK’s largest hire provider, with the widest range of tools, plant, and specialist equipment. It serves more than 46,000 businesses with safe, reliable hire equipment and services to enable the successful delivery of customer projects. With over 3,500 product lines, it offers everything from everyday tools and equipment – such as hammer drills, reciprocating saws – to specialist assets, such as for lifting or powered access. From over 200 locations, its team of 3,700 colleagues deliver excellent customer service, including an unmatched nationwide four-hour delivery promise. “That quality support is what our customers expect – and rely on,” states Speedy Chief Operating Officer, Dan Evans.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Office 365

title: Microsoft Surface for hybrid working spurs digital transformation
executive_summary: London Metropolitan University has a rich history with strong educational roots dating back to 1848. The University as we know it today was created in 2002 by the merging of London Guildhall University and the University of North London. Across its two London campuses, London Met delivers high-quality higher education to more than 9,000 students. Like many institutions during the pandemic, it responded quickly to enable business as usual through the early days. However, as it became clear that a ‘new normal’ of hybrid working and teaching was emerging, the university’s IT team sought to take a more strategic and transformational approach.
products: Azure, Azure Lab Services, Microsoft 365, Forms, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Surface, Surface Go

title: Philippines’ Department of Education closes learning gap for young learners using Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: The Department of Education (DepEd) is a learner-centered public institution and the main agency that manages and governs the Philippine basic education system. To drive literacy and close the learning gap, DepEd introduced a free Microsoft Teams tool called Reading Progress during National Reading Month in 2021. The AI-powered solution is helping 23 million learners and 950,000 teachers in the Philippines track fluency, specifically reading accuracy rate, correct words per minute, mispronunciations, omissions, and insertions through analyzing recorded reading sessions in Insights.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: RBL Bank uses Azure to maintain performance through 600% growth in transactions; achieves faster data processing
executive_summary: RBL Bank is one of India’s leading private sector banks with an expanding presence across the country. The bank offers specialized services under five business verticals namely: Corporate & Institutional Banking, Commercial Banking, Branch & Business Banking, Retail Assets and Treasury and Financial Markets Operations. It currently services over 10.66 million customers through a network of 500 branches; 1,424 business correspondent branches (of which 274 banking outlets) and 407 ATMs spread across 28 Indian states and Union Territories. RBL Bank is listed on both NSE and BSE.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Power BI

title: Peace Parks Foundation utilizes technology to protect, restore, and rewild south African ecosystems
executive_summary: Peace Parks Foundation is using cutting-edge technology to achieve conservation at scale. The organization develops and co-manages strategically important parks and projects within transfrontier conservation areas across southern Africa, focusing on ecosystem restoration, environmental protection, and community development. Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power BI enable Peace Parks to secure essential funding more effectively, while AI and IoT solutions allow rangers to scale their park maintenance and wildlife crime prevention work. Centralized data storage through Azure and communications tools like Teams allow for close collaboration of a workforce that is spread across the globe as they execute complex programs, launch rewilding efforts, and manage parks across borders. Through combining back-to-basics conservation methods with advanced technology, Peace Parks is leading the charge to uplift communities and ensure a harmonious, sustainable future for natural ecosystems in southern Africa.

title: Avans University of Applied Sciences turns learning into an interactive experience using Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: Technology is transforming the education sector, increasingly helping teachers around the world to provide better, more interactive learning experiences. Dutch institution Avans Applied Science University is a prime example. Here, a law teacher (with no technical background) has recently created a simulation game designed to train students to handle a bankruptcy case as it would happen in real life. Built using Microsoft Power Platform, the game takes students through various steps of the case. All with the help of a chatbot created using Power Virtual Agents, which interacts with students and asks them legal questions.
products: Azure, Power Automate, Power BI, Microsoft Copilot Studio

executive_summary: The Chief Disruption Officer at Innovation Credit Union chose a transformational, cloud-first solution to the challenge of doubling the size of its business, simplifying members’ lives, and expanding to serve customers nationally. Building on Innovation’s existing investments in Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365, and Microsoft Dynamics 365, the VeriPark solution provides a state-of-the-industry customer experience and a road map to the growth and scale that will drive Innovation’s success.

Lumen selected Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), part of Microsoft Entra, along with a suite of other Microsoft Security solutions to address identity and compliance in a complementary way. Now, the company has ease of use, transparency, and automation in how it protects and manages its data.

executive_summary: Leading information and technology full-services provider Fujitsu wanted to improve the scalability and efficiency of its online presence to advance its brand. To achieve this, it decided to migrate its online presence to Microsoft Azure from hosting in on-premises datacenters.

title: ESPN creates a virtual community for career development with SharePoint spaces
executive_summary: Stefanie Foster, a global security specialist at ESPN, has completed most of the interactive experiences hosted in the ESPN Career Center, an immersive shop for career development. In fact, Foster earned one of ESPN Career Center’s monthly prizes and had the opportunity to have a career coaching session with the president of the NHL’s Arizona Coyotes about leadership development. Foster appreciates the help in achieving her career goals. “Knowing that ESPN is dedicating time, money, and resources to build a career center to help their employees evolve and develop says a lot about our company and how it values employees,” she says.
products: Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, SharePoint, Microsoft Copilot Studio, Power BI

title: Carpetright modernizes for business growth with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: The pandemic and the store closures that came with it for significant periods accelerated the sense of urgency at Carpetright to build up capabilities and agility by modernizing its technology infrastructure. Carpetright ultimately selected Azure VMware Solution for hosting VMware virtual machine environments on Azure while it trained its team. Since adopting Azure VMware Solution, Carpetright now has a more modern and secure infrastructure to help the business grow both organically and through acquisitions.
products: Azure, Azure VMware Solution

title: Support Black Charities bridges data silos to serve better with GiveLife365
executive_summary: Support Black Charities (SBC), a Canadian incorporated nonprofit based in Ontario, is trusteed by CAMDA Sports Foundation Canada and holds an official federal charitable status. Dedicated to uplifting of the black community globally, SBC connects black community-based organizations with supporters in the black community and allies. With operations spread across three different systems, SBC's old process for managing membership was manual, tedious, and time-consuming. SBC worked with GiveLife365 to address data silos and enable the nonprofit through a more consistent, responsive, and efficient approach to constituent communications.
products: Azure, Power Apps, Power BI

title: eClinicalWorks thrives in the cloud with Azure Virtual Machines and Azure Disk Storage
executive_summary: eClinicalWorks is a national innovation leader with cloud-based solutions for electronic health records (EHR), practice management, patient engagement, and population health management. Whether the company is supporting ambulatory practices, specialists, healthcare centers, urgent care facilities, or hospital systems, one thing is certain—more businesses are signing up every day and taking advantage of its comprehensive tools for managing electronic health and medical records. But sustaining a high level of growth demands the appropriate capacity to manage the influx of data and network traffic.
products: Azure, Azure Disk Storage, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Elvia builds a highly secure DevOps platform with Azure infrastructure and network security services
executive_summary: Norwegian energy utility Elvia maintains a power grid network that spans more than 41,000 miles and serves more than 2 million customers. The company set out to build a secure, cloud-first DevOps platform that could meet Norway’s data residency and compliance requirements and scale to perform in a hybrid and multicloud environment. Elvia needed resilient, flexible components to deliver automated services that would help, not hinder, the company’s development of innovative grid network technology. Elvia realized its goal by enhancing its in-house development and data integration capabilities. Using Microsoft Azure DDoS Protection, Azure Web Application Firewall, Azure Bastion, Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) to help build and secure a development platform named Atlas.
products: Azure, Azure Application Gateway, Azure DDoS Protection, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Monitor, Azure Web Application Firewall, Microsoft Entra ID

title: iHeartMedia tops the charts with Azure AD and Microsoft Sentinel, creating simplicity at lower cost
executive_summary: iHeartMedia leads the pack in the “always-on" audio media world. In a space where security is non-negotiable and where employees need immediate and easy access every time—often to industry-specific, custom applications—delivering that balance can be challenging. But when iHeartMedia replaced its identity solution with Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and deployed Microsoft Sentinel, it opened the door to a more streamlined user experience, dramatically lower licensing costs, greater visibility throughout its estate, and other benefits.
products: Microsoft Entra External ID, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Sentinel, Windows Autopilot

title: Empowering staff to manage their wellbeing with Microsoft
executive_summary: AstraZeneca plc is a global, science-led biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines. The British-Swedish multinational pharmaceutical and biotechnology company is headquartered at the Cambridge Biomedical Campus in Cambridge, England and employs over 90,000 people worldwide. “At AstraZeneca our mission is to accelerate the delivery of life-changing medicines,” says Juliette White, VP Global SHE and Operations Sustainability at AstraZeneca. “So it’s no surprise that our priority is to ensure that our people feel healthy, safe and motivated”.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Windows 10, Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Viva Insights

title: Acotel: transforming routers from simple ‘black boxes’ to data gold mines and services platforms
executive_summary: The Internet of Things is transforming the telecommunications sector, allowing operators to gain insights into customer behavior and provide better, more innovative services based on them. Leading ICT Cloud company Acotel is committed to making this potential a reality in both the Italian and international telecoms markets. Using Microsoft Azure IoT, the company has developed a highly scalable edge-to-cloud solution that “mines” and processes data on traditional household routers. By providing that data to operators, it gives them an unparalleled understanding of their customer base and the perceived state of their services – all without introducing additional devices in the customer’s environment. This extraordinary solution, which stands right at the intersection between IoT technology and the telecoms sector, is already being used across over three million routers from different vendors in Italy – with plans to expand it to other countries already in the pipeline.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub

title: More than 1,000 Sanitas employees are already taking advantage of the capabilities of Big Data through the DOC project
executive_summary: Sanitas is committed to the advantages of digital tools to improve the management of people's health and also to increase the efficiency of its employees' work. Since 2019, the company has been conducting research and development activities in the field of applications, aimed at optimizing its processes.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Wüstenrot & Württembergische reduces patching time by 35 percent, leans into hybrid cloud management with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Starting small and extending rapidly, W&W is moving toward an open cloud approach, managing its on-premises workloads and servers in Azure and reducing operational costs and complexity with Azure Arc. With Azure Arc fully part of its infrastructure, W&W enjoys more efficiency and flexibility, and employees have more time for strategic work, among other benefits that cascade down to customers.
products: Azure Automation, Azure Monitor, Azure Policy

title: Blåkläder gears up for expansion with a modern IT platform
executive_summary: Blåkläder is one of Europe's largest manufacturers and retailers of workwear, and it produces around 4.5 million garments annually. The company's enterprise resource planning (ERP) system has played a key role in making Blåkläder a market leader, but it needed a new, modern IT platform to support international growth. For this reason, the clothing manufacturer chose a comprehensive package of Microsoft Dynamics 365 solutions delivered by DXC Technology. The solutions provide Blåkläder with a better understanding of its business, enabling the company to make smarter decisions that put it on the path to even greater global success.
products: Dynamics 365, Power BI

title: The Seattle Housing Authority equips residents with Surface Laptop Go to foster digital equity and accessibility
executive_summary: Knowing digital skills and access to the right technology would make a difference to thousands of residents in their search for jobs, education, and access to healthcare, the Seattle Housing Authority equipped 2,200 households with their own Surface Laptop Go and Microsoft Home and Student 2021. Now with convenient access to digital tools, more than 5,000 residents have greater opportunity to improve their lives.
products: Microsoft Teams, Office 365

title: Groupwide collaboration and knowledge transfer: AGAPLESION introduces Microsoft 365 for hospitals and care facilities
executive_summary: Processes in the healthcare industry are ripe for improvement through digital transformation because patients don’t like sitting around in waiting rooms, and doctors want to view patient data quickly and securely in digital form. To be well positioned for the future, AGAPLESION gAG—Germany’s largest Christian healthcare group—is digitalizing its processes step by step across its more than one hundred facilities, which include hospitals, residential and nursing care facilities, and medical care centers. By rolling out Microsoft 365, AGAPLESION is ensuring seamless collaboration and communication among its employees and enabling more knowledge transfer.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Excel

title: Trail Blazer Tours leverages Microsoft Azure to drive operational efficiency
executive_summary: Trail Blazer Tours India Pvt. Ltd (TBi) is a part of the Katgara group, a travel and tourism industry pioneer. TBi is one of the most trusted destination management companies in India having footprints in 9 offices across India and 9 international offices across globe.
customer: Trail Blazer Tours India Pvt. Ltd
products: Azure

title: How SharePoint and Office2SharePoint are helping Cadeler drive its growing business forward
executive_summary: Danish shipping company Cadeler supports the transport and installation of offshore turbines and foundations that help generate sustainable wind energy. Being on a growth journey, Cadeler needed a stable and secure cloud-based solution for handling important files and documents. It chose Microsoft SharePoint for its flexibility and high level of data security. With Office2SharePoint from iGlobe, it enjoys an optimized SharePoint experience, saving employees time and increasing efficiency in file and record handling.
products: Office 365, SharePoint Online

title: Legal and Tech transform work at Marks and Spencer using Power Apps
executive_summary: “When we started this journey five years ago, most of the legal team’s interactions with tech happened when something broke,” explains Sharon Peters, Head of Technical Programme Management at Marks and Spencer. “Now we’re being considered for the Alliance of the Year at the British Legal Technology Awards. It has been a transformative journey of collaboration and partnership.”
products: Microsoft 365, Forms, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate, SharePoint Online, Power Apps, SharePoint

title: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission uses Microsoft Azure to preserve the state for future generations
executive_summary: In 2019, the Florida state legislature passed HB-5301, also known as the “cloud bill,” mandating that state agencies migrate from on-premises data centers to the cloud for their network infrastructure and telecom communication needs. This meant that the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC) would need to find a cloud partner that could help them modernize while also meeting the information technology needs of an important state entity. With Microsoft Azure providing a platform that enabled them to build scalable websites and web workloads, and drive innovation for existing and future apps, as well as being Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS)-compliant, Microsoft was the right choice.
customer: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission
products: Azure

title: Up onto the roof and into the Azure Cloud: Enpal powers the energy transition with photovoltaic systems
executive_summary: Solar panels on every roof in Germany—that’s Enpal’s vision for the future. To make it a reality, the company relies on closely linked processes throughout its business model. That requires a platform capable of covering all these processes—with maximum flexibility, at low cost, and with as little IT effort as possible. Enpal is then free to focus on what really matters: driving the energy transition forward with renewable energy. In doing so, the company uses various Microsoft Azure services.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Digital Twins, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database, Azure Service Fabric, SQL Server

title: Plus Alpha Consulting, which centralized its system and security management with Azure Arc, and three reasons why it was adopted
executive_summary: Plus Alpha Consulting, a leading “visualization platform” company, aims to provide plus-alpha values (additional values) to its clients’ businesses. The company is in the process of migrating its services to Microsoft Azure as part of the cloud migration trend. While moving its main services to the cloud, the company faced the challenge of how to centralize the operational and security management of the systems running in an environment that is difficult to migrate. For business growth, even existing systems must be secured with the latest security mechanisms. One service that caught their attention was Azure Arc, a service for hybrid/multi-cloud management.
customer: 株式会社プラスアルファ・コンサルティング (Plus Alpha Consulting Co., Ltd.)
products: Azure, Azure Monitor, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel, Windows Server

title: Seguros SURA Latinoamérica to help businesses reduce strategic human resources risk with Microsoft Graph Data Connect
executive_summary: Seguros SURA Latinoamérica set out to address strategic human resources risk, which it defines as the deviations that companies experience in the attraction, engagement, and development of the human resources they need to adequately design and execute their strategies. Microsoft Graph Data Connect gives developers the power to copy specific Microsoft 365 datasets at scale into Azure data stores without having to worry about security. When used in tandem with in-person interviews, metrics from interoffice interactions in Microsoft 365 not only provided a more comprehensive picture of the company’s human resources but also created the basis for a predictive risk assessment model.
products: Azure, Microsoft Graph, Office 365, Power BI

title: FNHA transforms healthcare delivery with Dynamics 365, speeds nursing functions dramatically
executive_summary: The First Nations Health Authority (FNHA) provides community-based services that are primarily focused on health promotion and disease prevention―including but not limited to primary health care, mental health and wellness, and communicable disease control, along with health benefits administration―to more than 200 First Nations communities across British Columbia (BC). These include remote communities that are accessible only by boat or plane. FNHA needed to transform its workflows from pen and paper, spreadsheets, and disparate databases to a consistent, accessible, and automated tracking system for better patient interactions. This unique Canadian health authority built a solution based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Microsoft Power Platform to exchange data across internal and external systems, making some functions dramatically faster.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Exchange Online, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Excel, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Investment innovator Vontobel triples compute capacity using elastic Azure high-performance computing
executive_summary: When COVID-19 emerged in early 2020, global financial markets were hit with unprecedented turmoil and disruption. Vontobel, a global investment firm with Swiss roots that specializes in wealth management, active asset management, and investment solutions, felt the effects acutely. Creating and managing some of the company’s most important financial products requires significant technology resources, and the company’s capabilities were put to the test during the turmoil.
products: Azure, Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets, Linux on Azure

title: Clipchamp teams stay in sync using Microsoft Loop to collaborate across apps for richer insights
executive_summary: The Clipchamp teams at Microsoft have a collective goal. “We want to help everyone tell their stories, no matter who they are or what their experience level is,” says Yolanda Van Kimmenade, Senior Product Designer for Clipchamp at Microsoft. This storytelling got easier with the decision to add Clipchamp, a video-editing tool, to Microsoft 365. Clipchamp team members are responsible for making Clipchamp both a user friendly and tightly connected part of the Microsoft 365 toolset. To accomplish this, Van Kimmenade and her colleagues need to collaborate effortlessly. Enter Microsoft Loop, a co-creation app that works across Microsoft 365 apps and provides dedicated workspaces where teams can stay in sync. “Adopting Microsoft Loop has made it faster and much easier to work together,” says Van Kimmenade. “The things we collaborate on in Loop workspaces become living documents that change over time as team members add to them. It’s a more dynamic and organized way of working.”
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams, Outlook

title: Fending off cyberattacks: NORMA Group uses Microsoft Defender and Azure Sentinel to safeguard its global data
executive_summary: NORMA Group develops, manufactures, and sells joining technology for a range of industrial applications worldwide. Within an international network of locations, partners, and customers, the Group is responsible for the security of the data stored on its systems. To perform this important function, NORMA Group established its own security operations center, staffed by experts who monitor and process security alerts and, in emergencies, defend against cyberattacks. To ensure they have everything they need to respond quickly and fend off attacks, NORMA Group uses Microsoft Defender and Azure Sentinel.
products: Microsoft Sentinel

title: CWS International moves to the cloud, increasing agility and flexibility with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: From hygiene solutions in company washrooms to bed linens and uniforms at hospitals and beyond, many of the goods and services fundamental to facilities go largely unnoticed by the consumer. Companies like CWS provide not just these goods, but a holistic package of services to keep buildings running across the world.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Animal Supply Company modernizes invoice processing with Neudesic’s Document Intelligence Platform, powered by Microsoft analytics and AI
executive_summary: Animal Supply Company (ASC), a leading wholesale pet product distributor, transformed its invoicing process with data and AI solutions from Neudesic, a 20-year Microsoft partner. ASC’s manual systems were occupying valuable employees with tedious work. After transitioning to Microsoft Azure, the team decided to accelerate its business transformation by processing invoices through the Document Intelligence Platform (DIP), powered by analytics and AI from Azure. Just 12 months in, ASC has already exceeded the return on investment with help from Neudesic. Now, ASC is looking to bring automation to its largest distribution centers.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 AI

executive_summary: Waseda University was established as Tokyo Senmon Gakko in 1882 and will be celebrating its one hundred fiftieth anniversary in 2032. The university formulated the “Waseda Vision 150” midterm plan for its anniversary in 2012 and is working on various reforms, including:
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Monitor, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Desktop, Azure portal, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate

title: Royal Mosa reduces carbon footprint and enhances performance with centralized, cloud-native management through Azure Arc–enabled Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Rooted on the banks of the River Meuse from which it derives its name, Royal Mosa has been steadily and sustainably connecting people, places, and natural resources in the production of beautifully made ceramic tiles for the past 140 years. Operating in the same location in Maastricht, Netherlands, in the heart of Europe, Mosa strives to work harmoniously with local resources and businesses to create a truly unique ceramic tile manufacturing facility.
products: Azure Blob Storage, Azure Policy, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Sentinel

executive_summary: Willis Towers Watson (WTW) is a global advisory, broking, and solutions company that provides data-driven solutions in the areas of people, risk, and capital. WTW wanted to update its LoyaltyAdvisor platform, which enables WTW to manage loyalty program data and analyze point redemption for its global clients. WTW equipped its team with a deeply interoperable and intuitive platform through a Microsoft Azure solution that includes Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2, and Azure Databricks. As a result, WTW has accelerated its agility and innovation and boosted employee productivity. And thanks to the collaboration between WTW and Microsoft, WTW was able to provide a seamless transition to the new Azure-based platform without interruption to its clients.

title: Dell Technologies boosts culture and eNPS scores by using Microsoft 365 to modernize work for its global employees
executive_summary: Even before COVID-19, Dell embraced a more flexible hybrid work environment for team members around the globe. The publishing industry is expanding its domain from sales of paper magazines and comic books to content-centered businesses such as animation, movies, and events amid increasing digitalization and media franchising. In such an environment, Shueisha needed a data analysis platform to assess the "power of works." We asked about Shueisha's efforts to promote "site-centric" data utilization using Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Power BI, and Microsoft Purview.

Volpara’s product suite uses the Microsoft Azure IoT platform as a key building block that enables rapid deployment and reliable operation at scale. Volpara chose Microsoft Security, including Microsoft Defender for IoT and Microsoft Sentinel, to protect Volpara assets and facilitate effective security for Azure IoT solutions at customer sites around the world.
products: Azure, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for IoT, Microsoft Sentinel

executive_summary: As one of the Netherlands’ leading financial institutions, ABN AMRO knows how to make smart, data-driven decisions that maximize value and mitigate risk. The bank uses its expertise to deliver value to its customers, but it also applies its good sense to enhancing its own internal processes. As part of its crucial reporting requirements, the bank had a complicated workflow that depended on a host of on-premises systems, took a few days to complete, and was prone to delays. To gain greater flexibility and control over its reporting processes, ABN AMRO decided to migrate the workflow to the cloud, and it chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud infrastructure platform.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft Sentinel

executive_summary: Founded in 1955, Yusen Logistics (China) Co., Ltd. focuses on international air freight, sea freight, contract logistics, and targeted supply chain solutions. It currently operates in more than 350 cities in 47 countries and regions, with more than 600 distribution centers and offices, and it has nearly 25,000 employees around the world. Yusen Logistics China’s business covers 22 ports and inland cities across the country with 77 logistics distribution points.
products: SAP on Azure, Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Microsoft Excel performs with greater care, speed, and visibility with ADX
executive_summary: Every week, Microsoft releases new versions of Excel for the Web to millions of users. To ensure the quality of each update, the team needed a data analytics and exploration service. Using Microsoft’s Azure Data Explorer (ADX), also known as Kusto, the team started processing and analyzing logs, user feedback, and other data within seconds to instantly identify and fix issues to offer a seamless service.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer

title: SA Power Networks reduces datacenter footprint by around 30 percent with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: SA Power Networks understands the urgency of preparing for the future. As the key distributor of electricity to most of South Australia and its population of 1.7 million people, the company builds, operates, and maintains the crucial distribution network. And it takes that responsibility seriously. Not only does SA Power Networks deliver power dependably, but it also aims to deliver power safely and sustainably while supporting the shift to a net–100 percent renewable energy system. To support the seismic shift happening in the energy sector, from fossil-fueled power to renewables like rooftop solar, the company needed to rebuild its digital infrastructure. SA Power Networks required agility, scale, and data integration capabilities to complement and drive the innovation of its power distribution strategy, and it found what it needed in SAP on Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Automation, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Disk Storage, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines, Linux on Azure, SAP on Azure, Power BI, Windows Server

executive_summary: Zurich Insurance Group (Zurich) is a global insurer serving people and businesses in more than 200 countries and territories. The corporate center of the company at Zurich headquarters is responsible for adopting new tools and technology strategies and pushing them out to the various business units (BUs) and countries. With each BU operating differently based on the unique needs of its target market or country, many BUs looked to optimize processes to be able to handle more and more customer data across a centralized and flexible CRM system.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Customer Voice, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

executive_summary: Spanish airline Iberia Express, whose 20-plus planes fly to more than 40 destinations, wanted to reduce its costs and maximize efficiency. The low-cost carrier had a contract with a traditional distribution provider, and it had a very high cost per pricing transaction. Iberia Express worked with Microsoft partner Airplane Solutions and implemented its Air Pricing solution, which utilizes numerous Microsoft Azure services. Air Pricing saved Iberia Express 75 percent on distribution costs while improving system performance and provided a solid infrastructure for developing new commercial and marketing offerings for customers.

executive_summary: Avans is a multisite university of applied sciences in the Netherlands, providing tertiary education to some 35,000 students. Three and a half years ago, it began its cloud journey, incorporating Microsoft Teams, Office 365, and most recently, Azure. One significant Azure use case is Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), which has saved Avans tens of thousands of Euros annually and made essential software available to any student with a standard laptop. AVD is now being used to deliver tests and examinations as the university continues to explore the possibilities of a cloud-based future.

executive_summary: WaterAid UK is a nonprofit organization that aims to provide clean water, sanitation, and hygiene education to people in need around the world. Their mission is to transform the lives of the poorest and most marginalized people by improving access to safe water, sanitation, and hygiene. Through their federation model with seven-member regions, WaterAid is working to better connect their data to foster regional collaboration in hopes of improving fundraising and constituent engagement among other organization goals. executive_summary: For profoundly Deaf people in the UK, British Sign Language (BSL) is usually their first or preferred language. The capital ‘D’ is not a typing error – it is used to denote the pride that people have in their deafness. BSL has its own grammar and sentence structure and is not a signed equivalent of English. For many Deaf people in the UK, English is a second or third language. Content in written English can present a barrier. This is why Signly created their ground-breaking technology.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Content Delivery Network, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Front Door, Azure Media Services, Azure Storage

Today, it is done using aggregated data sources—local or from the Azure cloud—and central dashboards visualized using Power BI. This gives Dr. Oetker global transparency on the state of its IT landscape in a way that is user-friendly and organized according to target groups. This will be a key enabler in our transition from an international oil company to an integrated energy company.”

Through this single, highly secure endpoint into the Microsoft 365 platform and features, monday.com can access rich, actionable organizational data from a wide variety of sources.The Microsoft 365 environment is designed from the ground up with security in mind, and Microsoft Graph offers a security API to hook into that environment, along with multiple security providers, through a single programmatic interface.

Its recent digital transformation helps the nonprofit drastically reduce overhead, raise more money in a changing fundraising climate, and make each dollar raised stretch further. By adopting a cloud-first posture, American Cancer Society embraces efficiency and innovation in its battle against cancer.

Looking for an affordable solution with built-in security and a strong backup and recovery plan, it chose to implement SAP Business One on Microsoft Azure. Not only has the solution proven to be highly secure and scalable, it also helped Bartrom cut down its overall costs.

Already underway on its mixed reality journey, the company put its ingenuity to work, along with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist on mobile devices and, in some factories, enabled employees to go hands-free with Dynamics 365 Remote Assist on Microsoft HoloLens 2. This was a vital boost to the program Arla Foods developed to keep its employees safe by adhering to social distancing measures, help preserve essential food supply during a pandemic, and even create a blueprint for remote assistance that supports its high-priority sustainability goals. Not bad for a mere two weeks’ work—the amount of time it took Arla to make mixed reality technology available to its production facilities around the world.

From over 200 locations, its team of 3,700 colleagues deliver excellent customer service, including an unmatched nationwide four-hour delivery promise. “That quality support is what our customers expect – and rely on,” states Speedy Chief Operating Officer, Dan Evans.

executive_summary: Pathfinder International is a nonprofit that supports reproductive health and the rights of women and girls across the globe. The organization runs programs to improve access to family planning and contraception, maternal health services, HIV and AIDS support, and more. Azure Active Directory and other Microsoft solutions have minimized risk of cyberattacks and security breaches, while Microsoft InTune enables staff in remote locations to manage devices without dangerous travel or unnecessary risk. Through Microsoft Power Apps, the organization has created streamlined, paperless digital workflows for many processes. These technology solutions free up staff to focus on the health mission of the organization, with the knowledge that the technology backing their work is secure, efficient, and reliable.

Teams then worked together to implement change by enforcing positive habits with Microsoft Viva. These best practices, which flourished during the pandemic, will help Microsoft maintain its business success moving forward in a hybrid work environment.

By providing a robust IoT backbone and ultimate scalability, Azure IoT Central reduced Kitchen Brains development time by an estimated 80 percent—from 12 to 2 months—and provides the ingredients for continuous enhancement to meet the specific needs of each QSR and OEM customer.

To do this, the bank made online teamwork fully possible, by using Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365. Within a month, nearly 1,000 employees had transitioned to the cloud. Now, they can all collaborate on the go, work on their mobiles, and have reduced email load.

Using Teams and Viva to support employee wellbeing initiatives, Finastra has improved its employee net promoter score (NPS) and is attracting the talent it needs to grow.

They’re full of vitamin C and very good for you.”

The idea is that by studying how a person reacts to different events and occasions, it’s possible to anticipate how they’ll react to similar events in the future – and therefore prepare them for any circumstance. Anima Mentis is doing this by collecting a broad range of biometric, medical and contextual data both at and outside its center. With the help of innovation service provider Zühlke Austria, the organization is realizing a cloud-based AI platform that analyzes information to produce tailored recommendations for patients, who can use them to avoid burnout and train their mental strength.

title: Qanawat ensures readiness, no downtimes, scalability, and security to its payment procedures.
executive_summary: Qanawat is the leading digital mobile solutions provider in the Middle East and North Africa. Qanawat was expanding its market share in the DCB payment and wanted a reliable infrastructure partner that provides Scalability - Security – Availability. The requirement was challenging as the payment transaction should occur on time without delay and volumes may increase suddenly. To sustain its growth, Qanawat decided to migrate its on-prem infrastructure and direct carrier payment platform on Azure thus ensuring readiness, no downtimes, scalability, and security to their payment procedures Qanawat Digital FZC Qanawat (meaning ‘Channels’ in Arabic) is the leading digital mobile solutions provider in the Middle East and North Africa. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Dubai, UAE, they are strategically partnering with 40+ Mobile Network Operators, 10+ Digital Platforms, 700+ Merchants, content providers and Technology companies. The aim at Qanawat Digital is to support people and organizations and leverage the full potential of innovative mobile solutions by being the platform that allows Digital Content Merchants to reach their public target and allow the consumers to get the desired content and pay for it using their phone credit.

Over this period, more and more employees have swapped the telephone receiver for a PC and headset. Microsoft systems were providing flexible communications long before COVID-19 and way before anyone began talking about having to work from home. To make things a little easier, motorhome manufacturer HYMER has combined automotive digitization with smart-home solutions and travel-related services: the HYMER Connect app makes sure the joy of travel isn’t overshadowed by time spent dealing with logbooks, user manuals, and to-do lists. products: Azure, Azure Event Hubs, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Internet of Things

By providing a robust IoT backbone and ultimate scalability, Azure IoT Central reduced Kitchen Brains development time by an estimated 80 percent—from 12 to 2 months—and provides the ingredients for continuous enhancement to meet the specific needs of each QSR and OEM customer.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Event Hubs, Azure IoT Central, Power BI

executive_summary: E-commerce presents a valuable target for cybercriminals, and global e-commerce company QNET recognized the need to adopt a more efficient and secure IT infrastructure. The company migrated on-premises infrastructure to Azure, and replaced its patchwork of security products and services with an end-to-end strategy built on Microsoft Security products and services. The team now has greater confidence from more complete and in-depth visibility into a previously opaque environment. A once-skeptical CIO recognizes increased productivity and transparency from a safer, more productive IT infrastructure and a boosted return on IT investments.

executive_summary: Motionlab is a tech company based in the Czech Republic that also has a presence in the Western Europe, Middle East and East Asia. With a platform developed on the Azure cloud, the company enables brands and agencies to create personalized marketing videos. The video creation platform is easily integrated with tools for emailing, messaging, as well as CRMs, allowing clients to craft videos based on real customer information and seamlessly deliver these to emails, mobiles, apps, etc. The results have led to high conversion rates and increased brand loyalty for its clients.

Turning to Microsoft Azure capabilities of scalability and flexibility, CDCN transformed its claims platform, which allowed it to expand annual claims processing capacity from 3 million items to over 20 million items—with optimized cost and performance.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure SQL Database

executive_summary: Security and compliance are top priorities for financial services companies handling billions of dollars in customer assets. When the financial planning firm Visionary Wealth Advisors needed to balance compliance supervision with innovative ways to meet customer needs through mobile text messaging and other digital communication, it adopted the CellTrust SL2 communication platform on Microsoft Azure with Microsoft 365 E5 and Microsoft Purview Data Lifecycle Management for maximum security and compliance. Now, the firm can respond to clients at a moment’s notice.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Purview Data Lifecycle Management

executive_summary: Global energy firm Equinor is committed to a sustainable, low-carbon future, and the company realizes that effective use of data is essential to achieving its goals. title: Responsive teaching that reflects the reality of the student experience using Microsoft Reflect
executive_summary: Every act of learning happens in a context. When an educator steps in front of a room to begin the first lesson of the day, with the first period bell’s ring still echoing in the hall, that educator must deal with myriad challenges and backgrounds students have brought to the classroom. Events at home, frustration with the course material, a first romance gone bad, and more can alter the mood of the students and their ability to connect with the material and each other. This social and emotional landscape has always been a part of the reality of learning, but its importance elevated in the wake of the disruptions of the last few years, and the anxieties it left behind in students. For All Hallows’ School in Brisbane, Australia, the solution came in the form of Microsoft 365 A5, Windows devices, and Microsoft Reflect.

Recently, the organization realized it needed to reinvent its offering to expand its reach and better serve existing customers – so, it partnered with Microsoft to digitally transform its operations. Using cloud technology, it built a flexible, modular platform environment to help develop customized solutions that meet customers’ needs and help them to solve social and environmental challenges - ultimately enabling positive change for a better tomorrow.

Our strategy, Ambition 2025, is anchored on building the largest and most valuable platform business, with a clear focus on Africa. Visit www.mtn.com or www.mtn.co.za for more information.

title: Grupo Bimbo bakes in end-to-end data security and compliance with Microsoft Purview true to its “deeply human” values
executive_summary: With operations around the globe, more than 100 well-loved brands, and 145,000 employees (associates, in Grupo Bimbo parlance), Grupo Bimbo is a major player in the consumer goods industry. Its leadership strategy includes rigorously protecting its trove of recipes and R&D assets. Most importantly, the company must care for one of its most precious assets: its sterling reputation. Not only is the international bakery lauded for its commercial success, its “deeply human” ethos makes Grupo Bimbo a sought-after employer. Its vast store of sensitive data calls for visibility and highly effective safeguards to ensure compliance with regulations in the many countries where Grupo Bimbo operates. The company answered these requirements with the Microsoft Purview family of data security, governance, risk, and compliance solutions. This visibility sparks an array of benefits: improved data security, compliance, greater efficiency for cybersecurity teams, and—critically—increased protection against data loss and business conduct violations while safeguarding the privacy of every Grupo Bimbo associate.

Following Panasonic Connect’s acquisition of Blue Yonder, significant difference in development cultures between the two companies brought a “sense of danger.” To overcome the differences, they decided to pursue a cloud-native development culture. As a platform and tool for change, Panasonic Connect adopted Microsoft Azure and GitHub. This article describes how Panasonic Connect has worked on the transformation of its development culture.

Their “Microsoft for everything” approach helped the company scale up quickly to meet growing demand, reduce costs, and maintain a strict security posture, including General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) compliance. Wilhelm Kugelberg, Strategy & Business Development Manager at Svea Solar, has been part of the company’s OKR effort from the beginning. His team works together to find ways to break down the company’s mission into distinct milestones and continue to expand the business. Svea Solar is hoping to add nearly 4,000 more employees in the next five years. “We’re already one of the fastest growing companies in Europe,” says Kugelberg. “We recognized that we could achieve even more if we were more goal oriented and focused.” To power its OKR ambitions, Svea Solar turned to Microsoft Viva Goals. “We use Viva Goals to make our progress and objectives more transparent and accessible to everyone,” he says. “With it, we’ve expanded our OKR effort to include new areas of the business, and we’re driving efficiency in regard to our company goals.”

The data that is collected and used to power the system is compliant with Finnish security and privacy legislation and is informing research efforts to understand how the virus is contracted and spread. HUS’s longstanding commitment to the digitization of services meant that a foundation was already in place so the end-to-end service could be rolled out quickly. It has undoubtedly saved many lives, as well as prevented the strongest lockdown measures, which would inevitably have harmed the Finnish economy.

That’s what led us to embrace Microsoft tools to support our commitment to innovation.” In the years since, Brisendine took on responsibility for a dedicated “innovation center,” and St. Luke’s has embraced Microsoft tools to help transform how it supports employees and delivers exceptional care. That includes adopting Microsoft Teams, Teams Rooms systems, and Teams Phone capabilities to transform collaboration, moving its electronic health record (EHR) system to the cloud with Azure, and moving to Dynamics 365 for improved insights into patient needs. “The new technologies we’ve rolled out will have a positive impact on hundreds of thousands of patients,” says Brisendine. “That’s how we’re making the most of Microsoft tools to bring innovation and care into our communities.”

title: St. Luke’s delivers exceptional, scalable service for providers and patients with Epic on Azure
executive_summary: St. Luke’s University Health Network has gained a reputation for using innovative technology to deliver services to patients and streamline operational procedures for employees. After beginning a cloud transformation by moving IT resources to Microsoft Azure, St. Luke’s embarked on a migration of its critically important Epic healthcare system. Through careful planning and a phased approach, it has successfully migrated 20 of 20 Epic environments to Azure. St. Luke’s benefits from its new platform’s increased scalability and the agility to quickly respond to acquisitions, upgrades, and changes in the healthcare market.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Storage

title: GlaxoSmithKline enhances workplace resiliency, device management with Microsoft Endpoint Manager
executive_summary: As GSK began tackling its device infrastructure, it realized that its primarily on-premises work environment presented unwanted limitations. In response, GSK started its cloud migration journey working with Endpoint Manager, which combines web-based device management services such as Intune and Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager with other Microsoft Security and governance solutions in one highly secure, cloud-based service. In a matter of months, the company was able to deliver crucial employee applications, tools, and services in a highly safe and secure manner with significantly less work.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Windows 10, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot

title: Kinetica drives digital transformation through data with Azure as a service
executive_summary: Even though organizations that use IoT are generating vast quantities of data, making sense of it remains a hurdle. That’s where Kinetica excels. The analytics database company provides services for analyzing massive amounts of temporal and geospatial data. By providing Kinetica as a service on Microsoft Azure, the company no longer has to worry about scarce talent and resources and can instead focus on performing some of the most complex IoT use cases in the world—from telecommunications to Santa Claus.
products: Azure

title: Signant Health keeps COVID-19 clinical trials moving securely with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Signant Health provides the technology solutions that enable pharmaceutical companies to run clinical trials for developing new drugs and testing existing ones for new uses. When COVID-19 hit, Signant not only had to move its 2,000 employees to remote work, but it also had to be ready to scale operations to support clinical trials of critical therapeutic drugs and newly developed vaccines to fight COVID-19.
products: Microsoft Teams, Surface

title: SelfPay ensures the availability of the payment solutions’ infrastructure with Azure
executive_summary: SelfPay is one of Romania’s leading go-to solutions for contactless electronic payments. The company provides more than 5,500 self-service payment stations across 1,000 localities. To keep pace with growing transaction volumes—which often go up by 25 percent during holiday seasons—SelfPay sought to increase both processing power and scalability. This became a necessity following the COVID-19 health crisis and associated sanitary recommendations to privilege contactless transactions. By moving its databases to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform, the company tripled its transaction volume-handling capabilities, ensuring reliable, highly secure, and efficient payments service availability for people across Romania.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Managed Instance

SnapPay is an automated payments solution from Fiserv that works with major enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems like Microsoft Dynamics 365, SAP, and Oracle. Tasked with delivering accounts payable and accounts receivable services for large and mid-sized companies, SnapPay was originally developed as an on-premises technology. When it came time to move to the cloud, Fiserv looked at several solutions. Ultimately, Microsoft Azure was the cloud platform of choice. SnapPay performance has improved, and implementation time has been reduced up to 50 percent.

executive_summary: For financial services firms, digital transformation means improving the experience of financial advisors so they can work more efficiently. It also means adapting to regulatory changes so they can stay compliant year after year. INVENT is a digital transformation partner for the financial services industry, providing consulting and software as a service (SaaS) solutions to help companies upgrade their technology stack. INVENT has taken advantage of multiple cloud platforms, including Microsoft Azure, to build a highly secure toolkit that is streamlined, scalable, and easy for financial advisors to use.

title: Swiss Re accelerates Java app modernization using Azure Spring Apps
executive_summary: Technical Story
products: Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Monitor, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Key Vault

executive_summary: Kraft Heinz is a global food and beverage company with a portfolio of iconic and emerging brands.
