Kraft Heinz took advantage of Microsoft Teams to keep its workforce connected and products on shelves around the world. By moving both daily meetings and large-scale company educational initiatives onto Teams, the company kept food on tables. At the same time, it was able to drive a transformation inspired by its purpose: “Let’s make life delicious.”
products: Microsoft Teams

With the help of Microsoft’s Nonprofit Tech Acceleration (NTA) for Black and African American Communities program, BronxConnect now uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 to get a “single view” of formerly disjointed data to better serve clients.

executive_summary: Headquartered in Ukraine and with offices across Europe, North America, and Asia, SoftServe implements end-to-end IT solutions for companies looking to optimize business processes. SoftServe constantly aims to make the most of Microsoft solutions, including Dynamics 365. It recently moved its on-premises customer relationship management (CRM) system to the cloud to benefit from the platform’s full range of capabilities and further streamline processes and collaboration. The company also integrated Dynamics 365 Sales with LinkedIn Sales Navigator to drive sales and deliver targeted insights to its customer-facing teams.

With no brick-and-mortar stores to limit its capacity, ASOS has continued to grow to fulfill increasing demand, becoming a giant of the online retail space. So, Vestas implemented Decisions, a purpose-built 3rd party app, into its Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365 platform, enabling significant productivity improvements in meeting management throughout the organization. This new, powerful solution helps employees save time, make crucial business decisions faster and above all, improve mental wellbeing in the workplace by reducing frustration over poorly executed meetings.
products: Planner, Microsoft Teams, OneNote, Outlook, Word

title: Switch from analog to Teams telephony brings major gains
executive_summary: In the search for a more flexible telephony solution, Fernfachhochschule Schweiz turned to sipcall, who quickly impressed with its extensive experience in Voice over Internet and an attractive price model. Working together, they rapidly converted the entire communication system of FFHS from analog telephony to an Internet-based solution for MS Teams. The new solution has not only given FFHS the desired flexibility, but has also made it possible to significantly reduce costs while maintaining the same stable connection quality. The employees are enthusiastic and see great added value through the changeover. The new solution with Teams offers so many advantages that no one wants to return to analog telephony.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Empowering underserved youth in South Africa by imparting foundational skills for the digital economy
executive_summary: One of South Africa’s most pressing and complex issues is youth unemployment. Tackling the problem requires a holistic, multi-partner approach, which is exactly what Microsoft, Afrika Tikkun, and Nedbank did. The three organizations launched an e-learning platform called DigiSkills, enabling youth to acquire in-demand digital and professional skills to become more employable. Based on Microsoft’s existing Community Training Platform, the solution provides five development pathways, ranging from project management to data analytics. The blended learning model was hosted in Nedbank’s facilities and delivered through nonprofit partner Afrika Tikkun.
products: Microsoft Learn

executive_summary: Traditional LULC maps require significant human input, which takes time and involves processing large amounts of data, and they’re often out of date by the time they’re published. To be distinct from existing LULC maps, Impact Observatory’s model needed to be more accurate in near real time. To accomplish this goal and meet its technology objectives, Impact Observatory turned to Microsoft Azure and Microsoft AI for Earth, sharing a passion for combining technology and sustainability. The company now routinely makes maps faster than satellites can collect images, which is a testament to the processing speed and scale of what is now the highest-resolution global map ever publicly released.
products: Azure, Azure Batch, Azure Blob Storage, Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machines

products: Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, Dynamics 365 Sales, Dataverse for Teams, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate

Since the introduction of the Azure cloud-native data platform, Deutsche Börse Group experiences a faster time to market, with a minimal delay, SLA-backed storing and processing of large data assets as well as higher business continuity and reliance through their Azure-based infrastructure.

executive_summary: One of South Africa’s most pressing and complex issues is youth unemployment. executive_summary: When ITC Secure upgraded to Windows 11 Enterprise, it unlocked the security features needed to innovate its hybrid working environment. The key to its vision and success has been continued investment in the latest technologies. The bank was among the first in its market to introduce ATMs and alternative payment methods, and one of the first to deploy early online services like transactional websites and an online financial marketplace.

executive_summary: Digitizing its paper-based approach was a major goal as Kenny Constructions began its digital transformation, working closely with IT consultancy Topline Co. What used to take several hours per week across several teams—and included chasing down missing information or translating sloppy handwriting—is now instantaneous. Not only has FormMachines in Teams alleviated manual tasks, it also delivered a comprehensive view of the business so Kenny Constructions executives can make more informed decisions.

But, when COVID-19 changed airline travel overnight, United Airlines needed to find a way to take its bourgeoning hybrid culture to the next level. “We still wanted to maintain that ability to come together even though we were more geographically distributed than ever,” says Birnbaum. “Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365 became the crucial collaboration tools we used to build a hybrid culture that reflects the flexible nature of our business.” Hybrid work can be summarized as more options.

The platform has enabled CNFC to streamline operations, simplify financial management and ensure clear traceability on products from inventory to sales.

title: On the fast track to environmental action: DKV Mobility draws on digital products to ensure efficient and sustainable supply chains and vehicle fleets
executive_summary: From Hamburg to Munich with two tons of freight; from Munich to Hamburg with nothing: it’s not uncommon for trucks to deliver goods to a destination and then drive the long way back empty. This is a waste of resources—despite the fact that most companies put cost efficiency and sustainability high on their agenda. However, change is happening in the logistics sector, and DKV Mobility is helping smooth the way: its customer account center DKV Cockpit allows logistics companies and corporate vehicle fleets to operate in a connected, efficient, and sustainable manner. The technology behind it: Microsoft Azure and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service

title: Global energy leader safeguards its digital transformation with automated app governance
executive_summary: bp’s app access and governance processes were preventing the company from embracing a more proactive, continuous security posture for its growing technology footprint. Recognizing change was needed, bp worked with Microsoft to provide feedback on the automation capabilities of the app governance add-on for Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps. As a result, the energy company deployed several services to provide more robust app tracking, regulation, and monitoring capabilities. bp simplified how it defines and enforces app behaviors for thousands of third-party and line-of-business apps across its global enterprises for 90,000 users.
products: Microsoft Entra ID

executive_summary: As the organization responsible for providing digital services to Oslo’s healthcare sector, the Oslo Agency for Health has one main goal: to empower care teams with best-in-class solutions. As long-term Microsoft users, the organization has been working to drive efficiencies across its operations by removing paper-based processes and adopting low-code technology. This strategy proved fundamental when the pandemic hit in 2020, allowing the agency to develop new solutions for contact tracing and vaccinations in a matter of days. Using Microsoft Power Platform, the agency has since been able to create more than 25 apps in support of the healthcare sector. All while helping to weather the crisis effectively in the shortest amount of time.
products: Azure Functions, Azure SQL Database, Power Apps, Dataverse, Power BI

After the migration, Al Tannan eliminated manual work and streamlined its processes, reducing inventory time for a store from 14 to 4 hours. The team also gained visibility with data, enabling employees to monitor and solve issues faster and improve customer experience.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance, Office 365, Power BI

Over the past few years, the organization has embarked on a digital transformation program aimed – among other initiatives – at improving employee wellbeing using data and workplace analytics. Enabled by Microsoft Viva Insights, this particular initiative is helping to change SES’ meeting culture and support employee development.

Dow turned to Microsoft and its tools, capabilities, and expertise to build a highly scalable data ingestion and analytics system in the cloud. As a result, Dow helped employees access data in real time, reduced manufacturing and operational costs, and improved workflows.

executive_summary: G&J Pepsi-Cola Bottlers avoided both loss of data and ransom payment when a ransomware attack threatened the company in 2021. It refused to back down—and having avoided lasting harm, the company also resisted complacency. It used learnings from the experience to introduce a more proactive approach, deepen its existing processes, increase backup frequency, and more rigorously enforce policies. Microsoft Azure Backup is the solution that G&J Pepsi used to save the day, and it’s only one of the many Microsoft Security solutions that the company put in place. The value of its enhanced security posture: priceless.
products: Azure Backup, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Graph Data Connect, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for Identity, Microsoft Intune

executive_summary: Aditya Birla Capital Limited (ABCL), a Fortune 500 financial services company based in India, contains multiple verticals from which it generates distinct reports. The organization processes large amounts of data daily, and ABCL found that it was spending significant time generating reports from an array of siloed sources. ABCL partnered with Celebal Technologies, a Microsoft Gold partner, to gain unprecedented visibility into its business and stay ahead in the market by centralizing its data to generate rich visualizations and actionable reports via Microsoft technologies.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

In partnership with the Microsoft Brazil Customer Success Team, Studio 365 successfully supported the development and release of the TRF1 Virtual Support Desk, an online service platform for Microsoft Teams that provides safe virtual assistance to citizens. executive_summary: Schneider Electric’s global sales teams must engage with several tedious, manual tasks and toggle between multiple screens and apps if they want good data quality in their Salesforce CRM, taking time away from core selling activities.

executive_summary: Based in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia, Hochschule Düsseldorf, University of Applied Sciences (HSD) wanted to move its datacenters to a new facility in Düsseldorf-Derendorf. Immediately after the move, HSD faced a challenge. Maintenance work on the building’s power supply required a complete shutdown.
products: Azure, Exchange Online, Microsoft Teams, Office 365

title: Alpha Travel: How one ambitious business digitally transformed its opportunity to go global
executive_summary: There are only four sets of traffic lights on the 18 Faroe Islands. Tórshavn, the small capital on Streymoy Island, is home to all of them. Sandwiched between the Norwegian Sea and Atlantic Ocean—about 320 kilometers north-northwest of  Scotland—this globally ambitious company, Alpha Travel, is quietly adopting the latest cloud-based technology.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Business Central, Microsoft Teams

title: TIM turns to Microsoft for an improved entertainment experience designed especially for viewers
executive_summary: Telecom Italia (TIM) is an Italian telecommunications company with more than 51,000 employees headquartered in Rome and Milan. To expand entertainment services, TIM uses Microsoft Azure for data analytics to support a deeper understanding of customers’ needs and wants, all while meeting the company’s high standards of security and confidentiality. With new insights in hand, TIM offers customers tailor-made products and services and makes smarter, more insightful business decisions.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Kubernetes Service, Power BI, SQL Server

title: Acterys combined with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power BI delivers financial analytics and consolidation for 30 Worms Safety group companies
executive_summary: Worms Safety is a leading global alliance of specialists in safety and quality management. Following the company’s introduction of a new Xero financial management system, Worms Safety turned to Acterys to automate the consolidation for 30 group companies. Acterys, which specializes in planning and analytics, integrated Azure SQL Server and Power BI to improve management reporting with interactive dashboard capabilities. The new solution enabled Worms Safety to completely avoid 10 days of effort and cost previously spent on manual spreadsheet maintenance in addition to significantly improved analysis and reporting options.
products: Azure

title: Story collection: Explore how Manulife uses Microsoft cloud solutions for business innovation
executive_summary: Manulife provides financial and insurance services to more than 30 million customers around the world. The company strives to be a leading international financial services group that helps people make easier decisions and their lives better. Moving to the cloud is an important step toward that goal.
products: Azure, Microsoft Teams

title: Keeping people healthy during a pandemic, AllWays Health Partners deploys telehealth services to network providers using Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Just days before Governor Charlie Baker issued a stay-at-home advisory in March 2020, Christine Murphy was visiting rural medical practices to understand their challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic. As Vice President, Network Management at AllWays Health Partners, she wanted to understand how her company, the health plan of the Mass General Brigham system, could help independent providers continue to care for patients during an unprecedented health crisis.
products: Microsoft 365 E1, Bookings, Microsoft Teams, Office 365, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Cyprus-based Hellenic Bank builds a more productive workplace with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: One of the largest retail banks in Cyprus, Hellenic Bank emerged as a forerunner of digital transformation in the Central and Eastern Europe financial sector in 2017, when it started adopting digital tools to serve its customers better. It adopted Microsoft 365 tools like SharePoint Online and Microsoft Teams to its core processes, creating a productive workplace environment that empowers more than 3,000 employees to collaborate more easily to meet customers’ needs.
products: Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Stream, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online, Power BI

title: Leading construction software ISV shifts 900 customers to Azure in record time
executive_summary: Construction companies around the globe depend on Viewpoint for the enterprise resource planning software that helps manage their projects, processes, and people so they can deliver on-time, on-budget projects. When Viewpoint decided to simplify its cloud footprint, it embarked on a plan to move 900 software as a service (SaaS) customers to Microsoft Azure, the business-critical platform the company turns to for its highly regarded software. The company successfully completed the migration in just seven months. Now that it’s moved to Azure, Viewpoint is better positioned to grow, using Microsoft technology. It enjoys the scalability, reliability, performance, and cost optimization it desired while helping keep customers with stringent compliance requirements secure.
products: Azure, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Virtual Machines, SQL Server

title: Growing an innovative energy partnership across Australia
executive_summary: AGL, one of Australia’s leading integrated energy companies, is rolling out an innovative energy partnership with the help of Microsoft Azure Data Explorer. By allowing customers across the country to give back to the grid through remote management of networked solar batteries, AGL has created an innovative virtual power plant (VPP) that improves grid reliability, putting downward pressure on energy prices and helping customers save on energy costs.
products: Azure Data Explorer

title: American Council of the Blind scales up with accessible technology
executive_summary: American Council of the Blind is driven to support and advocate for all people who are blind or visually impaired. Yet its technology infrastructure held the nonprofit back. As part of its strategic plan, American Council of the Blind invested in Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Office 365. With more reliable and secure technology, it advances its mission and serves more people.

executive_summary: American Council of the Blind is driven to support and advocate for all people who are blind or visually impaired. Yet its technology infrastructure held the nonprofit back. With more reliable and secure technology, it advances its mission and serves more people.

title: Microsoft helps boost revenue, reduce fraud costs, and simplify customer transactions with AI-powered fraud protection for e-commerce
executive_summary: As a global e-commerce leader, Microsoft is no stranger to the threat of retail fraud. But it’s not always easy to safeguard more than a billion transactions a year and deliver the best possible shopping and purchasing experiences at the same time. In response, Microsoft developed its own fraud protection system, reducing fraud-related costs by $76 million and boosting revenue by hundreds of millions more over a two-year period. The solution—now called Microsoft Dynamics 365 Fraud Protection—was released for public preview in April 2019.
products: Dynamics 365 Fraud Protection

title: 24 Hour Fitness uncovers data insights to create personalized customer experiences
executive_summary: Just about everybody wants to get fit, but there are as many paths to fitness as there are people embarking on the journey. 24 Hour Fitness stands out in a crowded wellness industry not just for its innovative approach to fitness but for its personalized approach to member services. The company is applying data analytics to member marketing by connecting Microsoft Dynamics 365 with Adobe Experience Cloud hosted on Microsoft Azure to personalize marketing messages to millions of members at its 400-plus US health clubs. By connecting marketing and sales data, 24 Hour Fitness is reaching people in exciting new ways, bringing in record numbers of members, and helping more people reach their fitness goals.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Nonprofit iRespond creates biometric ID technology with Azure
executive_summary: With its cloud-supported iris-scanning technology based on Microsoft Azure, iRespond is empowering nonprofits and other institutions to serve refugees, displaced people, and other at-risk groups who do not have reliable identification. With this remarkably accurate biometric ID, the world’s most vulnerable people have better access to medical care and human rights protection.
products: Azure Stack, Surface

title: Global chemical company creates collaborative reaction with OneDrive
executive_summary: Ecolab is a global chemical company that prioritizes sustainability, making water conservation, renewable energy, and food safety its top missions. From its headquarters in Saint Paul, Minnesota, the company depends on employees all over the world to create a more sustainable, healthy world. It found a solution to its collaboration headaches with Microsoft OneDrive. Now, Ecolab teams collaborate more securely and seamlessly with OneDrive, wherever they are.
products: OneDrive for Business

title: UNHCR moves faster on humanitarian crises with latest cloud technologies
executive_summary: Staff at the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) work throughout 134 countries to protect and serve refugees and other forcibly displaced people. Yet outdated technology struggled to keep up with staff and the increasing need for their support in devastated communities. With the onsite help of Microsoft Services to upgrade to Microsoft 365, which includes Office 365, Windows 10, and Enterprise Mobility + Security, staff in a number of field locations now have modern tools to better protect and assist these vulnerable groups.
products: Microsoft Intune, Windows 10

title: Dr. Martens “Joins the Revolution” with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Dr. Martens is an iconic British footwear brand, loved the world over for its signature style that unapologetically represents freedom, self-expression, and authenticity. Formed in 1947, Dr. Martens made headway as a wholesale business and now has more than 100 stores globally, with ambitious plans for retail and e-commerce growth. Recognizing the need to evolve to suit the needs of the twenty-first century consumer, the brand embarked on “Project Reboot: Join the Revolution” to replace all its legacy applications with Microsoft Dynamics 365.
products: Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

title: Working as a team amidst disruption at the University of South Florida
executive_summary:
As winter ended in the early months of 2020, Florida found itself beset—like so many states and countries before it—by swelling numbers of COVID-19 infections.  Primary schools shuttered their doors throughout the state, and university campuses shut down.  For the University of South Florida (USF), with campuses in Tampa, Sarasota-Manatee, and St. Petersburg, as well as USF Health—which trains the next generation of healthcare professionals at its Tampa facilities—closing campuses did not mean an end to learning.
By turning to Microsoft Teams, USF has been able to deploy a solution that enables collaboration across the entire school, and helps facilitate remote learning for its students.
products: Microsoft Teams, Outlook

title: CHFT expands patient choice and care with virtual visits using Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Calderdale and Huddersfield NHS Foundation Trust in the United Kingdom has made it easier for patients to see consultants and for consultants to provide timely and personalized services in patients’ homes. Using Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Bookings, clinicians at the trust can book virtual visits and consultations quickly, move them flexibly, and host them online so patients don’t have to travel long distances. The trust has seen fewer missed appointments, more timely care, greater choice for patients, and lower costs.
products: Microsoft 365 E3, Bookings, Microsoft Teams

title: Revolutionising healthcare with Microsoft Teams and MedXnote
executive_summary: University Hospital Southampton NHS Foundation Trust (UHS) with 11,000 staff, providing services to  1.3 million people living in Southampton and south Hampshire. It also provides specialist services such as neurosciences, cardiac services and children's intensive care to more than 3 million people in central southern England and the Channel Islands.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: 24Storage: Removing physical interactions to empower customer service
executive_summary: Since it was founded in 2015, 24Storage has been driving innovation within the Swedish self-storage sector. Today, through a centralized, cloud-based solution, 24Storage can remotely control every aspect of its 23 facilities. This technology removes the need for any employees to be based onsite and gives customers complete control over their service—from sign-up and payment to 24/7 access. A digital-first approach has streamlined business processes and helped the company continue to rapidly expand across Sweden.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Unilever puts metadata in one big basket thanks to CadDo and Microsoft technologies
executive_summary: Unilever is one of the world’s largest fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) businesses, owning more than 400 famous brands that are sold around the world. Given the scale and complexity of its operations and metadata, Unilever identified a need to better understand its Cost to Serve. CadDo Calculate was implemented to address Unilever's needs rapidly and effectively. Using an end-to-end Microsoft stack, including Microsoft Azure, SQL Server, and Power BI, meant all components connected effortlessly and data flowed from raw source data into robust end-user reports. The project was a clear success in terms of its original scope, as CadDo Calculate is now live in Unilever’s largest markets covering over 20 percent of the global business.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Sonata builds a unifying data platform for Alltech with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: To better align its business processes with its global sustainability goals, Alltech continually looks for ways to be more efficient. Because it is a global organization, travel is a significant portion of Alltech’s expenses, and the company wanted to better understand its travel strategy and spend.
products: Azure, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI

title: Adastra helps Heritage Grocers Group save $500,000 by adopting Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Heritage Grocers Group had expanded rapidly through acquisitions, and traditional data organization processes were too slow to support its ongoing growth. The company wanted to optimize its data platform for better customer insights.
products: Dynamics 365, Azure, Microsoft Fabric

title: NHS gets well-architected in response to the pandemic
executive_summary: Since 1948, the National Health Service (NHS) has represented health and wellness to British citizens across the isles. However, never in its 70-plus years has the NHS encountered such an unprecedented health threat as when COVID-19 reached its shores. In order to respond quickly and effectively to the overwhelming flood of healthcare needs, it became increasingly clear that the NHS needed a better, more responsive system architecture that could scale with the tsunami of demand and maintain expected performance levels. That’s why it turned to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework and the AlwaysOn architectural approach—to diagnose systemic issues with the NHS architecture and implement a better framework for increased security, performance, and operations.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Front Door, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network

title: Amedisys prescribes Microsoft Security and a password-free solution to support clinical teams
executive_summary: Home healthcare and hospice care provider Amedisys needs to protect sensitive patient data. But accessibility to that data by its clinicians is just as important. The company works hard to ensure that those dedicated workers can quickly and easily call up the information systems and productivity applications that are now tightly interwoven into medical care delivery. How to accomplish these two seemingly oppositional goals? Amedisys found the answer with Microsoft Security solutions.
products: Azure, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Viva Engage, Windows Hello

title: Canadian Tech Talent Accelerator program helps Canadian talent skill up for digital careers
executive_summary: Between vacancies in IT jobs and workplace changes due to COVID-19, equipping young people for digital careers has become more relevant than ever. The Canadian Tech Talent Accelerator program brings together Microsoft, NPower Canada, Blueprint, and Canada’s Digital Technology Supercluster with the goal of training 3,900 underserved youth for digital careers. The program helps close the skills gap through hands-on learning, industry mentoring, and professional development. By supporting youth to confidently enter technology careers, the program bolsters Canada’s drive to become a digital leader.
products: Azure

executive_summary: Anglian Water supplies more than six million customers across East Anglia and Hartlepool with water and water recycling services. As part of its “love every drop” commitment, the company works to efficiently manage and conserve water supplies as well as raise customer recognition of what a precious resource water is.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Entra ID

As COVID-19 began spreading across the country, online orders skyrocketed 240 percent in a matter of months, accelerating Albertsons’s modernization plans. To squelch competitive pressures, the need to operate and innovate faster was clear. Reducing costs while leveraging inherent Azure capabilities such as scalability, flexibility, resiliency, and agility will enable Albertsons to quickly pivot based on market demand. In the third quarter of Fiscal 2020 alone, Albertsons reported an increase of 12.3 percent in Identical Sales Growth and an astounding 225 percent rise in digital sales.
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines, Windows Server

executive_summary: Netherlands-based cooperative CRV is a global leader in cattle improvement. With the motto “better cows, better life,” the company helps farmers make sure that their cows feed the global population in a healthy and sustainable way. While in the process of migrating to the cloud, the company recently adopted Azure Red Hat OpenShift, a container solution jointly managed and engineered by Microsoft and Red Hat. The technology frees up CRV’s developers to focus on creating new digital innovations for their farmers.
products: Azure, Azure Red Hat OpenShift

title: Scaling secure enclave environments with Signal and Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Signal is a free, open-source, private messaging application designed to protect the privacy of messages and user data. The nonprofit organization had employed Microsoft Azure confidential computing as one of its cloud solutions, using secure enclaves to host back-end services. When the app soared to a top position in app stores across the world in 2021, Signal quickly scaled up its confidential computing workloads on Azure, taking advantage of the platform’s high availability, reliability, and support during the massive growth.
products: Azure

title: Bridgewater goes all in on Microsoft Defender Experts, heralding a new age in managed security services
executive_summary: Bridgewater rose to the top of the financial space through a blend of innovation and proactive security strategy. It takes a global view, focusing on the long term to stay ahead of trends and deliver the best possible results for its hedge fund customers. That’s why the company has embraced a community-minded strategy that helps it focus its considerable energies on financial markets while entrusting Microsoft to augment its cybersecurity team. After all, Bridgewater contributed its extensive security expertise to shape the service, so it knows that it’s effective.

title: Kent State University offers hybrid learning for remote and in-room students with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Kent State University has always placed a high priority on accessibility and equal opportunity. The school had already begun building a catalog of online course material when COVID-19 pushed that effort into high gear. A partnership among technologists in the internal IT department, executive leadership, individual departments, and educators keen to provide the best experience for their students developed a new strategy based on Microsoft Teams. The university has updated technology to include Teams in rooms with computers and room audio/video capability, and specifically developed and deployed a number of broadcast and hybrid Teams Rooms to include Microsoft Surface Hub. Around one thousand rooms across eight campuses now offer more effective and equitable learning opportunities for in-room, remote, and hybrid classroom teaching.
products: Microsoft Teams Rooms, Surface Hub

title: Keurig brews a more perfect cup of coffee with Azure IoT Central
executive_summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is a beverage company built for modern life. It has created a broad collection of refreshing, iconic brands to meet the varied tastes of today’s consumers. More than 35 million US households have a Keurig coffee brewer, making it the leading single-cup brewing system in North America. Now Keurig is launching connected brewers to revolutionize the coffee experience for consumers and simplify fleet management and maintenance for commercial partners. Based on the Azure IoT Central app platform, this connected solution allows users to activate and customize their brews through mobile and smart-home devices. The solution also drives a continuous improvement loop for customer support and enables faster decisions for product development.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Central, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Internet of Things

title: Wimbledon High School teachers harness the power of Firefly in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Rachel Evans, Director of Digital Learning and Innovation at Wimbledon High School (WHS) in London, was clear that she didn't want technology to lead teaching and learning, but rather to enable teachers to use the best tools available to meet their goals. WHS needed to support the real-time business of learning, whilst at the same time simplifying storage of and access to learning materials. By leveraging Microsoft tools alongside Firefly, WHS teachers are better able to innovate in the classroom whilst ensuring consistency of experience for their students across all learning spaces.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, OneNote

executive_summary: Financial holding company Chedid Capital is a leading investment group in the insurance and reinsurance fields. The group operates across Europe, the Middle East, Africa and South Asia. To keep pace with its dynamic expansion, the company has built internal business applications to help streamline workflows using Microsoft Power Apps. A key example is a performance appraisal system that currently provides 600 employees in 15 global entities with transparency and consistency throughout the appraisal process. The same app has the potential to expand coverage to 1400 employees across 61 entities once all subsidiaries—including the recently acquired Ascoma group—are onboarded to the system. Another app for customer relationship management improves data visibility, leading to higher efficiency and performance of sales teams. The result is easier coordination and faster processing of data, which leads to greater productivity.
products: Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Elanco puts user experience front and center with connected Microsoft Zero Trust
executive_summary: When Elanco spun off from 140-year-old parent company Eli Lilly and Company, its IT leadership was quick to reimagine the company’s entire information landscape. The animal products and services provider used various innovative solutions including Microsoft Security solutions to build a future-forward landscape that supports its innovative teams while also helping secure data and applications. An intense 18-month deployment spanning Microsoft 365 E5 productivity apps, the full range of Microsoft Defender solutions, other Microsoft Security solutions, and more helped set Elanco up for a bright future, including a lower total cost of ownership.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Purview eDiscovery

title: Mattress Firm partners with Microsoft to transform customer experiences
executive_summary: Mattress Firm, America’s largest specialty mattress retailer, wants to stay ahead in the rapidly changing retail industry. That means transforming their business – from their customers’ shopping experience all the way through to the warehouse and delivery management. Moving to the Microsoft Cloud helps Mattress Firm put experiences and data together to revolutionize their ability to match customers with the right mattress and sleep systems and quickly pivot to anticipate the industry's next challenge. Now customers have a scientific approach to sleep better which the company hopes will help its customers live longer, better lives.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365

title: Würth transforms the customer experience and drives business growth with mixed reality
executive_summary: Suppliers around the world are fast waking up to the potential that mixed reality solutions offer in augmenting both e-commerce and traditional retail sales. A pioneer in this field is Würth Italia, the leading distributor of fastening products in Italy. In a bid to improve customer experience, the company has introduced mixed reality in both its online and traditional sales activities – all with a view to boosting sales, cutting down CO2 emissions and offering a completely new experience to its customers. This new, retail metaverse solution is already producing outstanding results: from revenue growth to talent attraction, the initiative is helping Würth to expand its reach and establish itself as a national and international leader.

title: Dreaming of making great strides as a global blockchain game company, Wemade is enjoying solid success in the global market as well as Korea
executive_summary: Founded in 2000, Wemade is Korea’s leading game developer with recorded sales of KRW 561 billion, a 344% increase year-on-year, as well as an operating profit of KRW 326 billion for 2021. Wemade, loved by global fans for its great game services, is solidifying its status as a leading game company with the worldwide success of Mir 4, which was released in 2020.
products: Azure, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Data Explorer, Azure SQL Database

title: Ansys trusts Red Canary and Microsoft Defender experts for turnkey cyberdefense
executive_summary: Ansys concentrates its resources on developing its leading engineering simulation software. Security is vital, but few companies have the experts to provide the intensive cybersecurity surveillance needed to protect a large and complex landscape. Enter Red Canary, a Microsoft Partner Network member that incorporates Microsoft Security solutions into its leading managed detection and response (MDR) services.
products: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps

title: Ally Financial applies the power of Azure Quantum to bring tomorrow’s solutions to today’s customers
executive_summary: Ally Financial fully believes in the power and potential of technology. Since its inception as a 100-percent digital financial institution, the Detroit, Michigan–based company has specialized in innovative digital banking experiences. Ally regularly pushes conventional boundaries on behalf of its corporate, commercial, and consumer customers. To that end, the company has decided to use Microsoft Azure Quantum resources, including new algorithms and future quantum hardware, to improve operations and tackle highly complex issues beyond the industry’s reach with traditional computing.
products: Microsoft Azure Quantum Elements

title: Pioneering “robotic quarterback” uses Windows, Azure ecosystems to solve developer dilemmas—and cut a year off time to market
executive_summary: When sports robotics company Monarc wanted to create what it calls “the world’s first robotic quarterback,” it adopted the Windows and Microsoft Azure ecosystems to do so. Its product, called “the Seeker,” combines AI, the Internet of Things, programmability, and more to enable football players to practice a full playbook by themselves. Why Windows and Azure? Monarc brought the Seeker to market up to a year sooner than it could have with other operating system and development tools, plus it maintains greater choice and flexibility in evolving the product and even runs Linux containers on it. “With Windows, we’re not missing out on anything,” says a company cofounder.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Internet of Things, SQL Server, Windows for IoT

title: Collaboration soars at Manchester Airports Group after it chooses Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: Manchester Airports Group (MAG) is the UK's largest group of airports, operating at Manchester, London Stansted and East Midlands Airports. Collectively, the Group's catchment area covers 70% of the UK population and operates some of the UK's busiest airports.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Teams Phone, Surface Go, Surface Hub, Surface Pen, Surface

title: Hawaiʻi DOT improves meeting collaboration with Microsoft Teams and Surface Hub 2S
executive_summary: Hawaiʻi’s Department of Transportation (DOT) has adopted innovative technology to keep citizens safe during emergencies and to conduct efficient internal meetings. With more staff working remotely, the department found that managing communication was a significant challenge. The Hawaiʻi DOT chose Microsoft Surface Hub 2S to improve security and provide a meeting solution that is easier for everyone to use. Now, the department conducts fewer, more efficient meetings, maintains seamless communication with staff and managers, and is eyeing opportunities for further improvement.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms

title: Visma: paving the way for the decade of AI with Microsoft’s skilling initiative
executive_summary: Norwegian software provider Visma has seen steady growth since it was established in 1996. Today, it acquires around 50 companies a year, providing a delicate balance of autonomy and support to the businesses that join its network. To ensure that it continues to provide cutting-edge services to its 1.5 million customers, skilling and competency development are key pillars of its operational model. Launched in 2020, a Microsoft skilling initiative is helping Visma provide development opportunities for employees across its network – ensuring the company remains on the front foot for the decade ahead.
products: Azure, GitHub

title: EFG Hermes trades 160 times faster with revamped Direct Market Access platform based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The leading investment bank franchise in frontier and emerging markets (FEM) EFG Hermes’ operates in 12 countries across four continents, delivering innovative financial products and services. To further improve the trading experience, Chief Information Officer at EFG Hermes, Mohamed Fathy,led a company-wide digital transformation. By revamping the firm’s Direct Market Access (DMA) platform on Microsoft Azure, the company managed to sped up its trading processes, increased turnover of DMA trading orders by 45%, and built the right foundation to scale up.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Metso: fostering a culture of online inclusion and diversity using Microsoft Accessibility Tools and Microsoft Unified Support
executive_summary: Finnish manufacturing company Metso puts its people at the heart of all it does. As part of this mission, the company recently launched a series of Unified Support training courses that aim at driving awareness on Microsoft’s Accessibility tools and how they can make the workplace more inclusive – both online and offline.

title: Wibmo strengthens security posture with Zero Trust powered by Microsoft
executive_summary: Wibmo is a full-stack PayTech company delivering state-of-the-art solutions to make digital payments simple, secure, and fast. It is an industry leader in emerging markets and offers solutions for mobile payments, fraud and risk management, prepaid services, and a host of merchant and acquiring services. Wibmo holds PCI DSS, PCI-3DS, PCI-SSLC, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, GDPR, and SOC 2 certifications for security and privacy. Founded in Cupertino, CA, in 1999 and a subsidiary of PayU, Wibmo has strategic partnerships with over 160+ banks across 30+ countries. Furthermore, it is the largest authentication service provider in India, which is one of the world's leading digital payment markets.
products: Microsoft 365 E5

title: DocuWare builds innovative workflow business with reliability backed by Unified
executive_summary: DocuWare, a leading provider of document management and workflow automation tools, migrated its services to Azure in 2014. Working with Microsoft Unified, it has been able to provide reliable service its customers rely on while adding innovative features. As a result, its business grew 20 percent in 2022.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Live where you want, work fulfilled; Microsoft 365 E5 supports NTT Com’s Remote Standard System
executive_summary: In July 2022, NTT Communications Corporation (NTT Com) launched a Remote Standard System (RSS) that allows employees to work from anywhere in Japan. As a Center of Excellence for Microsoft Sentinel, SOC Prime helps extended detection and response organizations like Quzara focus on their customers. The school built a state-of-the-art Microsoft Azure learning lab for students and faculty, creating a hands-on “sandbox” learning environment that offers practical experience and affordable access. title: ​​New standalone company Haleon minimizes cloud migration disruptions, halves SAP hosting costs running on Azure​
executive_summary: A few years ago, Haleon was the consumer healthcare division of global biopharma company GlaxoSmithKline (GSK). Now, it’s a fully independent company, spun off from GSK with an established brand portfolio. To get to this point, Haleon had to make the right IT decisions to stand on its own feet and operate from day one. Drawing on previous work with Microsoft, the company completed a successful holistic migration of its SAP and Oracle systems to Microsoft Azure within a highly ambitious 18-month timeline. Haleon now uses it to run the company’s business-critical production and manufacturing ERP environments. With Azure, Haleon’s multidimensional path to maturity has generated significant cost savings and reduced system downtime to a few minutes per quarter, and the company continues to work with Microsoft on future growth opportunities.

It now pushes out 183% more monthly system releases and has a robust, reliable platform to support the latest banking products and services for financial institutions.

title: Georgia Tech is accelerating the future of electric vehicles using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Dr. Omar Asensio, an Associate Professor at Georgia Tech and Visiting Fellow at Harvard Business School, leverages Microsoft's Azure OpenAI Service to enhance the electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure. By analyzing global EV charging behavior data in 72 languages, Asensio's team uncovers insights crucial for policy development and infrastructure improvement. Their work addresses the key challenge of consumer confidence in public charging stations, a significant barrier to EV adoption. Utilizing AI, the team achieves rapid data classification and predictive modeling, highlighting the reliability of networked chargers over non-networked ones. This approach promises scalable, cost-effective solutions for improving EV infrastructure, contributing to environmental sustainability and equitable access to EV technology.

title: Voices of the future: CTI's journey in AI-powered language education
executive_summary: The Chinese Testing International Company Limited (CTI), established in 2007, specializes in international Chinese language education and test services, with HSK as its flagship brand. CTI has over 1,000 certified teachers and focuses on a learner-centered approach. Since 2021, CTI has partnered with Microsoft Research Asia and Microsoft Azure AI Speech, establishing 1,330 test centers in 162 countries, serving over 50 million learners. They aim to integrate AI with Chinese language education, developing advanced tools like facial recognition and intelligent assessment. Using Azure AI Speech Services, CTI created the Learn Pronunciation to HSK application, providing instant pronunciation feedback to learners. This collaboration has resulted in a mobile Chinese pronunciation learning classroom, enhancing educational experiences with consistent and accurate evaluations.

Based in the idyllic town of Neumarkt in the German state of Bavaria, this SME markets its herbal remedies in more than 40 countries. Bionorica’s corporate goal is clear: growth. They were not able to take field trips, travel with their families, explore cities with their friends, or any of the other essential experiences that help formulate social and communal connections foundational to a student’s experience.

In addition, the company has established a personnel system for masters of caretaking with high expertness and practices as “MAJI-kami” (MAJI-kami system) and driven forward their effort to apply it to develop human resources. Recently, the company started a development of ”MAJI-Kami AI” solution, in which they combine enormous data stored in Ser-navi and various sensor data which were just started to introduce into nursing homes, as well as MAJI-kami system. We interviewed the persons in charge to learn how do they try to turn the “findings” of MAJI-kami into knowledge and how do they try to materialize them at sites.

For educators in the Milton Area School District, located in Central Pennsylvania, these challenges opened opportunities to explore and use technologies that improve literacy and fluency in their students. They turned to Microsoft Reading Progress, a program that uses artificial intelligence driven assessments to empower students to read, improve, and grow their skills—both on their own and with targeted aid from their teacher.
