The company is improving patient outcomes by helping clinicians move beyond 2D medical imaging. Augmented reality is the cornerstone of this effort, and MediView has partnered with Microsoft to deploy the Microsoft HoloLens 2 headset in healthcare settings. Using MediView technology, clinicians report increased confidence during procedures and less physical strain, and remote collaboration services could make minimally invasive procedures more widely accessible. MediView’s innovative mixed-reality imaging solutions are a testament to how its partnership with Microsoft is changing healthcare.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, Dynamics CRM, HoloLens

title: Gluwa uses blockchain to help investors fund loans to the unbanked
executive_summary: Gluwa with Creditcoin are bringing banking to emerging, underserved markets with a reliable, scalable cloud solution built on Microsoft Azure.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Container Instances, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Functions, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Load Balancer, Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Database, Azure Storage

title: Marlo Farma makes pet care and veterinary pharmaceuticals distribution a walk in the park with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For three decades, Marlo Farma, Serbia's top distributor of pet food and veterinary pharmaceuticals, has been innovating and growing. But its previous ERP system struggled to keep pace, causing purchase inaccuracies and decreasing customer satisfaction. Working with Microsoft partner GoPro, Marlo Farma migrated to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. The result: a 30 percent rise in logistics and warehouse efficiency, real-time insights supporting decision-making, and most importantly, happier customers and healthier pets.
products: AppSource, Dynamics 365 Business Central, Microsoft Teams, Office 365, Power BI

title: Designers Resource connects sales, finance, and operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Designers Resource Textile Pvt Ltd, an Indian home textile leader, addressed challenges in order fulfillment and remote work during the pandemic by adopting Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. This solution streamlined operations, connecting sales, finance, and operations seamlessly. General Manager Navin Sankhala attests to its value, citing improved management and streamlined operations. Results include a 15 percent operational cost reduction and a 20 percent sales increase.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Business Central

title: STERNET brings visibility, collaboration, and speed with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: STERNET, a Polish distributor and factory service of electric drives and industrial automation, decided to modernize its customer relationship management (CRM) and take advantage of the cloud. It partnered with OneDynamics to implement Dynamics 365 Sales. For STERNET, it was crucial to identify a global-standard solution that would evolve alongside the company and serve as a wellspring of inspiration.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Dynamics CRM, Microsoft 365, Power BI

title: Protocall realizes 45% cost savings with migration to Microsoft Azure environment designed and managed by Atmosera
executive_summary: A national provider of telephonic crisis services and digital tools for behavioral health, Protocall Services (Protocall) is on a multistage cloud migration to improve the reliability, security, and scalability of its infrastructure. On-premises and colocated systems no longer provided the performance or agility Protocall needed. Protocall reached out to Microsoft partner Atmosera to design and manage a new environment based on Microsoft Azure. Protocall’s migration has made it more agile and secure, with virtually 100% application infrastructure uptime. Many of Protocall’s business processes are simpler, and Atmosera’s continuous management of the Azure environment allows Protocall to focus on its mission: helping people in need.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Developer Tools, Microsoft Intune

title: Sasfin Bank enhances legal team with Azure-based, AI-powered Contract Corridor solution
executive_summary: Sasfin Bank Limited's Group Legal team, headed by Howard Brown, embarked on a transformation journey to enhance the bank’s legal operations. Taking document management head-on, Sasfin Bank’s legal team found a game-changing solution in Legal Interact's Contract Corridor. Built on Microsoft Azure, the platform doesn't just centralize 20,000 documents; it also uses artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze contract clauses, making post-signature management a breeze. Questions like 'What does this confidentiality clause mean?' are instantly answered, while Power BI dashboards provide real-time snapshots, moving from guesswork into data-driven decision-making.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: PTT Global Chemical solves office work issues ‘in one go’ with Microsoft Copilot and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: PTT Global Chemical (GC) is making strides in transforming its internal processes and empowering its employees to deliver value to customers fast. With Microsoft Copilot, the company transformed taking meeting minutes and assigning action items, streamlining what used to take hours into mere minutes. With an internal generative artificial intelligence (AI) built with Azure OpenAI Service, analyzing documents has become a breeze, saving employees a full workday.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft 365 Copilot

title: Gasunie: driving sustainability and efficiency in the Dutch energy sector with Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Dutch energy network operator Gasunie is a key energy player in the Netherlands and beyond. Traditionally a gas provider, the company is on a mission to drive more sustainable resources, such as hydrogen, and facilitate the European energy transition. To do that, Gasunie has built an intelligent data platform and put it at the heart of its data-driven activities – making it the single source of truth for insights to support daily operations. Powered by Microsoft, the platform has already proven a game-changer at the company. It’s helping the market to get better insights into the import and export of gas flows and filling degree of connected gas storages, but also to improve heat efficiency for the LNG Terminal (EemsEnergyTerminal) that the company recently built in the north of The Netherlands. All with a view to making the data platform play a central role in supporting the energy transition.
products: Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Synapse Analytics, Intelligent Data Platform, Power BI

title: Poloplast reimagines forecasting with demand planning in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
executive_summary: Austrian pipe manufacturer Poloplast was among the first Microsoft customers to participate in the preview of the new demand planning feature for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Built on the Power Platform, Demand planning empowers everyone to take a low-code approach to demand modeling and provides an intuitive user experience for reporting and analysis. Today, the business has made the forecasting process more user-friendly and collaborative, extended its outlook from three months to one and a half years, and reduced storage costs significantly due to more precise purchasing.
products: Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

title: Veradigm develops self-service healthcare chatbot "Billerbot" with Azure AI
executive_summary: Veradigm is a top provider of healthcare data and tech solutions for payers, providers, and life sciences—including billing services via its Practice Fusion EHR platform. It was fielding high volumes of basic medical billing questions. To help customers get faster answers, Veradigm used Azure AI Search, Azure OpenAI Service, and more in a Zammo.ai software solution to develop Billerbot. The generative AI–powered self-help chatbot is programmed to field basic queries about medical terms, processes, and billing.

title: Real estate investment trust Host Hotels transforms data into actionable business insights using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Host Hotels & Resorts’ IT team faced the efficiency and cost-benefit challenges of an outdated datacenter running legacy software. The infrastructure needed constant maintenance to stay current with the latest security and compliance specifications for a publicly traded Fortune 500 company. The decision to switch to Microsoft Azure cloud services has been a gamechanger. The organization has achieved major gains in resiliency, security and compliance, in addition to remote work capability. And Host’s IT team has been freed up to contribute to the company’s bottom line by providing critical, real-time data that informs business decisions and keeps the organization ahead of its competition.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure SQL Database, Azure Site Recovery, Microsoft 365

title: Microsoft Azure gives Capital on Tap the agility needed for global expansion
executive_summary: Capital on Tap began from the starting point that small business owners are the foundation for growth in our economy, and yet today’s banking system has left them behind. By the end of 2020, Capital on Tap was again expanding out its Microsoft Azure services to support its launch into the US market. Capital on Tap is now focused on optimisation: upgrading VMs to increase performance without adding cost and gradually moving away from VMs altogether. This move to a serverless architecture wasn’t an option before.
products: Azure

title: Enabling Remote Learning During the Pandemic
executive_summary: Classera main challenge is the need for fully remote work of Classera employees due to Covid-19 pandemic and beyond. Microsoft applications and solutions are catalysts to connect our teams across five branches to work together with high level of efficiency and teamwork spirit.
products: Azure, Microsoft Graph, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Outlook

title: San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency boosts citizen services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: San Francisco’s 874,000 residents and 26 million visitors rely on the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency (SFMTA) to get where they’re going safely. The agency, established by voter mandate in 1999, works to connect San Francisco through a safe, equitable, and sustainable transportation system. Driven by a need to centralize its data and reduce administrative bottlenecks, the SFMTA partnered with Microsoft to build a serverless data solution—centered on Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics—that it has used to unify disparate data, streamline processes, and gain insights and efficiencies.
products: Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Washington State’s King County uses Azure to help secure resident health data—and make lives better
executive_summary: King County is Washington State’s most populous county, with more than 2.2 million residents. For the Department of Community and Human Services, ensuring that these residents have access to critical social and health services is top of mind. Hampered by siloed systems, tools, and modes of data collection, the county turned to Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics to create a unified data platform that delivers a more holistic view of data, faster access to data, and a clearer picture of public health metrics.
products: Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Pakistani footwear and tyre tube manufacturer unlocks holistic view of retail business with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Established more than 50 years ago, Servis Industries Limited (SIL) is a leading manufacturer and exporter in Pakistan. To achieve its goal of becoming a global, world-class, and diversified company, SIL moved its on-premises infrastructure to cloud. By adopting Dynamics 365 Finance, Supply Chain Management, and Commerce, the company now has a holistic overview of its retail stores and an infrastructure management system that can support rapid national and international growth.
products: Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: The food tech company reducing global food waste with cloud technology
executive_summary: LMK Group is a Nordic food tech company that delivers a large variety of meals directly to its customers’ doors. As part of its work, the company is on a pioneering mission to reduce global food waste and drive sustainability across the grocery retail sector. To do this, LMK has been using cloud technology to optimize its processes, provide customized options for its clients and ultimately become a fully data-driven company.
products: Azure API Management, Azure App Service

title: Reinsure globally, analyze locally: Munich Re relies on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As a leading global provider of reinsurance, Munich Re needs to maintain a clear view of the risk situation and trends worldwide. As such, big data analyses on a grand scale are nothing new for the company. However, restrictive laws on data storage around the world were presenting challenges. At the same time, Munich Re was seeking to further increase its rate of innovation and operate in even closer proximity to its global customers by spreading its in-house analytics know-how more widely. This is why Munich Re moved its data analyses to the Microsoft Azure Cloud.
products: Azure, Azure Databricks, Power BI

title: How Liberty University is fighting COVID-19 using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: At Liberty University in Lynchburg, Virginia, a mechanical engineering team received a Microsoft AI for Health COVID-19 grant that provided access to Microsoft Azure Cloud, Microsoft High-Performance Computing (HPC) capabilities, and Microsoft AI for Health data science experts. The grant helped them study how a new respiratory therapy device can help COVID-19 patients and their caregivers.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Walgreens empowers pharmacists with an intelligent prescription data platform on Azure
executive_summary: Walgreens processes hundreds of millions of prescription dispenses a year across nearly 9,000 stores, and each transaction has hundreds of associated data points. Using Microsoft Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and other Azure resources, the company created an intelligent data platform that can quickly process data from prescription dispenses and create valuable insights within minutes, not only for pharmacists who are serving customers but also for operations and analytics teams across the company. This immediate access to rich transactional data and insights, whether generated 10 seconds ago or 10 years ago, changes the way that pharmacists and other decision makers use data and conduct business.
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Intelligent Data Platform, Power BI

title: Maccabi Healthcare Services streamlines and secures daily workflows with Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: With over 70 years’ history, Maccabi Healthcare Services is Israel’s second-largest healthcare maintenance organization (HMO). It provides both insurance and primary healthcare services to its over 2.4 million members. Needing a more secure and efficient way to manage critical healthcare-related communication and workflows, Maccabi turned to Microsoft Teams and Power Apps. Today, healthcare workers and their patients are benefitting from a more streamlined and efficient approach to patient onboarding, case handovers, and homecare visits, dramatically improving the healthcare experience.
products: Forms, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps

title: REI connects with customers for virtual outfitting to create a personalized experience using Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: With their highly identifiable green vest and expert knowledge of outdoor apparel and gear, retail employees at REI Co-op are hard to miss. The largest consumer co-op in the United States has more than 170 locations across 41 states and 12,000 green vests, as its sales floor employees are called, all connected by a love of the outdoors. Green vests are on hand to help the co-op’s 20 million members find just the right gear to make their outdoor pursuits a success, but everyone, not just members, can benefit from shopping with the specialty retailer.
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Graph, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, SharePoint Online, Microsoft Viva Engage, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Teams Phone

title: Mitsubishi Electric boosts connection among employees, speeds digital business transformation with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Mitsubishi Electric celebrated its 100-year anniversary by stepping up the transformation of its business model and business style, and is taking action on many fronts to achieve next-level growth. As part of those efforts, the company adopted Microsoft 365 to start building the Mitsubishi Electric Global IT Platform Service for its employees around the world. By April 2020, the global IT platform had evolved to facilitate easy communication and collaboration within the company, and Mitsubishi Electric employees now transcend organizational boundaries and physical distances by using Microsoft Teams and Surface devices.
products: Azure, HoloLens, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online, Microsoft Viva Engage, Power BI, Surface

title: CCBPI accelerates business and drives performance with Sales Capability tool
executive_summary: Coca-Cola Beverages Philippines (CCBPI) manufactures and distributes soft drinks and other consumer beverages in the Philippines. The bottler recognized that it needed to make better use of its data to lower costs and increase efficiency. Lingaro delivered a data and analytics solution that helped CCBPI overcome its data challenges via a Microsoft Power BI report solution powered by Azure. The Sales Capability tool from Lingaro provides easily accessed actionable insights that enable CCBPI to accelerate its business. The bottler has also realized substantial savings through automating data injection processes and eliminating manual work.
products: Azure, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Coca-Cola bottler SLMG Beverages adopts Dynamics 365 for business integration and operational efficiencies
executive_summary: SLMG Beverages Pvt. Ltd (SLMG) was formed in the year 2017 and is one of the premier companies of the LADHANI GROUP. The main objective behind the formation of SLMG was to combine their four legacy beverages units operations with the new business (new territory) acquired from Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages Pvt Ltd (HCCBPL) as a single company towards managing their bottling and beverages operations in a more efficient manner.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance, Power BI

title: ÖBB expands its business and improves time to market using Azure
executive_summary: Technical Story
products: Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Kubernetes Service

title: Kuwait’s National Aviation Services (NAS) powers a safe return to air travel with Azure
executive_summary: Present in numerous airports from Morocco to India, Kuwaiti National Aviation Services (NAS) is committed to enabling air travel that is both safe and stress-free. To help power the resumption of key flights amid the pandemic, NAS pioneered a forward-thinking mobile platform on Azure through its airport technology arm ICT.aero that specializes in the sourcing and development of solutions. Not only does the platform ensure strict COVID-19 testing compliance and identity verification, it also keeps travelers informed of all government requirements. So far, more than eight hundred thousand travelers have taken advantage of the mobile solution for a safe and seamless journey.
products: Azure

title: Galadari Food and Beverage modernizes cash collection with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Galadari Food and Beverage (GFAB), a part of the Galadari Brothers Group, operates the largest network of food & beverage (F&B) stores in the Gulf region. With activities soaring, its manual cash collection system was strained. The company then created the Cash in Motion app on Microsoft Power Platform to enhance collection and transparency. With this, GFAB can now monitor and track cash movement via real-time notifications. The company plans to expand operational fluidity across other Galadari businesses with more automation using Power Platform.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Power Apps, Power BI

title: All from a single source: all4cloud relies on the Microsoft Teams platform and partner Telekom
executive_summary: Do not simply introduce software, but live and think in processes: this is the goal pursued by all4cloud. The IT service provider has already helped around 200 customers migrate to the cloud, the majority of them Small and Medium Enterprises from every sector imaginable—from circular connector suppliers right over to frozen pizza producers. They all have one thing in common: a desire to reorganize their processes. This is where all4cloud comes in. The SAP partner now relies on Microsoft Teams and partner Telekom for communicating externally with customers and collaborating internally among employees.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Step by step into a digitalized future: Liebherr-Hausgeräte turns to Dynamics 365
executive_summary: What do caterers and laboratories have in common? They both work with products that have to be stored at very specific temperatures. In order to demonstrate compliance, caterers and lab technicians have to maintain temperature logs. Smart refrigerators from Liebherr‑Hausgeräte maintain these logs practically unaided and sound an alarm if the temperature rises above or falls below the recommended level. This is just one of the many ways in which Liebherr‑Hausgeräte harnesses digitalization. When it comes to comprehensive customer support, Dynamics 365 provides the basis for a strong, consistent CRM.
products: Dynamics 365

title: "Trailblazing: a new digital & integrated approach to the student record system at TEDI-London".
executive_summary:
TEDI-London is a new higher education provider for future engineers, founded by Arizona State University, King's College London and UNSW Sydney. It will accept its first student cohort in September 2021, welcoming them to a newly built campus in London’s Canada Water.

In October 2019, TEDI-London’s CIO, David Minahan, was in the unusual position of being able to define and implement a best practice digital strategy and a new student record system without being having to deal with any legacy constraints.
products: Dynamics 365, Power Apps

title: Professional services firm, Wipfli, uses Microsoft Azure to stay ahead of the competition
executive_summary: The accounting and consulting industry is incredibly competitive. Acquisitions are common, and the pressure to rapidly deliver innovative services drives competition. After a series of acquisitions, and with the impact of COVID-19 on remote work, Wipfli needed a cloud solution to consolidate its existing platforms and provide much-needed speed and agility to its client service and development teams. The large professional services provider chose Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI, Microsoft Viva Insights

title: Kruger boosts employee productivity in factories using HoloLens 2 and Dynamics 365 Guides
executive_summary: North American paper products and energy specialist Kruger is nearly 120 years old, but the company takes a modern approach to technology, giving employees innovative tools to make them more confident and effective in their work. With Microsoft HoloLens 2 and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides, Kruger is bringing its factory handbook to life using sophisticated features like spatial triggers and branching to guide the employee where the work happens.
products: Dynamics 365 Guides, HoloLens

title: Children’s hospital makes every moment count with help from Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Annae Barney Gorman, a philanthropist and community activist, lived her life in “the relentless pursuit of optimal health for every child.” What she started back in 1919 as a small health services center for residents of North Dayton, Ohio, has evolved into one of only 31 freestanding children’s hospitals in the United States today. More than 400 physicians, 1,000 nurses, and 2,000 staff are at the heart of Dayton Children’s Hospital’s vision of reinventing the path to children's health for families throughout the region and beyond. The hospital’s employees believe that each moment counts in how they interact with their patients, families, and each other. There were more than 384,000 visits in 2019, and all of them were key moments in unique patient journeys that are now better understood with the help of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.
products: Azure, Azure Storage, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Power Apps

title: Microsoft Power Platform transforms engagement center process to deliver faster impact for animal health
executive_summary: Patterson Companion Animal Health Division provides everything a veterinarian needs to run their business and help their furry and non-furry patients. This includes sourcing specially requested items, which was a manual and inconsistent process. The process ultimately led to SKU proliferation, dead stock, and inflated inventory levels. Microsoft Power Automate generates emails throughout the process, proactively providing status, helpful details, and final decision. Mapping the process highlighted opportunities for improvement that were addressed and automated. This has reduced the number of items being set up unnecessarily—saving time and ongoing maintenance.
products: Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: The tower in the cloud: Lufthansa Systems secures applications in the new cloud infrastructure with Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Aviation is about so much more than the colossal metal tubes that somehow manage to take to the sky. In the cockpit, in the cabin and on the ground, digital processes and solutions play a vital role in the industry. And wherever digital solutions are used to define processes, a maximum level of data security and system stability has to be ensured. Lufthansa Systems is setting new standards here with the Global Aviation Cloud, the cloud delivery platform developed specifically to meet the needs and security standards of airlines. Cloud-based hosting guarantees the global availability of its applications, while Microsoft Sentinel keeps watch over the many solutions deployed by its customers. This allows any security gaps to be quickly identified and closed.
products: Azure, Microsoft Sentinel

title: NHVR enhancing safety for all road users
executive_summary: The National Heavy Vehicle Regulator (NHVR) is Australia's independent regulator for heavy vehicles with a gross vehicle mass greater than 4.5 tonnes. The NHVR collaborates with states and territories, industries, partner agencies, and local governments to drive sustainable improvements to safety, productivity, and efficiency across the Australian heavy vehicle road transport sector. COMtrac's Azure-driven platform for case, evidence, and digital brief management has enhanced NHVR's investigations, delivering increased transparency and consistency. This has improved efficiency in investigations and led to improved road safety.
products: Azure

title: Valmont Coatings redefines customer service and operations efficiency with Azure
executive_summary: Valmont Coatings realized its on-premises job shop system for tracking customers and customer orders was holding back improvements in efficiency and customer satisfaction. Existing systems were different for customers and employees, which also made it hard to share information and track projects. To address these issues, Valmont replaced its entire on-premises business systems with Azure cloud-based services that provide a consistent experience for customers and employees. The new system has improved security, visibility, tracking, reporting, and flexibility and also streamlines production processes. This has led to measurable increases in customer satisfaction while providing a foundation for future growth.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure SQL Database, Azure Service Bus, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: Inail simplifies Italian citizens' access to online services with Microsoft Power Apps, Dynamics 365 and other Microsoft technologies
executive_summary: The Italian National Institute for Insurance against Accidents at Work (Inail) is a government entity that serves Italy’s workers, providing them with protections and advocacy at work. Inail wanted to simplify access to its services and support citizens remotely, so it worked with Microsoft and Microsoft Partner Network members Accenture and Avanade to build Sportello Digitale. Sportello Digitale is an intuitive online app built on Microsoft Power Apps, Dynamics 365, Teams, and Viva that helps citizens quickly and easily connect with Inail employees. Since the app’s launch, no citizen who has made an appointment online through Sportello Digitale has needed a second appointment to provide additional details on their case, and Inail has benefitted as well with reduced the costs, labor, and time spent resolving cases.
products: Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva, Power Apps

title: Confluent delivers enhanced data privacy, opens new opportunities with Azure Private Link
executive_summary: For many organizations, operationalizing data at this level would require significant infrastructure expansion, but Confluent does that work for them by delivering a fully managed, cloud data-in-motion software as a service (SaaS) platform, built on Apache Kafka and more securely and optimally accessed with Microsoft Azure Private Link. To provide the value of cloud-backed, real-time data for risk-averse customers, particularly those in highly regulated industries or with other increased security requirements, Confluent uses Azure Private Link to help maintain the privacy and integrity of any customer’s digital network. It chose Private Link to help minimize the complexity of connecting virtual networks in the public cloud and simplify highly secure connectivity for all types of customers.
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Private Link, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Blesi & Papa: Modern workplace with the highest security standards
executive_summary: A state-of-the-art IT infrastructure can support flexible working methods and meet the highest security standards. For the law firm Blesi & Papa, the security of their client data was a top priority. Scheuss & Partner supported the law firm in migrating its data and applications to the cloud. Little has changed in the way Blesi & Papa employees work, but the new IT solution delivers greater flexibility and security. Security has been significantly increased through a number of sophisticated features that provide several layers of data protection. The concept is centered around the individual users, who are protected by their logins.
products: Microsoft 365

title: bp advances net zero goals with the help of the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Data is integral to bp’s purpose of reimagining energy for people and the planet, including the ability to access and share data across the company in a more safe, secure, and reliable way. Microsoft’s Intelligent Data Platform brings together data from multiple cloud and on-premises sources, with Azure Synapse, advanced analytics, and IoT services to accelerate production of data products and train AI and machine learning models at scale. These capabilities also help bp track and manage carbon emissions and support its ambition to become a net zero company by 2050 or sooner and help the world achieve a net zero status.
products: Azure, Azure Digital Twins, Intelligent Data Platform

title: International Organization for Migration better able to support migrants in crisis with help from cloud-based solutions
executive_summary: IOM had three on-premises datacenters and 500 old, overprovisioned virtual machines (VMs). Security, backups, and monitoring relied on systems administrators for oversight and deployment. Networking and hardware problems in IOM datacenters caused unplanned outages, some of which significantly disrupted operations, and data security was a concern. IOM soon realized that it needed strategic partners to achieve its goal, and after careful planning and risk mitigation, the agency chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform. Before IOM’s cloud implementation, it wasn’t possible to follow individual migrants in terms of travel, health, and protection support. With cloud computing, however, IOM will soon have far more personal insights and even be able to interact with and directly support migrants.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Site Recovery

title: The tower in the cloud: Lufthansa Systems secures applications in the new cloud infrastructure with Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Aviation is about so much more than the colossal metal tubes that somehow manage to take to the sky. In the cockpit, in the cabin and on the ground, digital processes and solutions play a vital role in the industry. And wherever digital solutions are used to define processes, a maximum level of data security and system stability has to be ensured. Lufthansa Systems is setting new standards here with the Global Aviation Cloud, the cloud delivery platform developed specifically to meet the needs and security standards of airlines. Cloud-based hosting guarantees the global availability of its applications, while Microsoft Sentinel keeps watch over the many solutions deployed by its customers. This allows any security gaps to be quickly identified and closed.
products: Azure, Microsoft Sentinel

executive_summary: The National Heavy Vehicle Regulator (NHVR) is Australia's independent regulator for heavy vehicles with a gross vehicle mass greater than 4.5 tonnes. The NHVR collaborates with states and territories, industries, partner agencies, and local governments to drive sustainable improvements to safety, productivity, and efficiency across the Australian heavy vehicle road transport sector. executive_summary: The Italian National Institute for Insurance against Accidents at Work (Inail) is a government entity that serves Italy’s workers, providing them with protections and advocacy at work. Inail wanted to simplify access to its services and support citizens remotely, so it worked with Microsoft and Microsoft Partner Network members Accenture and Avanade to build Sportello Digitale. Sportello Digitale is an intuitive online app built on Microsoft Power Apps, Dynamics 365, Teams, and Viva that helps citizens quickly and easily connect with Inail employees. title: Global food retailer promotes collaboration across its enterprise with Teams and Teams Rooms systems
executive_summary: With 54 million customers making virtual and in-person visits to the 7,137 grocery stores that its brands operate in Europe, the United States, and Indonesia every week, Ahold Delhaize is a truly global operation. “We’re very committed to serving the customers who visit our brands and their supermarkets,” says Robin Albregt, Director of Global IT Solution Delivery at Ahold Delhaize. However, the global nature of the business means that serving those customers requires a connected workforce who can seamlessly collaborate no matter where they are. “With a highly diverse geographic footprint like we have, bringing people together to collaborate is really important to Ahold Delhaize,” says Mike Laurenti, Chief Information Officer at the Global Support Office of Ahold Delhaize. “One of the things that makes Ahold Delhaize special is our ability to understand best practices from one part of the company and share them broadly across the organization. Microsoft Teams is an important tool for how we do that.” Supporting that collaboration is even more pressing as Ahold Delhaize and its brands continue to embrace hybrid work. “I’m focused on making sure we’re maximizing the productivity of this hybrid way of working,” says Albregt. “To do that, we’re deploying Teams and Teams Rooms systems across our global enterprise.”

title: BSi modernizes delivery proof with KPoD digital signatures and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance, reducing errors by 80 percent
executive_summary: In the convoluted and competitive landscape of the steel distribution industry, BSi Steel, one of South Africa's leading steel distributors, faced a formidable obstacle in maintaining a precise and up-to-date record of truck deliveries to its valued customers. BSi's truck drivers relied on manual paperwork to obtain customer signatures, which served as proof of delivery. However, this outdated and inefficient process led to several challenges, including errors in data entry, time-consuming administrative tasks, and increased operational costs. To overcome these obstacles and enhance its delivery process, BSi Steel implemented KAISPE’s digital signature capture solution, KPoD, that works in tandem with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance. The result has been a streamlined delivery process, an 80 percent reduction in errors, and an overall improvement in the efficiency of BSi’s supply chain management system.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Infosys powers digital transformation of sales with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Infosys embarked on a digital sales transformation journey to be a live enterprise with agility built into the core to stay ahead of the game. With the primary objective of transforming sales experience across the entire sales cycle, it identified specific interventions across every touch point where sales operate, from lead generation to order booking, by creating a data and insight-driven ecosystem.
products: Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Power Apps, Power BI

title: ​​Arvato optimizes warehouse operations, deploys new environments within minutes using SAP on Azure​
executive_summary: Logistics provider Arvato uses interconnected Microsoft solutions, and it wants to expand to the cloud with some edge computing to maximize warehouse operations. With its latest project, Arvato sought to migrate and optimize its critical SAP systems, including its SAP S/4HANA environment. Working toward being cloud-first, the company deployed as many Microsoft resources as possible, including Azure ExpressRoute and Azure NetApp Files, to help protect against system failures or forced rollbacks in advance of its accelerated SAP on Azure go-live. With the SAP on Azure migration complete, Arvato has greatly sped up maintenance and patching time and reduced and consolidated dozens of domains. Now, it can better support clients throughout their supply chain journeys.
products: Azure, Azure Disk Storage, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: KUKA manages its robot fleets in real time with a software platform based on Azure IoT
executive_summary: Industrial robots work quickly, precisely, and almost around the clock in many fields, not just the automotive industry or electronics manufacturing. For their robot systems, automation specialist KUKA and its subsidiary Device Insight have developed the iiQoT software platform based on Microsoft Azure IoT. The platform provides important condition data in real time and enables remote monitoring of entire robot fleets. This allows efficient control of facility management, including fault monitoring and maintenance. An internal KUKA lighthouse project in the German city of Augsburg has shown that in one year of production, the platform saved 25 hours of machine downtime and administrative work.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Edge, Azure IoT Hub

title: Global aquaculture feed producer uses Microsoft Project to gain efficiencies, improve collaboration
executive_summary: Global aquaculture company BioMar wanted a change. Three departments were using an aging application to manage its product development cycle. The system was inefficient and not flexible enough to fit BioMar’s growth and product development needs. The organization sought a robust project management solution that would support its scientists and product managers to better collaborate and communicate, work more efficiently, and minimize manual processes. Today, BioMar is implementing a Microsoft-based project management solution that incorporates Microsoft Project, Power Platform, and Microsoft Teams that the company anticipates to roll out in Q1 2023.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power Automate, Project, Dataverse, Power BI

Austrade was impressed by the capabilities of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales as a CRM tool, as well as with its connectivity to Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and Marketing. This, along with price, speed, and interoperability with the Microsoft stack and Azure, made Dynamics 365 Sales the clear choice for Austrade.

executive_summary: Growing healthcare organization MultiCare Health System teamed up with Microsoft and Microsoft partner 3Cloud to meet changing demands in health data access prompted by the use of fitness trackers and phones. MultiCare wanted a scalable, interoperable data exchange framework to connect providers, patients, and payers—key for success in population health and value-based care. It also required an adaptable solution. Working with Microsoft FHIR experts and partnering with 3Cloud, MultiCare built a unique, fully managed solution using Microsoft Azure. The results have surpassed expectations: in three months, MultiCare has seen a significant reduction in administrative burden with a $50 per-chart cost savings and a 65 percent reduction in labor.

Using Azure AI infrastructure, OriGen has fast, easy access to the compute resources required to drive its NVIDIA GPU-based solutions and the means to deploy its powerful offering as a software as a service platform.

title: ABN AMRO Bank optimizes financial crime detection with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: "Banking for better, for generations to come"—this mission drives ABN AMRO Bank, a Netherlands-based financial institution committed to vigilance against financial crime. With financial crime on the rise, the bank realized that it needed a new approach to handle its vast transactional data. Embracing technology, it employed Microsoft's Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics to increase efficiency. The major improvement, however, came with the bank’s use of Azure Data Explorer (ADX). With ADX, ABN AMRO revamped its due diligence process by increasing its speed in and capacity for handling billions of transactions.
products: Azure Data Explorer, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

Old, unstandardized requests were slowing data analysis and the sharing of insights. To standardize and speed data access, PHSA moved its healthcare analytics platform to Microsoft Azure, creating a readily accessible data analysis platform that is scalable and secure. Data requests that once took many months now take only days. Because of the sensitive nature of health data, PHSA has worked closely with Microsoft to make sure health data never leaves Canada and is kept highly secure.

title: San Francisco Police Department saves officers hundreds of hours per month with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The San Francisco Police Department (SFPD), which upholds the law and protects residents in one of California’s biggest cities, used Microsoft Power Platform to create an app that helped officers more efficiently report the return of stolen cars. Initially, officers manually reported when stolen cars had been found and returned to their owners. This process took up to two hours, and delays in the system repeatedly led to unnecessary suspicion of vehicle owners. SFPD saw an opportunity to create a solution with Microsoft offerings that made the process of reporting stolen car returns near-instantaneous, ultimately saving officers hundreds of hours of driving time and reducing department costs.
products: Power Apps, Power Pages, SharePoint

title: LifeLabs® brings care closer to home with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: As Canada's largest provider of laboratory testing and management services, LifeLabs has been serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for more than 50 years. LifeLabs performs 112 million diagnostic, naturopathic, and genetic tests for more than 20 million customers annually. More than 6,500 LifeLabs employees at more than 380 Patient Service Centers (PSCs) put customers first in everything they do, earning a 90% satisfaction score. With LifeLabs MyVisit™ personalized mobile lab services powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service and Power Platform, customers can get their tests done at a time and location that fits their schedules, and then get their results online for the ultimate in convenience.

Now, providers get results more quickly, and the company has improved its total cost of ownership with the use of enduring, reliable, and effective devices.

Furthermore, the use of facial recognition enables this system to be used in a variety of ways that combine convenience and security. Going forward, this system will create services based on the experience and know-how gained through practical application within the company, under the “Client Zero” approach of NEC. Microsoft Entra Verified ID has been used for this digital employee ID system.

title: Dynamics 365 application modernization on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Microsoft’s journey modernizing its own Dynamics 365 solutions offers several key insights in how to successfully and incrementally move a highly complex set of solutions from on-premises, bare-metal servers to the cloud. The Dynamics 365 team’s continual focus on re-imagining the customer experience has empowered enterprises in many new ways, delivering an increasingly profound impact on the business and making Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform some of the fastest growing software categories for Microsoft. Today, the Dynamics 365 team can launch new products, new features, and new user experiences at a faster pace; can better understand its customers; and can more quickly solve unmet customer needs. The DNA of the Business Applications and Platforms group at Microsoft has fundamentally changed, and it shows throughout all of the group’s efforts and offerings today.

Hindalco Industries Limited is the metals flagship company of the Aditya Birla Group, an Indian multinational conglomerate. A USD28 billion metals powerhouse, Hindalco is the world’s largest aluminum company by revenues, and a significant player in the copper industry, catering to more than half of India’s copper requirements.
Headquartered in Mumbai, India, the company has a global footprint with 50 manufacturing units across ten countries.
It was named the world’s most sustainable aluminum company in the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices (DJSI) in 2020, 2021 and 2022.

title: Beiersdorf has a clear view of its sustainability progress—thanks to Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and a central data corpus
executive_summary: To set the company on a path that clearly benefits the environment and society, Beiersdorf launched its CARE BEYOND SKIN Sustainability Agenda, which features specific sustainability targets: achieve an absolute reduction of 30 percent in greenhouse gas emissions by 2025 along the entire value chain versus 2018 and make all packaging refillable, reusable, or recyclable by 2025. In order to make progress along this path transparent and measurable, precise KPIs are needed to obtain accurate data that reveals levers with maximum impact on these targets. Beiersdorf has therefore initiated a dedicated Sustainability Digitalization Program that uses a data analysis platform based on Microsoft Azure and Power Platform.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI Embedded

Dyno-Rod has one of the UK’s largest plumbing and drains forces. Its network of over 1,100 certified engineers, 54 franchisee businesses, and local support teams serves over 1 million customers per year—consistently scoring 4.7 stars out of 5 in satisfaction surveys.

Including security solutions Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Purview and Microsoft Sentinel, the new stack has successfully raised security KPIs and maturity levels across the entire company.

However, one of the tools to help with this—the company’s intranet—lacked modern functionality. In response, McCormick built a new employee portal with Microsoft Viva Connections. MKC Connect offers vibrant multimedia assets that are accessible to all employees through mobile-first technology, and its content management system enables updates to be made quickly and efficiently. Feedback has been excellent so far, and the real-time analytics in Viva Connections demonstrate the site’s growing popularity. McCormick has exciting plans to add new personalized functionality and content, giving the company a solid foundation for future growth in this key area of employee engagement.

It’s up to energy providers such as E.ON to manage this complex grid and connect all its components logically and in real time. This ties up a great deal of the workforce, whose capacity is then unavailable for other tasks. That’s why E.ON is using artificial intelligence to make its employees’ lives easier. By increasing productivity and efficiency, Copilot for Microsoft 365 is helping to transform the energy market.

It is an annual gathering of education officials, stakeholders, and partners to deep dive in assessing where the department is in terms of the set objectives. The focus is on critical topics that require engagement and better understanding, agreeing on the priorities for the year, and the Medium-Term Expenditure Framework period.
customer: National Department of Basic Education, South Africa
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Crayon boosts speed, accuracy of healthcare auditing process using Azure Machine Learning and PyTorch
executive_summary: Healthcare providers need to be able to verify that they’re maintaining the highest operating safety and efficacy standards. Those standards are set by a national accreditation organization whose surveyors, often healthcare professionals themselves, regularly visit facilities and document situations that might need to be corrected or brought back in line with the latest rules and policies. That assessment and accreditation process generates a huge amount of data, and even the most experienced surveyors struggle to keep ahead of the ongoing development of thousands of policy rules that might be relevant in any particular scenario. Vaagan and his team took on the task of fixing the issue by building a machine learning solution that could ingest text from those reports and return a top ten list of the latest associated rules with unprecedented accuracy. They used Azure technology, development tools, and services to bring that solution to fruition. Crayon customers report clear time savings with the new healthcare solution. Just as important, the solution provides consistent responses that aren’t subject to the vagaries of individual interpretation or potentially out-of-date data.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory
