executive_summary: A prominent financial corporation wanted to leave its datacenters and move its workloads to the public cloud, but it needed a custom solution that would be cost-effective and further its cloud journey. Nutanix and WEI together designed a solution that was tailored to their customer’s requirements. The solution took advantage of Nutanix Cloud Clusters on Microsoft Azure and was sold through the Microsoft commercial marketplace with a multiparty private offer. Because the Azure benefit–eligible solution was sold through the marketplace, their customer was able to count its purchase toward fulfilling its Azure consumption commitment, unlocking discounts on its cloud infrastructure.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace

title: NaturalReader’s AI text-to-speech application built on Microsoft Azure makes education accessible for millions of students
executive_summary: As a leading AI text-to-speech service provider based in Canada, NaturalReader innovates with the power of AI to improve education for millions of students globally. The integration of Microsoft 365 has made it effortless for employees to adopt and eliminated the need for custom codes, making it easier for the IT team to manage. executive_summary: Agentless cloud security pioneer Orca Security has always sought to provide exceptional service to hundreds of enterprises worldwide. It was the first security provider to integrate OpenAI’s GPT API into its solution, enabling customers to quickly respond to security alerts with AI-generated instructions. This brought about the challenge of ensuring data privacy and compliance. Orca Security bridged this gap with Azure OpenAI Service, securing customer data, guaranteeing a 99.9 percent uptime and full regulatory compliance, and backed by Microsoft's strong support.

title: PETRONAS drives quality decision-making with fast, easy access to intelligent data hub built on Azure
executive_summary: The dynamic Malaysian energy group, PETRONAS, has produced and delivered responsible and sustainable energy solutions globally since 1974. With more than 300 subsidiaries and operations in over 100 countries, PETRONAS has amassed an extensive wealth of data across its integrated value chain since its incorporation, making data a key business asset to drive strategic value. In 2020, PETRONAS embarked on its data transformation journey with the objective of making data available and accessible to everyone at the company through the Enterprise Data Hub (EDH), a unified enterprise platform supported by Microsoft Azure at the core. This platform has empowered employees with accelerated knowledge extraction and enabled enterprise analytics at scale, supporting PETRONAS’ ambition of becoming a data-driven organization.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: ASOS uses Azure AI Studio to surprise and delight young fashion lovers
executive_summary: United Kingdom–based ASOS is a destination for fashion lovers in their 20s, that continuously explores technology options to enhance the customer experience. The company delivers inspiration to its customers, along with a catalog spanning thousands of products through powerful computing capabilities and a vast recommendations engine built on Microsoft Azure. With the recent prevalence of generative AI platforms like ChatGPT, ASOS recognized a triple opportunity to expand its business model, enrich its technology infrastructure, and meet the modern tech expectations of its young customers. ASOS used Azure OpenAI Service and Azure AI prompt flow with ChatGPT language models to rapidly develop and test an Azure OpenAI-powered customer experience that helps customers discover new looks.

title: Managing documents with the help of AI: docunite ensures greater efficiency with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Managing real estate also means managing piles of documents relating to each property in a way that’s always complete, transparent, and up to date. But reality often paints a vastly different picture: files are stored in a variety of systems, and both internal and external stakeholders require their own versions of the documents at varying points in the process. That’s why docunite harnessed the potential of Azure Cognitive Services to develop a solution that bundles all the industry’s requirements and automatically processes and classifies documents. The result is greater efficiency in the kind of document management required in the real estate industry.
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: Roquette leverages Azure OpenAI Service in the age of generative AI
executive_summary: The mission of global family-owned group Roquette is to supply ingredients of natural origin to the pharmaceutical, food, nutrition and cosmetics industries. As a market leader, the company and its 10,000-strong workforce fulfills its mission by designing cutting-edge products capable of addressing society's health and nutrition challenges.

executive_summary: Founded by IIT-Delhi graduates Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal in 2015, Meesho is India’s leading e-commerce marketplace. The migration and re-platforming of its IT infrastructure, along with a significant volume of data to the cloud, took less than a year, and generated projected savings of USD3 million over the next 10 years.

Installing new charging stations can be costly and disruptive. To meet this need, a team at the Energy Production and Infrastructure Center (EPIC) at the University of North Carolina (UNC) at Charlotte developed a solution to retrofit existing streetlights for use as multi-vehicle smart charging stations. Alex Miller, a sophomore undergraduate with no previous Microsoft Azure experience, served as the team’s developer. Learning as he went along, he used Azure platform as a service (PaaS) and Internet of Things (IoT) technology to bring the project to life in less than six months.

The app is hosted entirely in Microsoft Azure for easy workflow management, fast service deployment, and scalability.

It’s a big change, and Microsoft 365 tools are at the heart of how Nationwide delivers the future of work. Today, Schleich sells its products in over 70 countries and operates locations all around the globe. To support the internationalization of its business with the right IT infrastructure, the company migrated its fragmented on-premises solution to the Azure cloud platform. The modern workplace ensures collaboration across national borders that is scalable, flexible, and has a firm focus on data security.

It also helped underpin a roadmap for future communications and collaboration innovation for related branch and corporate business processes such as mortgage renewals, expense submissions, fraud reporting, and education reimbursements.

With an emphasis on the 2-in-1 Surface Pro 7+ for ultralight business applications, Sumitomo aimed to accelerate workstyle innovation and digital transformation within the company. To distribute the devices quickly and efficiently, the program used cloud-based Windows Autopilot to set up and pre-provision devices. Key innovations supporting this agenda have included the introduction of chatbots to manage online interactions with customers, and the creation of a user-friendly platform that unifies customer data, allowing Eneco’s call center agents to make smarter decisions. The charity had no capacity or desire to build their own internal security team, so they took advantage of Softwerx’s 24/7 Managed Detection and Response (MDR) offering via the Softwerx Security Operations Centre (SOC). Kidney Research UK now enjoy affordable, eyes-on, round-the-clock, enterprise-grade security support.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Mechanical moles, digitally tweaked: TRACTO uses telemetry data in Azure to offer customers real advantages
executive_summary: How do pipelines for water and gas, or indeed fiber optic cables, get under the ground? The obvious way is by digging a trench. But TRACTO-TECHNIK GmbH & Co. KG offers a different solution—using equipment for trenchless pipe laying that doesn’t require tearing up streets and sidewalks. TRACTO has continuously refined this technology. Today, the company takes advantage of big data to offer innovative, digital solutions to customers around the world, to increase reliability, and to optimize drilling processes.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database

title: Vodafone employees achieve big productivity gains with Power Platform while maintaining high governance standards
executive_summary: Vodafone is a leading telecommunications company in Europe and Africa. As part of its strategy to streamline internal business processes, Vodafone has enabled Power Platform for all its employees and now has more than 1,000 solutions.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Modern workplace for USM: the successful switchover while employees worked from home
executive_summary: Migrating an international company to the cloud and modernizing its workplaces was a major project undertaking. The two teams from USM and Experts Inside proved with a lot of creativity and motivation how this could be done even in challenging times. While the employees were all working from home, the IT infrastructure was converted to Microsoft 365, the data was migrated to the cloud, and the various applications were successfully connected. Detailed and transparent information about the progress of the project was provided on the intranet through videos, FAQs, Quick Guides, planning boards, and various other tools. Employees are delighted at how fast and uncomplicated communication has become, and the newly gained flexibility makes everyday work much easier.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Decathlon rewards Romanian shoppers with Azure-hosted loyalty program built on ASP.NET
executive_summary: Decathlon is the largest sporting goods retailer in the world, active in 57 countries with more than 1,600 stores. In Romania, the sports retailer is present since 2009, having more than 28 physical stores plus the online platform, and reaching 1500 employees in 2021. Needing a more effective way to engage, retain, and reward its thousands of Romanian customers, the company turned to Azure and ASP.NET as the foundations for its loyalty program. Thanks to instant data available Decathlon is tapping into the key insights it needs to provide industry-leading service that keeps customers coming back.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database

title: Microsoft HoloLens streamlines operations for Centrica Storage as they transition to net zero
executive_summary: Centrica plc is a British multinational energy and services company that supplies electricity and gas to consumers in the United Kingdom and Ireland. Throughout 2020, it has worked on a ground-breaking project in conjunction with the Net Zero Technology Centre and mixed reality specialist VISR Dynamics. Together, with the support of Microsoft, this Connected Frontline Worker Consortium has explored mixed reality and its ability to support transformation within the industry, both to drive process optimisation, safety, productivity and efficiency and to support the transition to net zero. The project uncovered numerous benefits as the team worked to explore the potential of full-scale adoption of mixed reality in the energy sector.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Central, Microsoft Teams

title: Rimac Technology gains scale and speed with Azure HPC and AMD
executive_summary: Some of the greatest ideas were born in humble garages. Airplanes, rock-and-roll, and that longest of longshots, the personal computer, all ignited full-on revolutions. So, Mate Rimac felt in good company when he set out to design and build the world’s most powerful and advanced electric vehicle in his own garage in Croatia. He knew plenty of doubters—people who told him it would be impossible to create a brand-new car company in a country with such a small automotive industry—but Rimac wanted to revolutionize the industry from the ground up, so he knew it didn’t matter where he started.
products: Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Microsoft Azure brings agility, resilience and sustainability benefits for Aster
executive_summary: Aster Group supplies a wide range of housing options in response to the housing crisis, working towards its vision of ensuring everyone has a home. The not-for-dividend business was established in 1990 and has £2 billion worth of assets. It plans to invest £2.5 billion to deliver 12,000 new homes by 2030. Aster reinvests profits from open market sale and shared ownership to support the development of affordable rented homes. It owns and maintains over 34,500 homes and employs more than 1,720 people.
products: Azure, Azure Migrate, Azure Virtual Desktop, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID

title: USC’s Viterbi iPodia Program invests in collaborative hybrid learning to break down barriers in traditional education with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Educating tomorrow’s visionaries and leaders requires a new learning paradigm in today’s increasingly connected but more diverse world. Traditional e-learning, focusing on delivering lectures by faculty, limits students’ learning experiences and confines them to local campus resources. However, good learning happens anywhere and anytime. And great learning occurs when students work together with their global classmates as local peers—the goal of the new iLearning paradigm.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Top pizza chain slices through data recovery spend with Azure
executive_summary: When the company started, the total cost of ownership, in addition to all the branch offices’ equipment, was quite high. In the end, the company chose to move three branch offices and the company datacenter to Azure. As a result, the total cost of ownership has met the 30 percent spend decrease expectation, and the DR time has reduced from 30 days to just a few hours.
products: Azure, Azure Migrate

title: Storm Technology Ltd enables growth-ready CRM with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: SalesSense International Ltd provide a range of customer services sales and advisory programs through its Sales-Oriented-Service/Service-Oriented-Sales (S.O.S.) methodology. The company sought to formalise its commitment to delivering excellence to clients. Key to realising this objective was the introduction of a modern CRM solution, and to that end, SalesSense decided that the solution from Storm Technology Ltd—powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365—was the right fit for its operating model. The solution’s business process flow enables better tracking and reporting at each stage of the sales process.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Sales, Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, Outlook

title: River Island responds to changing tides in retail with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: For 70 years, River Island has brought trend-led styles to British shoppers, with more than 250 stores in the United Kingdom, Ireland, and around the world today. Despite its remarkable growth and global scale, employees invariably note the close-knit family culture that defines the company. “At River Island, you’re encouraged to be an individual, have a voice, and be part of the family,” says Paul Cooper, Head of Technology at River Island.
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Planner, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft To Do, Microsoft 365

title: Restaurant operator Cravia centralizes and streamlines operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Headquartered in Dubai, Cravia is one of the fastest growing food and beverage (F&B) organizations in the region. With different brands and chains in its portfolio, Cravia needed to centralize its business processes and operations on a single platform. It streamlined its financial records and achieved more supply chain efficiencies by implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Finance and Operations. Using Microsoft Power platform, Cravia also boosted its workflow efficiency and data visibility. With reduced manual processes, human error, and dependencies, the company now has more freedom to grow.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Microsoft 365, Outlook, Power BI

title: ÖBB gains greater scale and state-of-the-art security measures by moving ticket sales to the Azure cloud platform
executive_summary: ÖBB moves a lot of people, quickly and reliably. Austria’s largest mobility services provider transports 477 million passengers per year, 1.3 million passengers per day, and was ranked as the most punctual railway operator in Europe in 2019. With results like these, ÖBB knows that being a leading mobility company means not only ensuring the trains run on time, but that they’re filled with contented passengers.
products: Azure, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Bastion, Azure DDoS Protection, Azure DNS, Azure Firewall, Azure Web Application Firewall

title: Post-it® Brand and Microsoft join up to create the Post-it® App for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Pasting your favorite inspirational quote to your workstation, leaving a reminder for a coworker (or for yourself), or jotting down a grocery list —the reasons to reach for a Post-it® Note are numerous, especially in the workplace. When it comes to brainstorming with colleagues, Post-it® Notes can help be a catalyst for great ideas. “Brainstorming is synonymous with the Post-it® Brand,” says Liz Thompson, New Product Marketer for Post-it® Brand. Yet as hybrid work becomes the norm, collaborating with colleagues in various locations can be a disjointed experience, lacking the easy flow of ideas that often happens when people come together in the same room. “With people scattered here, there, and everywhere, it’s more challenging to get that creative magic to come to life,” says Thompson.
products: Microsoft 365, Planner, Microsoft Teams

title: Ready for a hybrid future with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: “I’ve had a Surface device for a long time,” says Kieron Nolan, VP of IT and Operations at Future Plc. “It looks like a premium device. It operates like a premium device. It is as robust as a premium device. Yet the cost of the device makes sense from a business point of view. They are really good devices and they look the part.”
products: Azure, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Surface Go, Surface Laptop, Windows 11

title: MCT streamlines invoice processing with AQL Technologies and Power Automate
executive_summary: Since 1986, MCT has been among the leading authorized Carrier Transicold dealers for truck, trailer, rail, and auxiliary power unit (APU) sales and repair services across the United States. Now consolidated as a family of companies, MCT Companies provides a complete range of services for the transport refrigeration industry from coast to coast, across 16 locations in seven states. MCT's dedication to consistency drove an operational evolution that eventually required that the business adopt a new system for its Accounts Payable team. The company turned to AQL Technologies, which leveraged its extensive knowledge of Microsoft best practices to streamline MCT’s invoice processing system through robotic process automation (RPA).
products: Power Automate

title: Beiersdorf builds on decades of skin care research and accelerates innovation with Azure AI
executive_summary: Beiersdorf’s team of more than 900 scientists have been researching innovative, cutting-edge skin care solutions for decades. By centralizing its immense data library and leveraging AI-powered knowledge mining with Microsoft Azure Cognitive Search, its researchers can find the information they need quickly. Features such as document summarization, semantic search, document tagging, and optical character recognition allow researchers to extract key information fast, enabling them to spend less time searching and more time on industry-leading product development.

title: Tenable FEC transforms connectivity and collaboration with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Tenable Fire Engineering Consultancy (FEC) is a key player in the building industry, specializing in combining innovative fire engineering techniques with local codes and laws for optimized, cost-effective, and safe builds. With multiple locations and clients from across the globe, the company needed to create a secure and collaborative platform for smoother operations. Since deploying an Azure Virtual Desktop, employees can easily and securely access their desktops from anywhere, on any device.
products: Azure Virtual Desktop

title: Condatis revolutionizes staff management with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Condatis sees digital, verifiable employee credentials as the next wave in hybrid work. Using them gives organizations an easy but trusted way to protect and support employees and create a seamless hybrid work experience. Condatis used Microsoft Entra Verified ID to help keep track of its employees in the event of an emergency or drill, create a record of their skills and training history, facilitate visitor access to locations and services, and give people more power over their digital identities. Condatis and its customers are saving time and money, building trust, increasing transparency, and becoming better prepared for unexpected business disruptions.
products: Azure, Microsoft Entra Verified ID

title: Forward-thinking energy company embraces Power Platform to increase process efficiency while cutting costs
executive_summary: Equinor is an international energy company with more than 21,000 employees and present in 30 countries worldwide. To optimize existing complex business processes in support of its transition to a broad energy company, it established a Microsoft Power Platform Center for Enablement to nurture greater innovation through low-code development.
products: Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance leverages Microsoft solutions to cut turnaround times of loans by 30%
executive_summary: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance Limited (PCHFL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Piramal Enterprises Limited, is a housing finance company engaged in retail and wholesale lending. In retail lending, PCHFL is one of the leading players that addresses the diverse financing needs of the under-served and unserved market in India.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, OneDrive for Business, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, SharePoint

title: United Tractors drives digital transformation with Azure Center for SAP solutions
executive_summary: United Tractors (UT) is Indonesia’s largest heavy equipment distributor and a key player in the mining, construction, and energy sectors. Having already adopted enterprise resource planning (ERP) early on, UT decided to push its growth further by adopting cloud technology. With an eye on Industry 4.0, the company migrated its on-premise SAP HANA system to Azure. The move enabled UT to gain actionable insights, as well as deploy business apps for inventory planning, predictive maintenance, and employee self-service. Coupled with the use of Microsoft 365, UT now enjoys increased productivity and collaboration across the organization.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365

title: Luminous accelerates integration, innovation, and efficiency through RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: When it comes to innovation, Luminous is by no means in the dark. The manufacturer has been producing a wide range of cutting-edge products in the power backup, battery, home electrical, and solar spaces for the past 30 years by sticking closely to its mission of creating customer delight through innovation and passion.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Kingston Builds Cloud-Based BPM System with Microsoft Power Platform, Sees Soaring Business Agility
executive_summary: The impacts of the pandemic have made clear the need for businesses to find agility and flexibility in their operations to cope with the rapidly changing business environment. As such, business process optimization (BPO) has become a universal goal among enterprises around the globe. According to research from Gartner, it is estimated that by 2025, 70% of new enterprise applications will employ low-code solutions. Projects will be able to be completed faster than ever through the use of development tools with intuitive UI. Project staff—regardless of coding ability—can thus quickly turn their ideas into highly functional applications, easily overcoming a variety of challenges.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Dataverse, Power Apps

title: Driving experience excellence with SAP on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: McLaren Automotive creates some of the most breathtaking performance road sports cars in the world from its McLaren Production Centre in Woking, UK. The iconic motor racing brand rolled out its first supercar, the McLaren MP4-12C, in 2011. In June 2022, McLaren launches the Artura, the next-generation hybrid supercar with a new high-performance Hybrid powertrain and a beautiful, aerodynamic new design for sublime agility and engagement.
products: Azure, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Data Factory, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Firewall, Azure Load Balancer, Azure Monitor, Azure Synapse Analytics, SAP on Azure

title: Vietnamese English school VUS transforms operations and streamlines finances with cloud solutions
executive_summary: VUS (Vietnam USA Society English Training Services Center) underwent a complete digital transformation to combat a drastic decline in student numbers due to COVID-19. Working with multiple implementation partners, the school turned to the cloud to create an AI-driven, connected, collaborative solution. It combined Microsoft 365, Azure, and Dynamics 365 to build secure, streamlined, and scalable operations.  With new tools, the center has reinvented its learning environment for today’s students.
customer: VUS (Vietnam USA Society English Training Services Center)
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Power BI

title: Setur gains centralized management and cloud-scale innovation with Azure Arc
executive_summary: When your primary customers are travelers on the go, you need flexibility to serve them wherever they happen to be. Turkish travel and tourism company Setur understands the importance of being here, there, and everywhere for its customers. However, attaining that kind of agility is no small feat—especially with on-premises digital infrastructure.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Arc, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure SQL Managed Instance, Azure Storage, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Key Vault, Microsoft Sentinel

executive_summary: Tenable Fire Engineering Consultancy (FEC) is a key player in the building industry, specializing in combining innovative fire engineering techniques with local codes and laws for optimized, cost-effective, and safe builds. Since deploying an Azure Virtual Desktop, employees can easily and securely access their desktops from anywhere, on any device.

title: Vietnamese English school VUS transforms operations and streamlines finances with cloud solutions
executive_summary: VUS (Vietnam USA Society English Training Services Center) underwent a complete digital transformation to combat a drastic decline in student numbers due to COVID-19. Working with multiple implementation partners, the school turned to the cloud to create an AI-driven, connected, collaborative solution. It combined Microsoft 365, Azure, and Dynamics 365 to build secure, streamlined, and scalable operations.  With new tools, the center has reinvented its learning environment for today’s students.
customer: VUS (Trung tâm Dịch vụ Đào tạo Anh ngữ Hội Việt Mỹ)
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Bringing Blind Veterans UK together with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: “On 1 September 1997, I woke up in bed catapulted into a world of complete darkness. I was absolutely terrified,” says Billy Baxter. Billy was a soldier in the Royal Horse Artillery, but contracted a virus in Bosnia that robbed him of his eyesight. When he woke up that morning, his life changed completely. He soon became detached, isolated, and depressed. The army had been his whole life. But then he got in touch with Blind Veterans UK, a charity with centres in Sussex and North Wales that supports anyone who has served in the UK Armed Forces and who is now living with significant sight loss. Their support, rehabilitation and training helped Billy turn a corner. He knew he wasn’t alone anymore and that he could finally talk to people who understood what he was going through.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Office 365, Windows 10

title: Aditya Birla Group conducted a global event virtually, demonstrating a unique use case for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Aditya Birla Group is a Fortune 500 organization, with a workforce of over 140,000 employees belonging to 100 nationalities. With over seven decades of responsible business practices, its businesses have grown into global powerhouses in various sectors – metals, pulp and fibre, chemicals, textiles, carbon black, telecom, cement, financial services, fashion retail and renewable energy. The organization’s overseas operations span 36 countries in North and South America, Africa, Asia and Europe.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Connected car: Auto parts specialist Select connects repair shops, vehicles, and logistics companies with Azure IoT Hub
executive_summary: Select AG supplies independent car repair shops with replacement parts for any brand of vehicle several times per day. The company—an alliance of 13 auto parts wholesalers in the German independent aftersales market—has 99 locations within Germany. Its AutoTeilePilot (“AutoPartsPilot,” or ATP) online catalog system lets repair shops quickly find the right replacement part. In an effort to streamline its processes and facilitate innovative services, Select teamed up with Deutsche Telekom to develop an IoT solution that can turn almost any vehicle into a connected car. The result was vjumi: a telematics app that lets independent repair shops benefit from a completely digitalized repair shop process and offer their customers predictive service.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub

title: Azure Compute unlocks faultless deployments with Azure Data Explorer enhanced with Machine Learning
executive_summary: Thousands of businesses rely on Microsoft Azure to host mission-critical apps quickly and seamlessly. To ensure flawless infrastructure for more than 200 Azure data centers globally, Microsoft engineers and data scientists leverage Gandalf, an internal machine learning service powered by Azure Data Explorer (ADX). This solution enables internal teams to deploy frequent and secure updates of Azure components while ensuring no interruptions to Azure’s customers. By processing huge volumes of data in near real time, ADX empowers developers and data scientists to work faster and innovate at speed.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer

title: Lynk & Co brings meetings into the car with Azure Communication Services and Teams
executive_summary: Lynk & Co wanted to expand on its applications and services so that customers could benefit in other ways. Lynk & Co sought out customer feedback to gain insight into additional features and services that would be useful. Users responded with an interest in apps and services that could support hybrid work and make car time more productive. In response to this feedback, the internal development team at Lynk & Co enhanced their 01 car models with a custom in-car meetings app. Built with Azure Communication Services, the meetings app boasts seamless and superior interoperability with Microsoft Teams, extending this service for in-car usage.
products: Azure, Azure Communication Services, Microsoft Teams

title: Grupo Bimbo Transforms the Data Analysis of Commercial Areas with Microsoft Solutions
executive_summary: The global baking company adopted Power BI and Azure Synapse Services to drive a digital transformation in data analysis in the commercial area. With the implementation, business processes were improved and automated and the time of operational processes was reduced, as productivity increased significantly.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Setur gains centralized management and cloud-scale innovation with Azure Arc
executive_summary: When your primary customers are travelers on the go, you need flexibility to serve them wherever they happen to be. Turkish travel and tourism company Setur understands the importance of being here, there, and everywhere for its customers. However, attaining that kind of agility is no small feat—especially with on-premises digital infrastructure.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure SQL Managed Instance, Azure Storage, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Key Vault, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Qode Health Solutions secures COVID-19 vaccination records with the ledger feature in Azure SQL Database
executive_summary: Qode Health Solutions is a South African company working to bring about a healthcare revolution. Seeking a way to verify patient data updates during the COVID-19 pandemic, Qode initially created its own custom blockchain. After the proof of concept highlighted system maintenance issues, Qode instead tested the ledger feature in Microsoft Azure SQL Database. The ability to track updates securely and efficiently with familiar technology helped Qode give its clients access to highly trusted data in near real-time.
products: Azure Backup, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Graph Data Connect, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Intune

title: Book a desk or call in sick in just 30 seconds: Campus IT at Hochschule Düsseldorf, University of Applied Sciences manages office occupancy with Power Platform
executive_summary: The employees of Campus IT at Hochschule Düsseldorf, University of Applied Sciences do not have permanent workstations. Instead, they use hot desking in conjunction with a clean desk policy. This method was instituted during the COVID-19 health crisis, but it became more time-consuming as employees returned to the office; managing desk assignments with an Excel list cost time and led to errors. Campus IT needed an automated, digital solution, and trainee Dan Stenmans delivered RABA—a room, attendance, and booking assistant based on Microsoft Power Platform.
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, SharePoint

title: SSP unifies its hybrid infrastructure with Azure Stack HCI and saves more than 100,000 kilowatt hours
executive_summary: A few years ago, SSP augmented its on-premises infrastructure with some key cloud-based workloads through Azure, hybridizing its environment. While the company enjoyed the benefits of a hybrid environment, it lacked the ability to move select services and workloads between its on-premises and cloud environments. With reliably stronger performance, SSP’s digital infrastructure is positioned to meet whatever challenges or opportunities the business might face next.
products: Azure, Azure Firewall, Azure Monitor, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Payette secures and extends on-premises BCDR while preparing for a cost-effective cloud future with Azure
executive_summary: When Payette’s data was breached during a cyberattack, the company modernized by expanding to a hybrid environment with Microsoft Azure, while integrating and updating its use of Rubrik’s capabilities. Payette trusts in Azure and Rubrik to manage a comprehensive set of business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) capabilities to back up, protect, restore, and modernize the firm’s business-critical data. The results have been game-changing for Payette, and the firm is now seeking out new ways to increase its Azure footprint to create a flexible future in the cloud for future business innovation.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Virtual Desktop, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft 365

title: Irth uses .NET MAUI to modernize its mobile app, helping workers who service critical network infrastructure operate safely and efficiently
executive_summary: Technology company Irth Solutions (Irth) rebuilt its risk management, damage prevention, and infrastructure protection mobile app using .NET Multi-platform App UI (.NET MAUI) to better safeguard critical network infrastructure. The company wanted to modernize its app to be more responsive on multiple operating systems but without developers having to write code in different programming languages. Irth became an early adopter of .NET MAUI so that its team could develop apps for Android, iOS, and Windows from a single shared code base. Now the company is advancing a mobile-first strategy to enhance resilience and reduce risk in the delivery of essential services.
products: Azure

title: WorkTrips.com reduces business trip bookings to a few clicks with Azure infrastructure
executive_summary: WorkTrips.com is a Polish company offering a modern platform that optimizes costs, automates processes, and provides care during business trips. To handle multiple requests at high speed and to simplify the flow of arranging business travel, it connects various Azure services via Azure Virtual Networking. Users get their trips booked on time, supervisors have less work, and companies benefit from the best offers. WorkTrips.com also benefits from simplified infrastructure maintenance and global data center availability, helping protect user data in sensitive locations.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network, Dynamics 365, Microsoft Entra ID

executive_summary: A few years ago, SSP augmented its on-premises infrastructure with some key cloud-based workloads through Azure, hybridizing its environment. While the company enjoyed the benefits of a hybrid environment, it lacked the ability to move select services and workloads between its on-premises and cloud environments. With reliably stronger performance, SSP’s digital infrastructure is positioned to meet whatever challenges or opportunities the business might face next.
products: Azure, Azure Firewall, Azure Monitor, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Payette secures and extends on-premises BCDR while preparing for a cost-effective cloud future with Azure
executive_summary: When Payette’s data was breached during a cyberattack, the company modernized by expanding to a hybrid environment with Microsoft Azure, while integrating and updating its use of Rubrik’s capabilities. Payette trusts in Azure and Rubrik to manage a comprehensive set of business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) capabilities to back up, protect, restore, and modernize the firm’s business-critical data. The results have been game-changing for Payette, and the firm is now seeking out new ways to increase its Azure footprint to create a flexible future in the cloud for future business innovation.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Virtual Desktop, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft 365

title: AMD enables exceptional flexibility and performance with high-performing Azure VMs, Azure NetApp Files
executive_summary: Take it from a company at the forefront of the industry—it’s an incredible time to be in the semiconductor business. Every day, engineers at AMD are hard at work inventing and improving the chipsets, data processors, and software applications that help form the computational backbone of a digital information economy measured in trillions of dollars’ worth of goods and systems. The leadership solutions from AMD impact the way people live, learn, and play. This level of customer-focused execution requires high-performance computing capacity for electronic design automation (EDA).
products: Azure, Azure HPC, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Virtual Machines

title: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign graduates 350,000 identities to cloud in 48 hours
executive_summary: In an identity management landscape where change and challenge are the only constants, the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (U. of I.) Technology Services team manages user identities with a “people-centric” approach. Its recent Microsoft Azure Active Directory migration of 350,000 identities took one short, drama-free weekend. The university’s team offers advice and lessons learned for other organizations.
products: Microsoft Entra ID

title: Bank of Queensland reduces service desk calls and simplifies work with Microsoft Edge
executive_summary: Employees from Bank of Queensland (BOQ), Australia’s sixth-largest financial institution, once relied on a “confusing hodgepodge” of browsers. To address the fragmentation, the bank consolidated with Microsoft Edge, which provides modern capabilities plus compatibility with BOQ sites tied to Internet Explorer. Using internal “change champions” to drive adoption, BOQ saw high rates of user uptake and significant reductions in service desk calls, as well as benefits from automatic browser updates, such as improved security.
products: Microsoft Edge

title: Email cybersecurity specialist SMX boosts cost savings and security while improving customer experience with Azure
executive_summary: As the saying goes, reputation is everything—it takes a long time to build and only a short time to lose. This is particularly apt for email cybersecurity provider SMX, given the ever-increasing frequency and sophistication of email cybersecurity threats. When you’re scanning and delivering millions of emails a month, reliability, reputation, and long-term usage and buildup of reputable IP addresses are vital core assets enabling business success.
products: Azure DNS, Azure Pipelines, Azure Traffic Manager, Exchange Online, Microsoft Defender for Identity

title: Indian School of Business enjoys teaching continuity, seamless hybrid operations, and robust cybersecurity with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Indian School of Business (ISB) is a world-class business school established in India in 2001. The not-for-profit institution is committed to developing leaders through innovative programs, outstanding faculty, and thought leadership. The school has two state-of-the-art campuses in Hyderabad and Mohali, where students learn the best global management practices.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 A3, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention, SharePoint

title: Premera Blue Cross auto-scales operations on demand by migrating to Azure Kubernetes Service, reducing costs by up to 60 percent
executive_summary: Premera Blue Cross (Premera), a health plan based in the Pacific Northwest, chose Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) to save time and money, freeing up staff to focus on improving services for its members. The organization had migrated to Microsoft Azure, but it found that significant time and effort were required to manage its previous Kubernetes service. Premera needed a stable, secure environment to support rapid growth. The organization realized that it could lower costs and liberate staff from maintenance work by using AKS. With AKS, Premera reduced the total cost of ownership by up to 60 percent and freed up a team of 10 people.
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service

title: Trimble partners with Microsoft to take on construction’s biggest challenges
executive_summary: In thinking about our future world, few numbers are as mind-boggling as the amount of construction needed to support it. In order to keep up with Global Economic Forum’s urban population projections, we’ll need to construct the equivalent of 2.8 new New York Cities, every month, from now until 2050. It’s difficult to comprehend a task this monumental. And even more humbling once you consider the historic labor shortages squeezing the construction industry and ambitious net zero targets that put immense pressure on an industry that is responsible for more than a third of global CO2 emissions.
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Logic Apps, HoloLens

title: MGM in Macau uses Microsoft Teams to replace resource-heavy processes with faster, digital alternatives
executive_summary: MGM MACAU and MGM COTAI, two integrated hotel properties in the resort city of Macau, use Microsoft Teams to provide company news, customer service tips, information, and applications, all of which employees can access on personal devices from anywhere, helping them to work more efficiently and collaborate better. It’s just one example of the organization’s ongoing efforts to empower employees in all areas of the business with collaboration tools that match the fast-paced reality of the hospitality industry.
products: Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online

title: Sime Darby Property takes operations to a new level by moving to the Azure cloud
executive_summary: Leading Malaysian property developer Sime Darby Property is working to multiply value for people, businesses, economies and the planet via its thriving asset portfolio. The company embarked on a group-wide digital transformation in 2020 to become a more agile, data-driven organization. The first step was migrating all its on-premises servers to the Azure cloud. Since then, Sime Darby Property has reduced its IT spending, empowered employees to be more productive, and transformed customer experience by leveraging the cloud.
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate, SharePoint Online, Microsoft Sentinel, OneDrive for Business

title: Decentriq unlocks highly secure collaboration on the world’s most sensitive datasets with Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Companies that work with sensitive data are often sitting on a wealth of information they’re restricted from using, but Decentriq is helping these companies tap into the value of this data—without sharing it. Founded in 2019, the Swiss company offers an enterprise-grade software as a service platform for confidential data collaboration. On the platform, participants can create data clean rooms, which are neutral spaces for multiple parties to work on joint datasets where compliance, control, and data confidentiality are enforced by advanced privacy technologies. With its data clean rooms, Decentriq is not only making data collaboration simpler, but in many cases, it’s also creating the opportunity for multiple groups to come together and use sensitive data for the first time—using Microsoft Azure confidential computing. Since migrating to the cloud and accelerating its confidential computing journey with Azure, the company has made collaboration on sensitive datasets scalable for the first time and helped customers reach a range of milestones, including doubling clickthrough rates for digital advertising. And this is just the beginning.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Virtual Machines

title: The cutting edge in hospitality: Saudi Airlines Catering Company automates 11 processes with Power Apps, with more to come
executive_summary: Saudi Airlines Catering Company has an enduring commitment to continuous improvement. Recognizing the need to modernize, its leaders embarked on a transformative journey, using Microsoft Power Apps to automate and streamline data processing operations. From digitizing manual data collection to creating a suite of business applications, the company notably reduced reliance on paper, saving the business card printing cost by replacing it with the digital business card app. Moreover, real-time dashboards empower everyone to make data-driven decisions, enabling the company to deliver value to its customers quickly.
products: Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Kantar Worldpanel Plus uses Azure Databricks to produce real-time shopper insights
executive_summary: Kantar’s new Worldpanel Plus service was planned to deliver insights about UK shopper behaviour. They opted for Microsoft Azure, running Azure Databricks and Azure Data Lake with additional Microsoft security and Power Platform tools. Worldpanel Plus launched in 2018. A large sample of shoppers now upload 100,000 receipts per day. This scalable solution enables Kantar to deliver UK shopper insights to the brands with which it works.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Monitor, Azure Key Vault, Microsoft Sentinel, Power BI

title: A bid for sustainability: ASCORP amplifies offers for green energy projects with Power Apps
executive_summary: ASCORP, a green energy trailblazer in Romania, faced challenges managing and standardizing its green energy projects’ bidding process. Driven by a vision of sustainability, ASCORP sought a solution to streamline its operations. Collaborating with Pepas Cloud, ASCORP developed an innovative app called Deep Quotes, on Power Apps. The solution helped ASCORP enhance its efficiency and improve collaboration by cutting down the time it takes to create an offer from 2-4 hours to five minutes.
products: Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Power BI, SharePoint

title: TAS United protects caller data 24/7 with Azure-based Safetica data loss prevention
executive_summary: Come rain or shine, TAS United agents are there for their clients, handling customer calls around the clock. To ensure that sensitive caller information remains confidential, the company implemented Safetica's data loss prevention (DLP) solution, run on Microsoft Azure. It applies machine learning and automation features to detect and prevent data leaks and help TAS United meet strict compliance requirements. Delivered in the cloud, it eliminates the cost and hassle of maintaining physical servers while reducing the time spent on manual data monitoring by 41 percent.
products: Azure

title: Sage improves retention 30% with employee listening powered by Viva Glint and Viva Insights
executive_summary: Sharon Oley, Customer Services Director at Sage, oversees 500 colleagues who maintain the great customer support that the payroll, HR, and finance software provider has become known for. “We’re very focused on giving the customer great access and a great experience,” she says. Key to that standout customer experience is a frontline workforce of engaged employees who buy into Sage’s people-focused, supportive workplace culture. For a global business operating in a hybrid world, however, keeping a finger on the pulse of organizational culture can be a challenge. “We use Microsoft Viva Glint and Viva Insights to gain real-time insights into how employees are feeling and workplace behaviors,” says Oley. “We understand the importance of listening to employees.”
products: Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Viva Glint, Microsoft Viva Insights

title: Cranfield University deploys Elastic SIEM on Azure to protect vital IT infrastructure and support revenue opportunities
executive_summary: Cranfield University, a postgraduate university focusing on science, engineering, design, technology, and management, uses large volumes of data from different sources for research and needs to keep its security infrastructure compliant with business partner requirements. Seeking to accelerate compliance with partners, Cranfield turned to Elastic Cloud powered by Microsoft Azure, enabling the university to analyze data, automate processes, and protect systems across the enterprise.
products: Azure

title: Virtual inspections optimize carbon footprint: Siemens Energy uses Microsoft Teams to simplify acceptance testing for its energy solutions
executive_summary: In 1867, Werner von Siemens discovered the dynamo-electric principle, setting things in motion that would make Siemens Energy one of the world’s most important suppliers of energy solutions. One-sixth of global power production is based on this company’s technology. In the past, Siemens Energy customers would travel thousands of kilometers to inspect and approve the solutions they ordered before initiating the complex process of shipping them. Today, Siemens Energy uses Microsoft Teams and HoloLens 2 to create virtual test beds that make these long journeys superfluous. This saves money and reduces the carbon footprint of the company and its customers.
customer: Siemens Energy Global GmbH & Co. KG
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms

title: Windows 11 Pro gives a competitive advantage to an ancient craft
executive_summary: Hakutsuru Sake Brewing Co., Ltd. has been creating fine sakes in Kobe, Japan since 1743. When the company transitioned to flexible work styles, they needed a way to streamline security management across their 22 locations around the world. Secure-by-default Windows 11 Pro devices enabled their 500+ employees to outperform anywhere while freeing up their IT team to focus on strategic business initiatives.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Windows 11

title: Hepsiburada teams up with Toloka and makes product search as easy as it gets with Azure-based solution
executive_summary: Envision the exhilaration of a shopper when their product search unlocks the perfect find – this is the realm of retail where Turkish Hepsiburada aimed for nothing short of excellence. To revolutionize its search capabilities for the millions of products available on its e-commerce platform, Turkish Hepsiburada teamed up with Serbian Toloka and developed a solution based on Microsoft Azure. The result was a 9-percent increase in search quality. Hepsiburada is now one of the leading Turkish e-commerce platforms.
products: Azure

title: ABN AMRO modernizes its infrastructure in 9 months with Datometry and Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO was looking to move business-critical workloads from Teradata to Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics. The deadline was tight, and the job needed to be performed with little to no downtime for business analysts and other internal customers. ABN AMRO worked with Microsoft partner Datometry, whose qInsight and Hyper-Q solutions enabled a seamless migration and allowed ABN AMRO to leave applications intact, avoiding time-consuming rewrites. As a result of leaving its legacy vendor, ABN AMRO realized significant scaling advantages, gained flexibility, and laid the foundation for a comprehensive cloud strategy.
products: Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Sogei transforms its culture and achieves 1,100 return on investment with Microsoft Adoption and Change Management services
executive_summary: Sogei, the IT company fully owned by the Italian Ministry of Economy and Finance, had to address low adoption of Microsoft 365 tools so its employees could work from anywhere with high productivity. But its initiative was reactive, lacking identity and roadmap clarity. Sogei commissioned Microsoft to help transform its working culture from the ground up with a Microsoft 365 adoption program and Center of Excellence. The unique solution developed by the Adoption and Change Management (ACM) services team has saved the typical user an average of 4.5 hours per week that has been reinvested into productive time, personal wellbeing, and upskilling. The program also introduced a 194 percent increase in collaboration with Microsoft Teams, 60 percent reduction in email volume, and provided a 1,100 percent return on investment for Microsoft 365 E3 licenses.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Générale pour l’Enfant leverages Power Apps and new technologies for its business applications
executive_summary: Since 1987, the Générale Pour l’Enfant group’s objective has remained the same: to imagine and design children and toddlers’ clothing that is comfortable, playful, and high-quality. This ambitious approach shared by all employees makes this family-based business a major player in children's fashion through its three flagship brands: Sergent Major, Du Pareil Au Même, and Natalys.
products: Power Apps, Power BI

title: From “DX x Work Style Reform” to “DX x Data-Driven Management” - The current state of TIS’s “Internal DX” with Microsoft products.
executive_summary: TIS, part of the TIS INTEC Group, is developing its business into one of Japan’s IT leaders. As a business partner for over 3,000 companies in a wide variety of fields including finance, industry, government, and distribution services, the company delivers IT services to support their growth strategies. Today, is TIS leveraging industry knowledge and IT construction capabilities accumulated for over 50 years to support the DX (Digital Transformation) of society and companies, and is proactively developing its own DX as well.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: First National Bank enhances customer communications with Microsoft Copilot for Sales
executive_summary: First National Bank (FNB) is a division of FirstRand Bank Limited, the largest listed financial institution by market capitalization in Africa. Founded in 1838, FNB offers personal, private, business, commercial, and corporate banking services to 10 million consumers, commercial enterprises, and public sector customers in South Africa and across the continent. Its 50,178 employees embrace the philosophy of “better business; better world.”
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Outlook, Microsoft 365 Copilot for Sales, Microsoft 365 Copilot

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Azure fuel YATA’s transformation of customer experience and operations with data and cloud
executive_summary: For the customer, service excellence can be as simple as getting a real-time alert to day-end promotions at exactly the right time. Digital transformation is making this happen at YATA. “Service excellence” is a term that promises many things to some, but to others it can be a buzzword—overhyped and overused. For YATA, the modern Japanese lifestyle department store, it’s all about driving impact and elevating its renowned superior customer experience to new levels through digital capabilities.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Danish Diabetes Association deepens member and volunteer support with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Danish Diabetes Association serves 90,000 members, helping people with diabetes and their families live better lives. The nonprofit adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 to better understand and serve its constituents in a cost-effective manner. The more efficient CRM enables the Danish Diabetes Association to provide its members and volunteers with more relevant information, and a payment integration helps cash flow so the organization can maximize funding for its programming.
products: Dynamics 365, Power Pages

title: Quantium Technology creates robust private equity management platform, scaling up internationally with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Quantium Technology is transforming private market operations with its modern and comprehensive software suite for fund/portfolio management, and investor relationship management. The firm was founded with the distinct vision to scale internally and position itself as the system of choice for forward-looking, 21st century professional fund managers. As the company enhanced its global scalability, Microsoft stood out as the preferred technology partner. In just five months, Quantium migrated to Azure's state-of-the-art platform, empowering its clients to focus on quality analysis while significantly minimizing manual tasks.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft 365

title: Datex debuts flexible supply chain software based on the Azure Stack and Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: Datex delivers mid-market and global third-party logistics providers a comprehensive range of warehouse management solutions that cater to their specific business process needs. To enhance scalability and dependability for fluctuating demands and expanding client requirements, Datex required an architectural redesign. Previously, fulfilling unique customer requirements involved time-intensive and costly solutioning. To address this, Datex developed Wavelength, an enterprise low-code application platform (LCAP), utilizing the Azure Stack and Azure Integration Services. This approach provided Datex with increased capability and adaptability, along with inherent scaling for various operational volumes.
products: Azure API Management, Azure Container Instances, Azure Event Grid, Azure Functions, Azure Integration Services, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Stack, Power BI

title: Hellenic Bank transforms market analysis using Power BI, offering business customers unmatched insights
executive_summary: Hellenic Bank, a leading Cypriot financial institution, has changed the way companies think about business intelligence. Where businesses used to rely only on in-house sales numbers, Hellenic Bank worked to provide a wider view. Using Power BI, the bank designed their Commercial Intelligence tool which gathers and analyzes card transaction data in an anonymized and aggregated manner. Using the tool, Hellenic Bank’s business clients can uncover insights that go beyond their internal data boundaries, bringing a clearer picture of their evolving market shares, market trends, and consumer behavior, down to details like demographic groups and neighborhoods.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint Online, Power BI, SharePoint, Windows Server

title: Domino’s Pizza Enterprises slices identity by role for seamless, highly secure access with Microsoft Entra ID
executive_summary: Like its generously topped pizzas, Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Ltd. (DPE) manages an internal identity roster that features enormous diversity in role, variety, and sheer volume. As a global powerhouse with Franchisee Partners in Australia and New Zealand, Asia, and Europe, it must manage those identities across multiple international borders. In an initiative to simplify its IT landscape through consolidation and reduce costs, DPE replaced its previous identity management system, Okta, with Microsoft Entra ID. Just four months after deployment, team members experienced convenience like never before, and DPE cut licensing costs and raised IT team productivity. Most importantly, the company keeps morale high through its nontraditional inclusion of frontline workers in its corporate information workspace, Microsoft Viva. Now with Microsoft Entra ID, everyone is in the know with seamless and safer access.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel, Azure, Microsoft Graph, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria boosts accessibility with Microsoft Entra ID
executive_summary: Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria is a leading Spanish university for undergraduate, masters, and doctoral programs. Accessibility is important to the university, which is spread across six campuses and three islands. When an aging on-premises Active Directory Federation Services implementation began experiencing incidents, the university knew it had to move to the cloud. Adopting Microsoft Entra ID, Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria has improved data security, increased access, and reduced infrastructure costs.
customer: University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Fielmann Group gives employees clearer vision and drives alignment with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: With 23,000 employees and 28 million customers worldwide, Fielmann still manages to maintain the organizational cohesion of a family-owned business. As a result, its employees and customers are fiercely loyal. When the company wanted to drive further internationalization and digitization, it turned to Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Viva. The challenge was to balance the need for organizational alignment with the sense of customer centricity that has made Fielmann great.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Viva Goals

title: B.TECH scales retail operations and slashes time-to-market by 30 percent with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: In the fast-paced world of retail, B.TECH isn't just keeping up; it's setting the pace. The Egyptian retail giant, specializing in household appliances and consumer electronics, has used its digital transformation arm b_labs to build a competitive advantage. With Microsoft Azure, B.TECH tackled scalability head-on and boosted service availability to 99.9 percent. Gone are the days of back-office panic during high-traffic periods like Black Friday. The retailer is now riding a wave of operational agility with a 30 percent cut in time-to-market. B.TECH has opened its doors to continuous improvement and innovation by embracing the cloud.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Firewall, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Virtual Machines, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Sentinel

title: CompuData grows 25% year over year, increases cloud revenue by 250% by migrating from private cloud to Microsoft Azure with Ingram Micro
executive_summary: IT solutions provider CompuData migrated its legacy infrastructure to Microsoft Azure, increasing its cloud revenue by 250% and making its growth sustainable while maintaining regulatory compliance. When CompuData found that maintaining a private cloud infrastructure was becoming too complex and costly as the company grew, it looked to Azure for scalability and efficiency. CompuData worked with Microsoft partner Ingram Micro to transition all its customers and applications to Azure through the Microsoft DCO program. As a result, CompuData is scaling faster, reducing costs, and growing by 25% year over year.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Keller Independent School District improves student experiences with Surface laptops and secures the organization using Microsoft 365 A5
executive_summary: Keller ISD is responsible for the education of over 34,000 students in cities and towns spread across 51 square miles of land just north of Fort Worth, Texas. The school district focuses on providing exceptional educational experiences in the classroom, across its facilities, and through support and guidance for students and staff alike. To further this goal, Keller ISD recently hired Matt Vrlenich as its new Chief Technology Officer. Upon taking the role, Vrlenich quickly identified his top priority: migrating 23,000 browser-based devices for its fifth through twelfth graders to Surface Laptops and Microsoft 365 A5, then utilizing the included cloud-management tools and Microsoft security to keep students learning and the organization compliant and safe.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 A5, Windows Autopilot, Surface, Surface Book, Surface Pro, Windows 11

title: Using Advanced Analytics to automate processes and prevent failures: A data platform for Clearstream based on Azure
executive_summary: Every day, Clearstream carries out more than 250,000 settlement transactions, while holding more than 300,000 nationally and internationally traded bonds, securities, shares, and investment funds in custody. That’s another way of saying that this subsidiary and central securities depository of Deutsche Börse Group carries a great deal of responsibility. In a strictly regulated industry, the company carries out its processes promptly, accurately, transparently, and securely. In the past, Clearstream used an on-premises data platform for this purpose. Today, data is made available from a central source with the help of Microsoft Azure. This ensures more efficient processes and speeds up the development of new services.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Functions, Azure Kubernetes Service, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Nagarro powers HR operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365 to gain efficiency
executive_summary: Nagarro is a global leader in digital product engineering. With its agile and caring values, it drives technology-led business breakthroughs to help clients transform, adapt, and build. Listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, the company enables enterprises to future-proof their business by leveraging its expertise across cutting-edge technologies and multiple industries. It has a broad international customer base, primarily in Central Europe and North America. Nagarro employs over 19,000 people across 36 countries and is growing exponentially.
products: Dynamics 365 Human Resources

title: CATA Center for Astrophysics simultaneously connects more than 300 schools over 4,300 kilometers with the help of Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: In observance of Astronomy Day, the Chilean Centro de Astrofísica (Center for Astrophysics) developed a collaborative activity through Microsoft Teams to measure the planet's radius alongside students across the country.
products: Power Apps, Microsoft Teams

title: The Tile Shop enhances security and agility with SAP on the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: The Tile Shop is a large, growing US-based tile supplier. The company’s continuing expansion necessitates new, more advanced technological infrastructure and robust cybersecurity solutions. The Tile Shop recently transitioned from outdated, on-premises infrastructure to Microsoft 365 E5 and SAP on the Microsoft Cloud. Adopting Microsoft Sentinel, Defender for Cloud, and Intune, among others, the company has unified and strengthened its cybersecurity posture, saving hundreds of thousands of dollars in the process.
products: Azure, Azure Site Recovery, Azure portal, SAP on Azure, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for Identity, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Availability, safety, and expense reduction: FRAM Capital undergoes digital transformation with Microsoft tools
executive_summary: With support from partner company Microsoft CloudData, FRAM Capital, an investment manager, implemented an integrated ecosystem based on Microsoft 365, Microsoft Azure, and the use of Microsoft Sentinel for security. The solution was easily implemented by the financial market’s familiarity with the tools, and there was an increase from 25 to 100 users with no additional infrastructure costs.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Exchange Online, Microsoft 365, Power Automate, Microsoft Sentinel, Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Achieving One Fujitsu with Red Hat Enterprise Linux on Azure for Enhanced Security and Operational Efficiency
executive_summary: As Fujitsu Limited fulfills its digital transformation, it’s adopting a new One Fujitsu model. This initiative aims to build trust in society and realize a more sustainable world through innovation by working with customers undergoing a sustainability transformation.
