title: Jardine Engineering Corporation replaces legacy phone system with Teams Phone, reduces implementation cost by 60 percent
executive_summary: Yiu and her colleagues identified Microsoft Teams Phone as the ideal solution for a highly dispersed organization with an outdated legacy phone system. Today, JEC employees make and receive calls right from Teams, bringing many of their most-used collaboration tools together in one place. Eliminating a standalone phone system helped JEC achieve significant cost savings.
products: Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Microsoft Teams Phone, Excel, Word, Power BI

title: Università degli Studi dell’Insubria: pioneering a new frontier of learning with Surface Hub 2S
executive_summary: Italy’s Università degli Studi dell’Insubria believes in using technology to deliver qualitative, engaging classes both on-site and remotely. To this end, the organization recently installed a suite of Microsoft Surface Hub 2S devices across its campuses. The solution champions the use of digital whiteboards in a new, highly interactive way that allows both in-person and online students to get more involved and bring active contribution to classes. All while helping lecturers to elevate their teaching.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Intune, Surface Hub

title: Ashok Leyland leverages Microsoft Teams for remote collaboration and business continuity
executive_summary: Founded in 1948, Ashok Leyland is an Indian multinational automotive manufacturer. The organization was looking for an effective remote collaboration platform and leveraged Microsoft Teams to ensure business continuity amid the pandemic.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Ageas Group: Creating a centralized security solution for a decentralized IT landscape
executive_summary: Headquartered in Belgium, the multinational insurance group Ageas has always promoted autonomy; empowering each entity within the company to shape and operate its business and IT landscapes to best suit a local market. But with the financial services industry facing a growing number of cybersecurity threats, and no unified Security Information Event Management (SIEM) platform in place, Ageas needed to make a decision to best protect the group’s collective assets. Working with Microsoft, Ageas implemented a bespoke security solution to serve all of the organization’s entities across the world. A centralized security monitoring approach that is providing everyone with world-class detection and prevention – without any individual entity giving up their own operating model.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Centro Hospitalar Universitário Lisboa Central: Delivering virtual care with Microsoft collaboration tools
executive_summary: Portugal’s oldest hospital, Centro Hospitalar Universitário Lisboa Central (CHULC), has a history of embracing both traditional medical practices and innovative healthcare solutions. This culture is shared by its board of directors who, in 2019, decided on a digital-first strategy to help the hospital develop an omnichannel approach to patient care. By partnering with Microsoft, the organization has since implemented a number of telehealth tools to deliver virtual care to both clinical and non-clinical specialties. A transformation that helped the hospital provide remote care during COVID-19 restrictions and has now become an integral part of daily hospital life.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Cooperative Bank of Epirus transforms the user experience with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Cooperative Bank of Epirus is leading the social and economic development of the Epirus region, thanks to the greater efficiency and increased security of its financial services. With the help of Microsoft 365 solutions, it empowers its employees to commit to the development of local businesses and the prosperity of financial services customers.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business

title: Lenovo reinforces customer trust with ledger in Azure SQL Database
executive_summary: Lenovo builds millions of computers every year, and the company wants its customers to trust that each one arrives configured to the customer’s request. To provide this attestation, the company now tracks each new device with its Trusted Supply Chain solution built with ledger in Microsoft Azure SQL Database. Lenovo chose ledger in Azure SQL Database because of the performance, scalability, and security of the Azure platform. The company has been so pleased with the results that it is planning to use ledger in Azure SQL Database for additional high-security applications.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database

title: No kilometer too far: Digital transport management at Raiffeisen Waren GmbH with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With 210 locations across Germany, Raiffeisen Waren GmbH is never far away from the action. Whether roof tiles, wall paint, or floor screed, the commercial enterprise delivers building materials directly to construction sites. And quindata GmbH—a subsidiary of Raiffeisen Waren GmbH—performs state-of-the-art transport management based on SAP S/4HANA to guarantee efficiency when planning the necessary delivery routes and logistics. The company uses a slightly adapted version of the standard SAP S/4 HANA transport management solution to link the transport data for all the various locations, simplifying the delivery process and preventing any disruption to construction projects. That way, no unnecessary kilometers are traveled and no time goes to waste.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure

title: The Global Fund guides nations to get more out of medical aid with Visio
executive_summary: It could take weeks to produce a representation of the national health system and associated organizations that receive grant funds, but the image would be either too messy or incomplete, so no one would use it—time-pressed grant managers and other users found it difficult to grasp the non-standardized, complex diagrams. For Global Fund managers, the Visio-based tool took grant management to a more strategic level. Like the organization itself, the tool is flexible, agile, and invaluable to all constituencies, not just Global Fund grant managers.
products: Visio

title: Wigo4it: how a public-sector organization is modernizing critical services with cloud technology
executive_summary: As the organization responsible for providing IT services to the four largest municipalities in the Netherlands, Wigo4it is committed to putting citizens’ needs at the heart of all it does. As part of this mission, the organization is currently undergoing a digital transformation journey aimed at adding more value for money, optimizing operations and helping its civil servants to support vulnerable citizens. Powered by the Microsoft Azure cloud, the initiative has triggered a shift in Wigo4it’s working culture, empowering its employees to achieve more.
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Virtual Desktop, Office 365

title: One system for everyone: Biologische Heilmittel Heel uses Dynamics 365 for customer management
executive_summary: Biologische Heilmittel Heel, a medium-sized enterprise based in the German state of Baden‑Württemberg, produces medications for a wide range of symptoms. Its product portfolio is diverse, as are its customers. From doctors’ offices to pharmacies to wholesalers—every customer has a different perspective on the products and wants the messaging to reflect this. Omnichannel marketing is gaining in importance, and the old IT landscape was no longer up to this task. Today, Dynamics 365 consolidates all data at Heel, enabling the company to provide its customers with more individualized support.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps

title: Terragon Group, thanks to Azure cloud, unleashed its full potential and scalability, helping its clients to increase their ROI by 900%.
executive_summary: Terragon Group is an African data and marketing technology firm focused on driving intelligent connections to consumers in Africa. Terragon uses its on-demand marketing cloud platform, attribution software, and deep analytics capability to enable intelligent, targeted omni-channel (SMS, USSD, email, WhatsApp, email, social) engagement between Brands (SMBs and Enterprises) to 350m+ “mobile-first” African consumers. In an on-premises environment, Terragon’s solution could only reach 10-20% of its potential. Using their platform on the Azure cloud unleashed its full potential and scalability, helping their clients to increase their ROI by 900%.
products: Azure, Azure Cloud Services

title: bp bolsters its threat resilience with Microsoft Defender for Office 365
executive_summary: bp’s ethical phishing program required manual effort. Its third-party solutions were not fully integrated with the company’s security and operations systems, making it challenging to manage attack simulation data efficiently. The energy company partnered with Microsoft to implement attack simulation training in Microsoft Defender for Office 365, using the solution to streamline bp’s ethical phishing capabilities and reduce its testing and reporting. Now, bp can send two automated attack simulations per month to around 75,000 employees, with most of the effort managed by one security engineering specialist.
products: Microsoft Defender XDR

title: Bain & Company builds new intellectual property management platform using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Bain & Company (Bain) built an intellectual property management platform on Microsoft, streamlining information access and increasing employee satisfaction. The global consulting company’s legacy knowledge system could not keep up with modern demands, so Bain decided to migrate to the cloud. The Bain team also wanted to build a modular, API-based platform that could grow at business speed. Using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365, Bain developed Iris, a custom web user interface that combines search functions and content management and provides security controls that facilitate wider employee access. Now the company’s knowledge specialists and consultants can find information quickly and with high accuracy.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint

title: Michigan Office of Children’s Ombudsman streamlines case management and improves compliance using i-Sight on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The State of Michigan Office of Children’s Ombudsman helps protect and improve the lives of children by investigating complaints regarding Michigan’s child welfare system and by recommending changes to law, policy, and practice. It needed a better case management system to fulfil its mission to bring greater accountability to Michigan’s child welfare system. Adopting i-Sight case management on Microsoft Azure for US Government has improved efficiency, productivity, and security, empowering the agency to better manage cases from beginning to end.
customer: State of Michigan Office of Children’s Ombudsman (MiOCO)
products: Azure, Azure Cloud Services

title: Rabobank balances the books: Optimal privacy and safety with Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention
executive_summary: Agility and dedication to its customers have served Rabobank well throughout its more than 125-year history. The bank’s global workforce supports food and agricultural producers around the world. Its small but successful security team relies on the most effective tooling available to help secure the bank’s assets across 42,000 endpoints. Rabobank turned to Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention to curtail inappropriate data sharing, regardless of the location of its employees or data. Best of all, Rabobank curbs data loss without deploying agents, providing a better experience for employees and more time for IT teams to focus on high-value activities.
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Atea drives B2B innovation with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Atea wanted to provide a level of innovation rarely seen in B2B ecommerce. The top priority has been to transform the digital buying experience from broad-based engagement to fine-tuned communications with the right message and with the right cadence, in order to build loyalty and maximize retention. Atea is now able to bring together data from multiple sources like contacts, accounts, account registration, and orders to create a unified profile of each business user.
products: Azure Blob Storage, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Dataverse, Power BI

title: Keeping an eye on global production processes: Accuride unites on-premises and cloud services with Power Platform
executive_summary: Wherever wheels are turning, Accuride isn’t far away. From loaders to trucks, buses to sedans—the company supplies wheels and brake components to manufacturers of commercial and passenger vehicles all over the world. Accuride operates a global production network that has grown considerably over the years. After a series of mergers and acquisitions, Accuride standardized its approach to international teamwork by implementing the Microsoft Teams collaboration platform. And the company’s complex production processes are now coordinated using Microsoft Power Platform.
products: Azure Arc, Azure Stack HCI, SQL Server

title: L’Oréal gives hybrid work a makeover with Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Beauty is a global enterprise at L’Oréal. The cosmetics, fragrance, and haircare giant oversees 35 international brands and employs more than 85,000 people. Staying at the leading edge of beauty trends requires all of those individuals to share their unique perspectives and insights, across time zones and business areas. “We are defined by our culture of togetherness,” says Etienne Bertin, Chief Information Officer at L’Oréal. Maintaining that culture in the era of hybrid work requires tools that transcend boundaries. “In this new world, L’Oréal is focused on facilitating collaboration, communication, and co-creation among our employees, which is why we use Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams,” he says.
products: HoloLens, Microsoft 365, Planner, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms

title: Walmart Finance standardizes on Power BI for reporting and analytics
executive_summary: As the world’s leading retailer—supporting approximately 10,500 stores and clubs and 2.3 million associates worldwide — it’s no surprise Walmart has a vast amount of data to process. With trillions of transactions come challenges around data centralization, preparation, and consumption. The Walmart finance organization has chosen to standardize on Microsoft Power BI to create an agile, scalable, and cost-effective reporting and analytics solution.
products: Power BI

title: J.D. Irving, Limited sawmills adopt Microsoft HoloLens mixed reality to save time, support sustainability goals
executive_summary: The arrival of COVID-19 amplified the need to enable remote experts to collaborate with local maintenance technicians in the J.D. Irving, Limited (JDI) Sawmills Division. After reviewing successful Microsoft HoloLens deployments in other JDI business divisions, the Sawmills Division decided to add mixed reality to its Microsoft Teams environment with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist. The solution offers real-time communication and collaboration between the production floor and remote equipment provider specialists. Adopting HoloLens 2 devices has boosted business continuity and sustainability efforts at JDI by bringing expertise onsite and avoiding carbon-inefficient travel.
products: Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, Microsoft Teams

title: Huabao Group increases competitiveness across its enterprise with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: To efficiently support upstream and downstream business transactions in real time, Huabao Group needed to establish an integrated industrial chain management system that could enhance the competitiveness of its entire industrial chain. With the help of SAP on Azure, Huabao Group successfully realized the first full closed-loop operation of its headquarters and 21 subordinate enterprises, which is a solid step for the company to transform from informatization to digitization.
products: Azure Backup, Azure Bastion, SAP on Azure

title: Agilus and Credivera create a people-centric business by employing Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Agilus Work Solutions keeps its edge in the highly competitive recruiting world through its superb support for both clients and job seekers. It knew that the protracted professional credentials verification process was an obstacle to getting people on the job quickly. When Agilus partnered with Credivera to reinvent the process, the two companies turned to Microsoft Entra Verified ID to take the waiting out of a long onboarding process and put control over credentials back in the hands of job seekers. As a bonus, Agilus saves its clients and candidates weeks of delays, and everyone involved enjoys greater transparency.
products: Azure Functions, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Entra Verified ID

title: Onslow Virtual Schools - MSC - Equity defined by connection: Onslow Virtual Schools delivers online learning excellence with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Onslow Virtual Schools (OVSS) includes an elementary and secondary school that serves students in the area around Jacksonville, North Carolina. For various reasons, students may choose a fully virtual setting and have the option to fully enroll in a 100% remote learning environment powered by Microsoft Education. From their home or location, they log into established class times, with their device cameras typically on, and instruction is reimagined in a world of virtual learning. Microsoft 365 tools and Microsoft Teams enable OVSS educators and students create connection amongst each other—to keep up and get ahead. It is an investment that has already paid dividends and has become a model for providing opportunities for equity and 21st century education.
products: Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Windows 11

title: Amadeus embarks on a new wave of innovation with data mesh on Azure
executive_summary: Amadeus creates technology solutions that transform the way people travel. With more than 10 petabytes of data in its estate, the company has one of the largest data platforms in Europe. The organization wanted to unleash the true potential of its data while maintaining the highest possible security standards. Amadeus chose Microsoft to help it implement a data mesh architecture on Microsoft Azure. Supported by a clear data strategy and next-generation operating model, the solution will help Amadeus spur the development of innovative new personalized and on-demand travel experiences.
products: Azure

title: ABN AMRO: leaping into the future of the FSI sector with the Azure cloud
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO is determined to embrace digitalization to improve its operations and provide better services for its customers. To do this, it has embarked on a digital transformation program – called Apollo – which includes adopting new technologies, moving applications to the cloud and embracing a new DevOps working culture. Crucial to achieving this has also been migrating its trading and treasury front-to-back-to-risk platform Murex MX.3 from on-premises to Microsoft Azure. All while shifting from Oracle Exadata to Oracle database on Azure NetApp Files. This is part of a key initiative that’s giving ABN AMRO greater flexibility, scalability and an improved time to market. The migration is helping ABN AMRO provide more stable, securer services – all while driving efficiencies and improving its working culture.
products: Azure

title: Co-op cuts 2 years off its modernization plan with Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse
executive_summary: United Kingdom-based food retailer Co-op, a large consumer co-operative, transitioned in 2020 from its longtime on-premises datacenter to a virtualized data warehouse using Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse. Datometry Hyper-Q emulated Co-op's legacy data warehouse processes in the cloud, enabling Co-op's applications to interoperate with Azure Synapse. Co-op's modernization plan was expected to take more than three years, but Datometry and Azure Synapse shaved two years off the timeline. Co-op has already seen impressive benefits in processing speed and multimillion-pound cost savings.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: DavidShield kept teams conected and productive throughout the pandemic thanks to Office 365
executive_summary: DavidShield Group is a leader in the Travel Insurance industry and was able to keep teams connected and productive throughout the pandemic, securing information thanks to Office 365, including Teams and OneDrive, for better collaboration and cost control.
products: Microsoft Teams, Office 365, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Entra ID

executive_summary: Wherever wheels are turning, Accuride isn’t far away. From loaders to trucks, buses to sedans—the company supplies wheels and brake components to manufacturers of commercial and passenger vehicles all over the world. Accuride operates a global production network that has grown considerably over the years. And the company’s complex production processes are now coordinated using Microsoft Power Platform.

executive_summary: Beauty is a global enterprise at L’Oréal. The cosmetics, fragrance, and haircare giant oversees 35 international brands and employs more than 85,000 people. Staying at the leading edge of beauty trends requires all of those individuals to share their unique perspectives and insights, across time zones and business areas. “We are defined by our culture of togetherness,” says Etienne Bertin, Chief Information Officer at L’Oréal. Maintaining that culture in the era of hybrid work requires tools that transcend boundaries. “In this new world, L’Oréal is focused on facilitating collaboration, communication, and co-creation among our employees, which is why we use Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams,” he says.
products: HoloLens, Microsoft 365, Planner, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms

title: The Children’s Mercy Kansas City Research Institute enhances pediatric research collaboration and sample sharing using Microsoft technology
executive_summary: As a pediatric healthcare organization focused on a translational approach to research, the Children’s Mercy Kansas City Research Institute (CMRI) aimed to accelerate its research capabilities through cloud-based collaboration. Investigators studying high-risk pregnancies wanted to provide greater visibility to their perinatal sample collection. In response, CMRI developed the Perinatal Research Biorepository (PRB) Query Tool, offering researchers access to de-identified sample data. The PRB Query Tool uses Microsoft Power BI for data visualization and Microsoft Azure for cloud-based storage. The resulting solution improves research speed and accuracy by integrating data from more than 4,550 samples and more than 500 participants.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: Hilti future-proofs its IT environment using RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: As a premier supplier for the construction industry, Hilti has dedicated itself to making construction better. As the construction industry increasingly moves towards digitalization, the company recognized a great benefit in transforming its IT environment and moving its on-premises SAP landscape to the cloud, including its business-critical enterprise resource planning application. In less than a year, Hilti accelerated its continuous innovation roadmap for the future by migrating to RISE with SAP on Azure, reinforcing its product quality, innovative spirit, and direct customer relationships. By moving its SAP landscape to Microsoft Azure, Hilti enabled its IT team to move any remaining server infrastructure, including Linux and Windows workloads, to the Microsoft cloud and close down its on-premises datacenter, increasing resilience, minimizing downtime, and preparing for more rapid growth.
products: Azure, Azure Firewall, Azure Storage, SAP on Azure

title: Dynamics 365 gives SanMar a modern design
executive_summary: SanMar is the nation’s premier supplier of wholesale imprintable apparel, bags, and caps. The Seattle stalwart sells a wide variety of branded and private label categories, as well as blank garments and accessories, through its distributor customers to large corporations like Starbucks and the Seattle Seahawks, small businesses, and community-based events.
products: Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Microsoft Teams

title: GAC IT Team saves 1,000+ hours after global cloud migration
executive_summary: Shipping and logistics pioneer Gulf Agency Company (GAC) operates out of 300 offices around the globe. To keep up with the challenges of the 21st century it needed to build a more efficient work ecosystem. GAC’s Chief Information Officer Martin Wallgren and his team migrated the group’s on-premises data centers to the cloud and built an integrated data platform—Pegasus. By doing so, they created a platform that puts GAC in a position to offer better, quicker services to customers, which sets it apart from its competitors.
products: Azure, Azure Kubernetes Service, Power BI

title: Nordic Pet Care Group takes care of pets while Microsoft Defender for Business handles security
executive_summary: Regardless of an organization’s size, cybersecurity should be a prerequisite for success in today’s connected world, and Nordic Pet Care Group is a perfect example. The company is big enough to enjoy a strong market share in Northern Europe and continuing expansion, but at 220 employees, it’s too small to sustain a large IT team. It solved this quandary by engaging with multitalented infrastructure solution provider Atea Danmark and implementing Microsoft Defender for Business. The result: a reimagined security posture that provides enterprise-level protection at a small or medium-sized business price tag. With its Microsoft 365 productivity solutions, Azure, and Power Apps, Nordic Pet Care Group is ready to keep flourishing.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Microsoft Defender for Business, Microsoft Intune

title: DataPlatform with Microsoft Synapse and Databricks
executive_summary: Executive Summary
products: Azure Databricks, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Santeon: Harmonizing healthcare data for better, more transparent patient outcomes with the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Santeon is a learning system of seven hospitals with national coverage in The Netherlands and is the largest healthcare network in the country. The group’s ambitions to use data collectively to provide value-based healthcare (VBHC) was limited by different data governance systems in each hospital. The Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform was used to harmonize data and create the groundbreaking Health Intelligence Platform Santeon (HIPS). Data is now usable across the entire group, helping to empower patients and provide better health outcomes – providing a compelling example of how a large healthcare network can harmonize data on a national scale.
products: Intelligent Data Platform, Power BI

title: BÜCHI’s customer-centric vision accelerates innovation using Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: For the past 80 years, BÜCHI Labortechnik AG has put quality laboratory technology solutions into the hands of the world's top researchers, scientists, and manufacturers. Always innovating, BÜCHI is changing its business approach from the inside out in a digital transformation that connects customers in new ways, streamlines processes, and drives profits. A new strategy requires new tools, and the company is upgrading and replacing dozens of legacy business systems—a sweeping modernization effort that also means reevaluating hundreds of integration points across global information and communications technology (ICT) platforms.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Cost Management, Azure Event Grid, Azure Files, Azure Functions, Azure Integration Services, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Monitor, Azure Service Bus, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Network, Azure Key Vault

title: Dentsu builds Azure-supported analytics platform to modernize data across the organization
executive_summary: Dentsu is a marketing and advertising network dedicated to brand partnership that delivers meaningful progress and growth through unique and innovative media campaigns and bespoke data-driven solutions. The global organization spans more than 145 markets with 65,000 employees, serving 11,000 clients.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Intelligent Data Platform, Microsoft Entra ID, Excel, Power BI, Azure Data Lake Storage

title: Ridgelinez, internally practicing data-driven management, builds data utilization infrastructure by Azure and accelerates DX even further!
executive_summary: Established in 2020 as a comprehensive professional firm supporting corporate innovation, Ridgelinez built data utilization infrastructure and is accelerating internal DX practice. As the background for building the infrastructure, they have dealt with issues such as “generation of data silos” and “lack of interest accompanying obsolescence of data” when promoting an architecture fully implemented on cloud by utilizing SaaS and PaaS. How did Ridgelinez solve issues of data, which is essential for promoting DX? Here is the introduction of activities related to data-driven management at Ridgelinez and the role that Microsoft Azure has played there.
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Vodafone Fiji gains scale, reliability, and ease of innovation by migrating its payment platform to Azure
executive_summary: Vodafone Fiji customers send and receive money and make purchases and payments through its M-PAiSA payment platform. Hoping to gain greater scale, resilience, innovation, and compliance, and to shed maintenance efforts and costs related to its aging hardware, the company migrated its on-premises platform to Microsoft Azure. With help from partner Onsys Technologies, Vodafone Fiji’s platform is now architected with a host of Azure infrastructure services. These have helped position the company to work more efficiently, easily scale for peak demand, and more easily develop and implement new features for continuous improvement.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Backup, Azure Blueprints, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Load Balancer, Azure Monitor, Azure Virtual Machines, Windows Server

title: Engineered Advisory deploys Springworks Trivia for Microsoft Teams to boost team building and employee engagement
executive_summary: Engineered Tax Services is a professional services organization dedicated to helping businesses succeed in the accounting space and supporting clients’ financial goals by offering tax mitigation and wealth-building strategies. The company needed a fun team engagement app that was integrated with Microsoft Teams and would engage its fully remote team. Enter Springworks: a human resources technology company whose Trivia app for Teams helped Engineered Tax Services’ Cost Segregation team achieve a community engagement rate of 57 percent.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Changing end-user behavior at scale: New BrainStorm platform relies on Azure Functions
executive_summary: Technical Story
products: Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Functions, Azure Kubernetes Service, Microsoft Graph, SQL Server

title: Renewi deploys Elastic Observability on Microsoft Azure to optimize performance of business-critical applications
executive_summary: Renewi is a leading waste-to-product company that focuses on extracting value from waste rather than disposing of it. The company wanted to improve its operational efficiency, customer service, and environmental impact by using data and analytics more effectively. Renewi chose Elastic, a leading platform for search-powered solutions, to help it achieve its goals. Elastic’s solutions are supported and enhanced by Microsoft Azure, which provides a reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure for Elastic deployments. With Elastic on Azure, Renewi gained real-time insights into its waste streams, optimized its routes and processes, and reduced its carbon footprint.
products: Azure

title: Azure Virtual Desktop is the last piece of full cloud migration, Future of educational field by “Digitalization of School Affairs”
executive_summary: Located in the eastern part of Ehime Prefecture, Saijo City is surrounded by Ishizuchi Mountains to the south and Seto Inland Sea to the north. While the city is a sightseeing district rich in nature called “City of Waterways”, it has one of the largest areas in Shikoku as an agricultural city/industrial city. Utilizing ICT and promoting the creation of “Smart City Saijo” where everyone can connect and live a safe/secure and prosperous life, the city is actively utilizing ICT especially in the field of education. It has been working on the cloud migration of education/school affairs/learning systems from a very early stage for a local government, adopted Microsoft Azure (hereinafter, “Azure”), and realized an environment with three separated tiers which do not impair convenience. As the next step based on these efforts, Saijo City Board of Education will start migrating the VDI environment operated on premise to the cloud. What was selected under these circumstances was “Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD)”, a virtual desktop service provided on Azure.
products: Azure, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365 A3

title: Košík.cz gains agility to expand to new markets and deliver customer satisfaction with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With daily deliveries to about 6,000 customers, Košík.cz is one of the Czech Republic’s largest online food retailers. Operating at that scale requires serious IT support to ensure that deliveries are met and customers are happy. However, Košík.cz’s digital infrastructure was increasingly unable to meet its growing demand.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Teams, Office 365

title: Power Apps as a bridge to SAP: Automated digital customer orders for WENKO field service
executive_summary: Founded in 1959, WENKO-WENSELAAR GmbH & Co. title: Collaboration reaches new heights at United Airlines with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: United Airlines, the global airline based in Chicago, Illinois, has been connecting people for more than 90 years. But, even after decades in the industry, there is still room for a fresh challenge, like when the airline was asked to help coordinate a “civilian air activation” and help move Afghan refugees out of the Middle East and Germany. When Harel Magaritz, Managing Director of Network Operation Center, Daily Operation at United Airlines, remembers the event, he calls it “one of the more remarkable things we’ve ever done.” The story he shares is a testament to teamwork. “In August of 2021, United Airlines gathered 250 employees in Microsoft Teams to coordinate the civilian air activation,” he says. Over a period of nearly two months, employees from across United collaborated in Teams to arrange a total of 70 flights, all while continuing to run a worldwide airline. Ultimately, the effort helped assist some 10,000 refugees. “We had multiple Teams channels going 24 hours a day,” says Magaritz. “It was phenomenal, getting everyone together in real time to make sure no information was missed and support was constantly there.” Everything from providing coloring books for young passengers to sourcing Gatorade for dehydrated guests was discussed in Teams, along with the paperwork and logistics needed for such an operation. Without Teams, the undertaking would have been significantly more challenging, notes Magaritz. “If we didn’t have Teams, this mission would have involved hundreds of emails and phone calls,” he says. “Would we have completed the missions? Yes, but it would have been nowhere near the product and level of collaboration we delivered with Teams.”
products: Azure AI Bot Service, Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Graph, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms

For online consultations that take place on Microsoft Teams, ASC Technologies AG developed its Recording Insights digital solution. Where once only spot checks were possible, an artificial intelligence (AI) named the Compliance Policy Engine makes it possible to evaluate 100 percent of recordings, simplifying compliance with legal requirements. As an expert in compliance recording for highly regulated sectors, ASC relies on Azure Cognitive Services and integration into the Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services.

This results in poor outcomes, heightened costs and inefficiencies across healthcare and pharmaceuticals. Both industries have tried applying AI to resolve this, but due to privacy regulations, they are limited to collaborating on ad-hoc projects with de-identified datasets, which does not help find such missed patients and treat them at scale. With the help of Microsoft Azure, Pangaea Data built a scalable AI-powered product platform to discover such missed patients and connect to them. For instance, Pangaea Data worked with two global pharmaceuticals and the UK’s National Health Service (NHS) to find 6x more (200,000) undiagnosed and miscoded cachectic cancer patients for therapies and trials, which led to improved outcomes for patients, halving treatment costs for the NHS (saving £1 billion) and a six-fold increase in revenue for the pharmaceutical sponsors.

By blending cutting-edge academic research and practice, their Math Nation program is providing an equitable educational system. From 2020 to 2021, Microsoft provided over $1.5 million in grant money to help Math Nation expand the learning experience with the On-Ramp to 6th-grade tool and prepare secondary math teachers with accessible professional learning courses. Using Microsoft Azure, Math Nation is accelerating research and development in math education.

title: Generating insights on 1 billion shoppers globally using dunnhumby Customer Data Science
executive_summary: Processing more than 18 billion retail data records every week from 1 billion shoppers globally, dunnhumby embarked on a journey to modernise their operational infrastructure migrating their customer insights and data products to Microsoft Azure, to deliver reliable, secure, fast, efficient, and joined up technology. Azure offered the security and efficiency needed to give dunnhumby colleagues the freedom and time to focus on what’s really important – customer data insights.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: North Carolina Plant Sciences Initiative accelerates agricultural research with Azure and IoT
executive_summary: The data-driven North Carolina Plant Sciences Initiative (N.C. PSI), an agricultural research initiative based at North Carolina State University, is using faster and more efficient data management to tackle some of agriculture’s biggest challenges. Working with Microsoft Azure and SAS Analytics, the N.C. PSI has equipped its research teams to address global challenges such as climate change, rapid population growth, and emerging crop diseases and pests. The N.C. PSI draws on the expertise of professionals in fields outside of agriculture—from engineers and meteorologists to social scientists and economists—as it works to speed up agricultural innovations and breakthroughs that will have a positive social impact.

products: Azure, Azure Internet of Things, Microsoft Teams

With low-code development using Microsoft Power Platform, T-Mobile employees from all different backgrounds—computer science experts to coding novices—now develop solutions themselves that help the company with everything from device promotion approvals to store closure management in response to COVID-19. T-Mobile has a thriving internal Microsoft Power Platform community and is creating a T-Mobile Center of Excellence to promote further low-code development.

The company adopted the UberCloud Engineering Simulation Platform, based on Microsoft Azure, powered by Intel® Xeon® Scalable processors, and optimized for leading engineering applications. UberCloud and Microsoft collaborated with a blended FLSmidth team, bringing the company’s engineering teams the performance and collaboration gains they need for continuing success.

With the unique positioning of a “lifestyle artist,” the company has been the first to bring national art museums and art salons into communities, integrating art and everyday life, and promoting the development of culture and art in society, while at the same time opening up a new vision for its own development.

title: St. Luke’s University Health Network transforms patient care with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: Dutch Food producer, Aviko, creates a high-availability cloud setup to support 24-hour operations
executive_summary: As one of Europe’s leading producers of potato products, Aviko needs to maintain an efficient production line, from farm to factory to shipping around the world. To further optimize operations, Aviko implemented a new SAP Extended Warehouse Management (SAP EWM) system to remotely automate its cold storage warehouses. As a data-driven solution, the SAP EWM calculates the optimum way to store products and also communicates orders to over 30 automated robots, cutting the downtime between deliveries. This level of digital transformation required an entirely new IT infrastructure and a high-availability setup that could only be achieved by migrating to the cloud.

title: Leading Slovenian insurer, Zavarovalnica Triglav, shifts 2,200 staff to Microsoft 365 Enterprise Voice in Teams

To further enhance its customer experience, and simplify analytics, the company implemented Microsoft 365 Enterprise Voice in Teams. By integrating the solution with its public telephony system, the company enabled its staff to benefit from seamless calling, call forwarding, and a single authorization and access interface to facilitate user access anywhere.

The bank created a studio inside its headquarters and deployed Microsoft Teams Live Events so it could host a range of events from conferences to webinars. Millennium bcp managed to bring its customers, employees and other relevant stakeholders closer to the bank and has opened the doors to a whole new world of digital communication for the Portuguese financial sector.

The solution champions the use of digital whiteboards in a new, highly interactive way that allows both in-person and online students to get more involved and bring active contribution to classes. All while helping lecturers to elevate their teaching.

title: Arxus ensures that Resengo's reservation system is permanently available
executive_summary: Resengo is a Belgian digital company that develops online reservation systems. Primary target groups are restaurants, saunas & wellness centers, and sports & recreation facilities. In recent years, Resengo has experienced significant growth. The company now has over three thousand customers and records 1.3 million online restaurant reservations each month. Across all sectors, this amounts to nearly 3 million reservations every month. Behind the scenes, Resengo often needs to move quickly. This has proven to be a problem in the past. Resengo's ambition is to eventually switch entirely to Microsoft Azure. Arxus has taken responsibility for the entire infrastructure component. This ensures that Resengo does not need to invest in machines or in infrastructure knowledge. At the same time, Arxus offers guarantees of availability, performance, and security that would not be immediately feasible for Resengo under its own management. It works much better and more efficiently for Resengo to fill the need for scalability via Arxus.

To make this easier, Taylor Wimpey identified an overarching need to increase visibility throughout the customer journey – from marketing, through sales and on to customer service. To achieve this single ‘golden view’ of each customer, Taylor Wimpey chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 as its business platform. Today, the business is already benefitting from the improved information sharing and visibility. Most importantly, Taylor Wimpey teams are using the information to enhance the experience for customers.

In order to maintain and manage sustainable global growth, in 2019 the company realized that as part of their wider Digital Transformation, they needed to roll out a CRM solution globally across multiple divisions. Then Brexit happened. And then, Covid hit. Thankfully, Carbery Group had already explored possible CRM solutions before the pandemic, the only questions were: which one should they choose, and how could they successfully implement it without negatively impacting their business?

Yet in the logistics and construction sector, no high-quality purchasable address material exists. This is where HitHorizons came into play.

They’re full of vitamin C and very good for you.”

Thanks to its new Microsoft Azure-based system, enrolling children in kindergartens around the city is easier than ever, while budgeting and reporting are faster, simpler and more transparent.

title: AdventHealth prescribes Microsoft Edge and Microsoft Search to boost its organizational health

The IT Application Delivery Services team decided to consolidate around a single browser solution. With Microsoft Edge, the team recognized the advantage of clearing up the misalignment of multiple browser types and versions, speeding workflows, and of course, improving security. The result: there’s no longer a need for users to jump between multiple browsers to accommodate different sites and apps, and there’s no fear about app-to-browser incompatibilities hindering the user experience.
products: Microsoft Edge

title: Math Nation Accelerates Equitable Learning and Relevant Content with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: For 20 years, the Lastinger Center at the University of Florida has been leading educational innovations to improve teaching and learning for those who need it most. By blending cutting-edge academic research and practice, their Math Nation program is providing an equitable educational system. From 2020 to 2021, Microsoft provided over $1.5 million in grant money to help Math Nation expand the learning experience with the On-Ramp to 6th-grade tool and prepare secondary math teachers with accessible professional learning courses. Using Microsoft Azure, Math Nation is accelerating research and development in math education.

title: A code for all occasions: Automotive supplier Plock runs quality assurance for microparts measuring just two by two millimeters based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Automakers aren’t the only ones under considerable pressure to innovate. Companies all along the supply chain must also continuously optimize their processes and products if they want to remain competitive. Quality assurance can often present a challenge, especially when it comes to microparts produced by Tier 2 suppliers. When batch sizes stretch into the millions, generally only spot checks are made. This is why Plock, an SME that supplies the automotive industry, introduced a solution that allows each individual part to be digitally traced by attaching a miniature code that contains all the key quality information. This information is stored in Azure and can be called up and analyzed as needed.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Capita sets itself up for hybrid work with Azure Active Directory and Microsoft Endpoint Manager

Committed to a “New Ways of Working” strategy that prioritizes strong support for a mobile and remote workforce, it recently transformed its own IT infrastructure to provide workers with a modern hybrid workplace built on Microsoft Security solutions for identity, access, and device management. The new highly secure, available environment features Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), part of Microsoft Entra, for identity management, conditional access, multifactor authentication, and self-service password reset, along with Microsoft Endpoint Manager for device management. The result is both a productivity boost and an enhanced experience for Capita workers, simplified operation for administrators, and reduced overall IT costs for Capita.
products: Microsoft 365 E3, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Intune

title: Supporting sales internationalization through migration of the CRM system environment to the cloud

Swiss company Hawa is expanding its sliding door solutions business worldwide. To optimally support this growth, the company needed new IT solutions. By having all information accessible through a single tool, agents can engage more effectively with customers.
In ORBIS, Hawa found a partner who could optimally support its changeover project, in particular the migration to the cloud. Actively involving all those affected and working together to develop a solution helped to ensure that the project was a resounding success for both sides.

Six years ago, it began its digital transformation journey, migrating to Microsoft Azure and automating many of its operations. So, when the COVID-19 pandemic hit the whole travel industry hard, Sunweb Group moved fast to limit the impact it would have on its many customers. Using its cloud-based infrastructure to its advantage, within two months it created a self-service voucher system that enabled customers to redeem vouchers for cancelled holidays. This was just the start, with the company continuing to innovate as the pandemic unfolded. Before long Sunweb Group had introduced an automated rebooking system and offered a Cashback Guarantee to incentivise wary customers to continue to book holidays. It has not only boosted the company’s reputation; it has paved the way for a future of continuing cloud-based innovation – and enhanced customer experiences.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

From the beginning of data collection to the last migrated server, Planzer moved 200 servers to Azure in about seven months.

title: Johnson Controls takes a smart approach to building technologies with Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: In 1885, long before anyone talked about carbon footprints or climate change, Warren Johnson launched a company to explore new ways to harness and conserve precious energy resources. The new intranet, CarlsNet, has improved internal reach and engagement, becoming a useful tool to find news and resources at the desk or on the go. Delivered via the cloud, it eliminates all the drawbacks of on-premises applications that have traditionally existed in the manufacturing space. FactoryTalk Design Studio also supports new ways of working, bringing robust collaboration features and modern software development paradigms to the factory floor. Moving forward, the combination of Visual Studio Code, GitHub, and Azure is making developers at Rockwell Automation more efficient and agile, enabling them to get more done and deliver more quickly via an integrated platform and a smaller toolset.

The federated learning framework was built using Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and open-source technologies to help organizations analyze siloed data and build new applications without compromising data privacy.
